text: British oil giant Shell has announced that it will stop purchasing Russian oil and gas, with CEO Ben van Beurden apologising for buying a cargo of Russian crude oil after Ukraine invasion. "As an immediate first step, we will stop all spot purchases of Russian crude oil, shut service stations, aviation fuels and lubricants operations in Russia," Shell said.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Russia's rating cut for 2nd time in a week by Fitch
text: Russia's sovereign rating has been downgraded by six notches to the second lowest level of 'C' by Fitch Ratings, which said that a bond default is "imminent". "This rating action follows our downgrade...to 'B'/Rating Watch Negative on 2 March," it said. "Developments since then have...further undermined Russia's willingness to service government debt," the rating agency added amid sanctions.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: How will the new UPI work on feature phones and in offline mode?
text: To use RBI's UPI123Pay, users need to link their bank account with their feature phones and set up a UPI pin with a debit card. They can call an Interactive Voice Response number to transfer money. They can also use a missed call payment feature to send money to a merchant/shop or tap their phones on a sound-based payments device.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Better.com accidentally sent severance cheques a day before mass layoffs: Report
text: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com accidentally released severance payslips a day before mass layoffs were meant to be announced, TechCrunch reported citing employees. "No email, no call, nothing. This was handled disgustingly," an employee, who received a severance cheque, said. After the mistake, CFO Kevin Ryan sent an email to employees confirming the layoffs in US and India.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: We're sorry, we messed up: Flipkart on 'Get kitchen appliances' text on Women's Day
text: Flipkart has apologised after the e-commerce platform was criticised for sending a message promoting kitchen appliances on International Women's Day 2022. "Dear Customer, This Women's Day, let's celebrate You. Get Kitchen Appliances from ₹299," the message read. "We messed up and we're sorry. We did not intend to hurt anyone's sentiments," Flipkart wrote on its official Twitter account.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Better.com is laying off 3,000 India & US workers after firing 900 on a Zoom call
text: Mortgage lending startup Better.com, which had fired 900 employees on a Zoom call, has announced that it's reducing its workforce in India and the US in a significant manner over "the coming days". A company spokesperson told TechCrunch that the number is "just over 3,000". CFO Kevin Ryan said affected employees will be eligible for 60-80 days of severance pay.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: IndiGo, SpiceJet shares jump as ban on international flights lifted after 2 years
text: Shares of Indian airlines, including SpiceJet, IndiGo parent InterGlobe Aviation and Jet Airways, rose 5-8% each, a day after the government lifted the ban on regular international flights after two years. The Centre will resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27. Currently, international flights operate under air bubble arrangements with nations.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Size doesn't matter: Mahindra on China's defence budget being 3 times that of India
text: After China announced its 2022 defence budget of $230 billion, which is three times that of India's, businessman Anand Mahindra said, "Size doesn't matter. The future of warfare will be different." Ukraine's armed drones are playing havoc with convoys of tanks, he tweeted. "It's not how much we spend but how smartly we spend that will matter," Mahindra added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex jumps 1,100 points a day ahead of 5 state assembly election results
text: The Sensex jumped over 1,100 points during intraday trade on Wednesday ahead of the five state assembly election results tomorrow. While the Sensex was trading above 54,500 levels, the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 300 points to trade above 16,300 levels. Earlier, exit polls predicted that AAP may win in Punjab, while BJP will retain Uttar Pradesh.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: LIC gets SEBI nod for India's biggest-ever IPO: Reports
text: State-run Life Insurance Corporation of India has reportedly received market regulator SEBI's approval for an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO is expected to be the country's biggest-ever public issue. According to its draft papers filed on February 13, LIC will offload 31.62 crore shares. Earlier, reports said the government may defer the IPO to next fiscal amid Russia-Ukraine war.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I've done my best to lead NSE in a difficult period: CEO on not seeking 2nd term
text: National Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Vikram Limaye said that he won't apply for a second term as his first five-year term ends in July 2022. "I've done my best to lead the organisation in a very difficult period and to stabilise, strengthen and transform NSE," he added. Earlier, NSE published an advertisement calling for candidates for CEO role.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex ends 1,223 points higher at 54,647 ahead of assembly poll results
text: The Sensex ended 1,223 points or over 2% higher at 54,647 on Wednesday, a day ahead of five state assembly election results. The broader Nifty 50 also jumped 332 points or 2% to close at 16,345. The benchmark indices ended in the green for the second straight day. Reliance Industries, Asian Paints, Bajaj Finance were among top Sensex gainers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Universal Music suspends operations, closes offices in Russia
text: Universal Music Group has said it is suspending all operations in Russia and closing its offices, amid the growing protest from global firms against the violence in Ukraine. "We are adhering to international sanctions and...have been working with groups from a range of countries...to support humanitarian relief efforts," it said. It also urged for an end to violence in Ukraine.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Ukraine war may have limited impact on domestic credit market: Report
text: An India Ratings and Research (IRR) report said Russia-Ukraine war's impact on the domestic credit market may be limited as the banking system has adequate liquidity. The duration and intensity of the war will be the key determinant for the macro and micro risks. Entities with a weak financial profile may face financing challenges if the situation worsens, it added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government sees "clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency". She added that the digital rupee is a conscious call taken in consultation with RBI and that the government expects the digital currency to come out from RBI this year itself. "I see a possibility for revenue in [digital currency]," she said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Heartened to see US ban Russian oil imports, UK must follow: Branson
text: Billionaire Richard Branson praised the US ban on Russian oil imports saying, "Heartened to see...US...ban the import of Russian oil and natural gas." "This will have an impact on remaining revenue flows to Russia," he added. Branson said UK and EU must enforce a ban too as complete economic isolation is the "only way of forcing Russia out of Ukraine".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: To say that govt controlled oil prices due to polls is incorrect: Puri
text: Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said oil prices are determined by global prices and "to say that the government had controlled oil prices due to elections is not correct". "We'll take decisions in the best interest of our citizens," he added. This comes after global oil prices reached close to the $140/barrel mark on Monday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CNG prices hiked in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1, to cost ₹57.51/kg in Delhi
text: CNG prices have been increased in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1 per kg with effect from Tuesday. In Delhi, one kg CNG will now be costlier by 50 paise and cost ₹57.51 from earlier ₹57.01. The prices in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad have been hiked by ₹1 per kg and CNG in these cities will cost ₹59.58 per kg.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Ex-Goldman banker faked ex-wife's email account to lie to girlfriend
text: Former Goldman Sachs banker Tim Leissner has detailed how he used his ex-wife's email to lie to his former girlfriend, Kimora Lee Simmons. Leissner, a key witness against former Goldman banker Roger Ng in the 1MDB scandal, posed as Judy Chan to convince Simmons the two were no longer married. Leissner was questioned about the phoney account by Ng's lawyer.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Dish TV to move SAT against SEBI order to disclose its AGM voting results
text: Dish TV on Tuesday said it will move the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against SEBI's interim order directing Dish TV to disclose its annual general meeting's (AGM) voting results. SEBI had ordered Dish TV on Monday to disclose AGM results within 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and directed depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cabinet approves SPV for sale of surplus govt land and buildings
text: The Union Cabinet has approved setting up of the National Land Monetisation Corporation (NLMC), a special purpose vehicle (SPV) to handle the sale of surplus government land and buildings. NLMC's board will include senior central government officers and eminent experts. In addition to selling surplus land and buildings, NLMC will own and manage surplus assets of central PSUs under closure.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Norway wealth fund puts Adani Ports, 2 others on its watch list
text: Norway's sovereign wealth fund has put Adani Ports, Canada's Bombardier and South Korea's Hyundai Glovis on its watch list for possible exclusion from investment due to ethical concerns. It said Adani Ports has been put on the watch list for its possible contribution to "serious violations" of human rights because of its involvement in building a port terminal in Myanmar.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SAT declines to stay SEBI order directing Dish TV to disclose AGM results
text: Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) has declined to stay SEBI's order directing Dish TV to disclose voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM). SAT has also directed Dish TV to file its reply in the matter against SEBI's order by March 20.  SEBI passed the order after receiving complaints from Yes Bank and other Dish TV shareholders.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Liquor prices hiked by up to ₹80 at TASMAC shops by Tamil Nadu govt
text: Tamil Nadu has increased the price of liquor at Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation Limited (TASMAC) shops and the hike ranges from a minimum of ₹10 to ₹80. Now, a 180 ml bottle of rum and brandy will cost ₹130 as compared to its earlier price of ₹120. The price of beer per bottle has been increased by ₹10.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Best employers don't support bloodshed: Ukraine to Amazon Founder Bezos
text: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has written an open letter to Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos urging him to suspend provisions of Amazon Web Services in Russia amid war. "I believe that the best employers...would never support bloodshed and disinformation," Fedorov said. He also wrote that many Ukrainians are working for Amazon globally and they need the company's support today.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Russian oil ban will be catastrophic, prices could hit $300 a barrel: Deputy PM
text: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Alexander Novak has warned that a ban on Russian oil imports by Western countries "would lead to catastrophic consequences for the global market". "The surge in prices would be unpredictable. It would be $300 per barrel if not more," he added. On Monday, Brent crude price briefly hit $139/barrel for the first time since July 2008.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI launches UPI for feature phones; transactions won't require internet
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has launched a UPI-based payment product for feature phones called UPI123Pay. The product will allow customers to use feature phones for almost all transactions, except scan and pay, and it doesn't need internet connection for transactions. This will help NPCI reach its goal of processing a billion transactions a day, the RBI said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI launches 24/7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' for digital payment queries
text: The RBI has launched a 24x7 helpline for digital payments queries, DigiSaathi. The initiative will help customers address digital payments queries including cards, and the most relevant and appropriate information will be delivered as soon as possible. RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das also launched an instant payment system "UPI 123PAY" for feature phone users.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: I'm the healthiest person I know & I got breast cancer: Zerodha Co-founder's wife
text: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil has revealed in a blog that she was diagnosed with breast cancer in November 2021 despite being "the healthiest and fittest person" she knew. "The last few months...have been a blur and an emotional roller coaster. As cliché as it may sound, health really is wealth," Patil, who's Zerodha's whole-time director, wrote.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Better.com, that fired 900 staff on Zoom, plans laying off 4,000 this week: Report
text: Three months after Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 workers on a Zoom call, the US-based mortgage company is planning to lay off around 4,000 people this week, TechCrunch reported citing sources. That is about 50% of its staff of about 8,000. Following the December layoffs, Garg apologised, saying that he "blundered the execution" and took time off.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: We both went bald: Zerodha Co-founder's wife on their pic amid her chemotherapy
text: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil, who was recently diagnosed with breast cancer and is undergoing chemotherapy, said she decided not to go for a wig as cancer's already a "taboo". "It...didn't feel right...so, we both went bald at the same time. Nithin has agreed to remain bald until my hair grows back again," she wrote, sharing their picture.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Paytm's market cap falls below ₹50,000 cr as shares hit record low
text: The market capitalisation of Paytm's parent One97 Communications fell below ₹50,000 crore on Monday as the company's shares hit record low of ₹751. Paytm's market capitalisation stood at ₹48,785 crore as its shares ended 4.15% lower on the NSE on March 7. Paytm made its stock market debut in November 2021 and its shares have declined nearly 65% since then.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What is the co-location case for which ex-NSE CEO Chitra has been arrested?
text: The NSE co-location case refers to a series of events wherein some brokers received preferential access through the co-location facility, resulting in faster access to the markets. The matter came to light after a whistleblower wrote to SEBI in 2015. The NSE co-location facilities were launched in 2009 while Chitra Ramkrishna was appointed as the Joint MD the same year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Keep Saturdays free, address grievances of tax assessees: FM to CBDT, CBIC officials
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman rapped CBDT and CBIC for allegedly not responding to grievances of tax assessees and directed officials to reserve Saturdays to hold meetings with them. "Are you engaging with your own assessees?...Engage with them and give the clarification required," Sitharaman said. She was having a post-budget interaction with industry members and tax officers in Bengaluru.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra refused to identify former colleague Subramanian: CBI tells court
text: The CBI has been granted seven-day custody of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna in the co-location case after she was arrested on Sunday. The CBI had sought 14-day custody from the court arguing that Ramkrishna had been evasive in her replies and despite being confronted with her former colleague Anand Subramanian, a co-accused, she "refused to even identify him."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Assume tough times ahead, be prepared: Zoho CEO to staff amid Russia-Ukraine war
text: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu on Monday tweeted some advice that he had shared with this staff amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Vembu wrote, "The world faces many serious challenges…While our company is on a...healthy foundation...we have weathered two serious downturns in our 25-year history...Assume...tough times will be ahead and be prepared…We don't know what lies ahead. Expect turbulent times."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Indian investors lose ₹29 lakh cr wealth since February, more than Ukraine's GDP
text: Indian investors have lost ₹29 lakh crore of wealth since the beginning of February amid heightening geopolitical tensions between Russia and Ukraine and oil prices touching a 13-year high. The wealth lost by Indian investors is a lot more than Ukraine's GDP, which was estimated at $181 billion (nearly ₹15 lakh crore) in 2021, according to the Statista website.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: M&A in their early days: Harsh Goenka as he shares childhood pic of Ambani brothers
text: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka has shared a childhood photograph of Mukesh Ambani and Anil Ambani on Twitter and wrote, "Two brothers in their early days...M&A." The picture shows the two brothers dressed in formal suits with garlands around their necks. "Mukesh Ambani's looks are always constant," a Twitter user reacted to the picture.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Nickel price more than doubles in a day, briefly hits $100,000 a tonne
text: Nickel price jumped as much as 111% on Tuesday to briefly surge above a record $100,000/tonne on London Metal Exchange (LME), before paring some gains. LME halted trading in nickel as brokers faced trouble in paying margin calls following the largest-ever price move on the exchange. This comes amid a rise in risk of shortages from Russia, following Ukraine's invasion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Warren Buffett among world's 5 richest people again as fortune hits $117 billion
text: Berkshire Hathaway CEO Warren Buffett's net worth has grown by over 7% this year to around $117 billion as his company's shares rallied, Bloomberg reported. The 91-year-old is now back among the world's five richest people, after falling to as low as world's 11th richest person in October. World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth has dropped by 15% this year.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I'd sell & buy metal scrap: Vedanta's Anil Agarwal while sharing an old picture
text: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Monday tweeted an old picture of him while revealing some details about his earlier days. He wrote, "I rented an 8 ft by 9 ft office in Bhoiwada (metal market) in Kalvadevi where I'd work day-in, day-out." He added, "I would sell and buy metal scrap collected from cable companies, and Bihar, my hometown."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Credit Suisse cuts India's rating to 'underweight', cites rising crude prices
text: Credit Suisse has downgraded India's rating to 'underweight' from 'overweight' in the wake of rising crude oil prices, referring to the cut as "tactical". In Asia, India is the "most vulnerable to higher oil prices, along with the Philippines", the agency noted. The downgrade comes as crude oil prices briefly hit a 14-year high on Monday amid the Russia-Ukraine war.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Oil prices touch highest level since 2008, jump close to $140 mark
text: Oil prices continued to soar on Monday after reports said the US and European allies are planning to ban Russian oil imports over its invasion of Ukraine. In the first few minutes of trade on Monday, Brent crude hit $139.13/barrel while West Texas Intermediate hit $130.50/barrel, both at their highest since July 2008. Russia is the world's second-largest crude exporter.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Accounting firms EY, Deloitte sever links with Russia
text: EY and Deloitte on Monday said they will sever ties with Russia, following two other of the world's Big Four accounting firms KPMG and PwC. EY won't serve any Russian government clients, state-owned enterprises or sanctioned entities, individuals, the firm said. "We'll separate our practice in Russia, Belarus from the global network of member firms," said Deloitte CEO Punit Renjen.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Activision Blizzard sued for wrongful death of female employee
text: The parents of 32-year-old Activision Blizzard employee Kerri Moynihan are suing the company for her wrongful death. Moynihan was found dead in a hotel room at Disney's Grand Californian Hotel in 2017. Her parents alleged the "hostile, intimidating, offensive, and abusive" workplace she experienced was a "significant factor" that contributed to her suicide, The Washington Post reported.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sachin Bansal's Navi to file for ₹4,000-cr IPO this week: Report
text: Financial services company Navi Technologies is planning to file draft papers with SEBI for ₹4,000-crore initial public offer (IPO) this week, PTI reported. The issue is expected to open in June and will be a fresh issuance of equity shares with no offer-for-sale component. Flipkart Co-founder Sachin Bansal co-founded Navi with Ankit Agarwal after exiting the e-commerce startup in 2018.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 4 directors of TN-based firm's held for cheating people of ₹1,100 cr
text: Four directors of a Tamil Nadu-based firm were arrested by the ED for defrauding people of over ₹1,100 crore. Disc Assets Lead India Limited and Ors collected the money from public in 'Collective Investment Scheme', reportedly promising land or money with higher interest in return. The accused were identified as N Umashankar, N Arun, V Janarthanan and A Saravana Kumar.
author: Isha Chakravorty

headlines: SC directs 6 banks to release ₹1,200 cr for stalled Amrapali projects
text: The Supreme Court has ordered six banks to release ₹1,200 crore before March 14 to aid the National Buildings Constructions Corporation (NBCC) in completing Amrapali's stalled projects. Bank of Baroda, the consortium's lead bank, told SC that it has already infused its share of ₹300 crore. NBCC said it'll also be conducting an independent structural audit of Amrapali's under-construction projects.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Airlines urge govt to raise cap on domestic fares citing rising fuel prices
text: Airlines in India have urged the Civil Aviation Ministry to raise caps on domestic fares citing rising aviation turbine fuel (ATF)  prices. ATF, one of the biggest components of air fares, has risen 26.4% or ₹19,508.25/kl in Delhi since December 15. The Civil Aviation Ministry had temporarily set upper and lower airfare limits in the wake of the pandemic.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Disclose AGM voting results within 24 hours: SEBI to Dish TV
text: SEBI has ordered Dish TV to disclose the voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM), held on December 30, in the next 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and ordered depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors and compliance officer. Dish TV didn't disclose AGM voting results citing a pending case in the Bombay HC.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing info with 'yogi', arrested by CBI
text: NSE's former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', has been arrested by the CBI in connection to the NSE co-location case in Delhi. A Delhi court on Saturday rejected Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail application while calling CBI's conduct in the case "lackadaisical". Notably, the CBI has already arrested her former colleague Anand Subramanian.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Indian rupee hits its lowest level against the US dollar
text: The Indian rupee hit its lowest level against the US dollar as it opened at ₹76.96 on Monday compared to a close of ₹76.17 on Friday. The rupee's previous low was at ₹76.91 in April 2020. The sharp fall comes amid soaring oil prices following the Russia-Ukraine conflict and continued outflows of foreign portfolio money.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Western sanctions on Russia are akin to declaration of war: Putin
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Saturday that Western sanctions on Russia over the invasion of Ukraine, "are akin to a declaration of war", adding, "But thank God it has not come to that." Putin reiterated that he aims to defend Russian speaking communities in Ukraine through the "demilitarisation and de-Nazification" of the country so that it becomes neutral.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I'm grateful to Musk for supporting Ukraine in words and deeds: Zelenskyy
text: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took to Twitter to share details of the conversation he had with the world's richest man Elon Musk, and tweeted, "I am grateful to him for supporting Ukraine with words and deeds." He informed that next week, Ukraine will receive another batch of Starlink systems for destroyed cities. "Possible space projects were discussed," Zelenskyy added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Doesn't it smell of Ukrainian blood?: Ukraine as Shell buys Russian oil
text: After UK oil giant Shell purchased a cargo of Russian crude oil at a record low discount, Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba asked the company, "Doesn't Russian oil smell (of) Ukrainian blood for you?" Defending the purchase, Shell said it would choose alternatives to Russian oil wherever possible and will commit profits from the limited purchase to a dedicated fund.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: We're too big to be isolated: Russia on sanctions over Ukraine war
text: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov on Saturday termed western nations' sanctions on Russia "economic banditry", adding, "This does not mean Russia is isolated." He added, "The world is too big for Europe and America to isolate a country and even more so a country as big as Russia." He said that US' sanctions on Russia's energy exports would jolt energy markets.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Zelenskyy invites world's richest man Elon Musk to visit Ukraine; shares video
text: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on a video call with Elon Musk invited the world's richest man to visit Ukraine. "So, If you have time after the war, you are very welcome, I invite you," Zelenskyy told Musk. In a video clip shared by Zelenskyy on Instagram, Musk responded, "That sound's good, I look forward to visiting once things are..."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I find it difficult to meditate, I use NSDR to relax: Google CEO Sundar Pichai
text: Google and Alphabet's CEO Sundar Pichai in an interview with The Wall Street Journal spoke about how he relaxes, and said, "I found these podcasts which are non-sleep deep rest, or NSDRs." He said, "While I find it difficult to meditate, I can go to YouTube, find an NSDR video." He added, "They're available in 10, 20 or 30 minutes."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ratan Tata always keeps his promises: 28-yr-old assistant lists 2 of Tata's values
text: Shantanu Naidu, the 28-year-old assistant of Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata, in an interview revealed two values that he had observed in the latter. Naidu said, "He will just help so many people each day and then totally forget about it." He added that Ratan Tata always keeps his promises and "always delivers when he has given his word."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: CCI dismisses predatory pricing claims against e-commerce firm Shopee
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has dismissed allegations of predatory pricing levelled against the e-commerce platform Shopee. In its order, CCI said that Shopee did not hold a significant market power as it is a new entrant. The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) had claimed that Shopee sold various products at low prices and indulged in predatory pricing.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: McDonald's sued for $900 million by US startup over false advertising claims
text: US-based Kytch, which sells devices to fix broken ice cream machines, has sued McDonald's for $900 million alleging false advertising and tortious interference with its business. As per Kytch, McDonald's told its franchisees that the startup's devices violated their machines' warranties and could lead to "serious human injury". Kytch denied both the claims and accused McDonald's of defamation.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna sent to 7-day CBI custody in co-location scam
text: A Delhi court granted the CBI seven-day custodial interrogation of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna in the co-location case on Monday. The probe agency had sought 14-day custody of Ramkrishna, who is also accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi'. She was arrested by the CBI in Delhi on Sunday, a day after her anticipatory bail was denied.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Madhya Pradesh govt increases DA for state govt employees to 31%
text: Madhya Pradesh government has decided to increase the dearness allowance for state government employees to 31%, CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Saturday. The payment for the same will start from April 2022. He further announced that the state government will also give an additional ₹25,000 to girl students under the "Ladli Laxmi scheme" on taking admission in the college.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Russian billionaires' luxury yachts, villas worth $156 million seized by Italy
text: Italian authorities have seized luxury yachts and villas worth $156 million from sanctioned Russian billionaires since Friday. Italy has impounded yachts belonging to Russia's richest man, Alexei Mordashov and Gennady Timchenko, a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin. Further, reports said villas owned by billionaire Alisher Usmanov and state TV host Vladimir Soloviev were also seized.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Visa, Mastercard suspend all operations in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
text: US payments firms Visa and Mastercard have announced that they will suspend all operations in Russia over the invasion of Ukraine. Both the companies said that cards issued abroad will no longer work at Russian ATMs and cards issued by Russian banks will not be supported by their networks. "We don’t take this decision lightly," said Mastercard in its statement.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sensex plunges over 1,600 points, drops below 53,000 for 1st time in 7 months
text: Sensex plunged over 1,600 points to trade at over 52,600, while Nifty was down over 400 points at over 15,820 in the opening session on Monday as Russia-Ukraine war entered its 12th day. This is the first time in over seven months that Sensex dropped below 53,000. Tata Steel is the only gainer on Sensex today so far.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Clothing is a necessity, Russians have right to live: Uniqlo as it stays open in Russia
text: Fast Retailing, the parent company of Japanese clothing brand Uniqlo, on Monday defended its decision to keep the Russian stores open amid rival brands suspending operations in the country over the invasion of Ukraine. Tadashi Yanai, President of Fast Retailing, said, "Clothing is a necessity of life. The people of Russia have the same right to live as we do."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sensex ends nearly 1,500 points lower at 52,842, Nifty settles below 15,900
text: The Sensex plunged 1,491 points to close at 52,842 while the Nifty settled at 15,863 after falling 382 points on Monday amid weak global cues. The sharp fall comes as crude oil prices surged past the $130-per-barrel mark amid heightened tensions between Russia and Ukraine. Metal index gained over 2%, while auto, bank, FMCG, PSU bank and realty fell 2-5%.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Look for a job you'd choose if you had no need for money: Warren Buffett
text: Warren Buffett, the Chairman of Berkshire Hathaway and the world's sixth-richest man, has advised college students to seek employment in the field and with the kind of people they would choose if they had no need for money. In his recent shareholder letter, he added, "For when they find that sort of job, they will no longer be 'working'."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Russian banks to switch to China's UnionPay as Visa, Mastercard cut links
text: Sberbank, Russia's biggest lender, along with Alfa Bank and Tinkoff on Sunday said they would soon start issuing cards using the Chinese UnionPay card operator's system coupled with Russia's Mir network. This comes after Visa and MasterCard suspended their operations in Russia owing to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Payments company PayPal also suspended its operations in Russia on Saturday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Moody's cuts Russia's credit rating to 2nd-lowest on its scale
text: Moody's Investors Service on Sunday cut Russia's credit rating to Ca, the second-lowest rung of its ratings ladder. Moody's said its decision was "driven by severe concerns around Russia's willingness and ability to pay its debt obligations". "At the Ca rating level, the recovery expectations are at 35% to 65% (of face value)," Moody's said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Biggest advice I got from Elon on crypto is 'be cautious': Musk's brother
text: World's richest person Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk told Input Magazine the biggest advice he got from Elon regarding cryptocurrencies is "be cautious". Kimbal said he doesn't even know what the Tesla CEO's views are on cryptocurrencies. Kimbal earlier said Tesla was ignorant of the environmental impact of cryptocurrencies when it purchased Bitcoin and started accepting it for car purchases.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: MoS Rajeev Chandrasekhar to attend India Global Forum in Bengaluru
text: Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar will attend India Global Forum (IGF) which is being held in Bengaluru on Monday and Tuesday. It's being held in the city for the first time. "India is in midst of a major transformation of and expansion of its economy with PM Narendra Modi's Atmanirbhar Bharat economic roadmap," Chandrasekhar said.
author: Medhaa Gupta

headlines: Microsoft to set up its largest Indian data centre region in Hyderabad
text: Microsoft on Monday said it plans to establish its largest Indian data centre region in Hyderabad, with its first phase expected to become operational by 2025. Microsoft India President Anant Maheshwari said the company is making long-term investments and that it has doubled its existing three data centres' capacity. “We already serve more than 3,40,000 companies in India,” he said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: GST Council may raise lowest tax slab from 5% to 8%: Reports
text: The GST Council may, in its next meeting, raise the lowest tax slab from 5% to 8% and prune the GST exemption list to increase revenues, Moneycontrol reported. A state finance ministers' panel will submit its report by March-end to the Council. The panel may also recommend a three-tier GST structure, with rates at 8%, 18% and 28%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FPIs withdraw record ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4 amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. This is almost half of the amount FPIs withdrew in February 2022 at ₹35,506 crore, which was the highest amount withdrawn since March 2020. As per depositories data, they pulled out ₹14,721 crore from equities and ₹2,808 crore from the debt segment.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Psychologist said ex-NSE CEO Chitra was evasive during probe: CBI
text: During the hearing of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail application in connection with co-location case, the CBI said a senior forensic psychologist was roped in to extract facts from Ramkrishna. "The...psychologist...observed that [Ramkrishna] was evasive in her responses. She always attributed knowledge regarding matters to her lower functionaries," the CBI told the court.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Mother Dairy to hike milk prices by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR from tomorrow
text: Mother Dairy on Saturday announced that it will hike milk prices by ₹2 per litre for all milk variants in Delhi-NCR from March 6. The company cited a rise in fuel costs, costs of packing material and procurement prices as the reason for it. Apart from this, Amul and Parag Milk Foods had also increased milk prices recently.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Nag Ashwin seeks Mahindra's help to build futuristic vehicles for film, Mahindra replies
text: Director Nag Ashwin, who's shooting 'Project K' starring Prabhas, Amitabh Bachchan and Deepika Padukone,  sought Anand Mahindra's support in building futuristic vehicles for the movie. "How could we refuse an opportunity to help you envision the future of mobility?" Mahindra responded. "Chief of Global Product Development @Velu_Mahindra will...happily throw his weight behind you," he added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Hundreds book Airbnbs in Ukraine to send money to citizens amid war
text: Hundreds of people are booking Airbnb rentals in Ukraine to offer monetary assistance to local families affected by war. This came after US-based influencer Tommy Marcus proposed the idea of paying for Ukrainian Airbnbs to financially support their hosts. Marcus shared some replies from Ukrainian hosts, one of which said, "Hope we'll win and stop this horror."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Putin's war has always been a war against his own people: Branson
text: Billionaire Richard Branson while expressing his thoughts on the Russian-Ukrainian war said Russian President Vladimir Putin's war has "always also been a war against his own people". He said Putin has created "a system of control, intimidation, oppression, and disinformation". He added Russians had their dignity "stripped away slowly but continuously" as Russia "slipped into totalitarianism".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Singapore sanctions 4 Russian banks; bans military goods, computers export
text: Singapore announced sanctions against Russia over its "unprovoked attack" on Ukraine, becoming one of the few Southeast Asian nations to do so. It includes a ban on dealing with four Russian banks and an export ban on electronics, computers and military items. The sanctions "aim to constrain Russia's capacity to conduct war" and engage in "cyber aggression", Foreign Ministry said.
author: Athira Sasidharan

headlines: Russian economy headed for deep recession, may face 1998-like crisis: JPMorgan
text: JPMorgan & Chase's economists said the Russian economy "now looks headed for a deep recession" following sanctions by Western countries. They expect Russia's GDP to contract 7% this year as compared to a 5.3% contraction in the 1998 debt crisis. A peak-to trough decline in Russian GDP is now expected "at around 12%, comparable to 1998 (~10%) crisis", economists added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: We're not obsessed with wealth, it's boring: World's richest man Musk's brother
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk said in an interview that he and his brother aren't obsessed with wealth. "I do know other people...are obsessed with wealth...And that's not me...it's not my brother. It's boring," he added. Kimbal claimed Musk has "paid more taxes than any human on the planet in the history of America".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Apple's corporate staff to start returning to offices from April 11
text: Apple's corporate employees will start returning to offices from April 11, the company's CEO Tim Cook told employees in an email. Employees will be required to work from office at least one day per week by that date, Cook said. He added that employees will need to be in the office at least three days a week from May 23.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Microsoft suspends sales of products & services in Russia
text:
Microsoft on Friday announced that it was suspending new sales of its products and services in Russia amid its ongoing invasion of Ukraine. Microsoft added that it will proactively work to help 
cybersecurity officials in Ukraine defend against Russian attacks. "We stand with Ukraine in calling for the restoration of peace, respect for Ukraine’s sovereignty," the company added.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Need to increase oil, gas output to make up for Russian exports: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to discuss the need to increase oil and gas output, saying, "Hate to say it, but we need to increase oil & gas output immediately." He acknowledged the move would "negatively affect Tesla", however, he further said, "Sustainable energy solutions simply cannot react instantaneously to make up for Russian oil & gas exports."
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: BharatPe removes Ashneer Grover's profile from its website days after his exit
text: After the company removed Ashneer Grover as the founder of BharatPe, his profile and photo have also been removed from its website. In a statement, the company had accused Grover and his wife Madhuri Jain of misappropriating company funds to fund their lavish lifestyle. The 'About Us' page now features Co-Founder Shashvat Nakrani, CEO Suhail Sameer, Nishit Sharma, among others.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: What are the major announcements made for B'luru in state Budget 2022-23?
text: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced that ₹8,409 crore has been allocated for Bengaluru's development, including 1,000 crore for the Mekedatu project. He said that a skywalk will be constructed at Banashankari junction to connect the metro station with the bus stand. A mega jewellery park, 'Green Expo' and 'Namma Clinics' will be established in Bengaluru.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: CBI lackadaisical, SEBI too kind: Court as it rejects Ramkrishna's pre-arrest bail
text: Rejecting ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna's anticipatory bail in the co-location case, a Delhi court called CBI's conduct "lackadaisical". It said, "The conduct of...CBI is most lackadaisical...no action seems to have been taken against the main beneficiaries of the...co-location scam...for almost four full years...Even SEBI, despite being the...markets watchdog, has been too kind and gentle."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: China announces $230 billion defence budget, 3 times that of India's
text: China has reserved $229.47 billion in the national budget this year to enhance military training and combat readiness for the People's Liberation Army. This is over three times that of India's ₹5.25 lakh crore ($70 billion) defence spending announced for 2022. China's defence budget has been increased by 7.1% as compared to last year.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: CBI court refuses anticipatory bail to ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna
text: A special CBI court has dismissed the anticipatory bail of former NSE chief executive Chitra Ramkrishna in connection with the NSE co-location case. Accused of sharing information with a 'Himalayan yogi', the court said that no grounds were made out to grant anticipatory bail to Ramkrishna. It is reported that the CBI argued against granting protection to her.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Russia's 4th richest person's ₹543 crore superyacht seized by Italy
text: Italian authorities have detained the superyacht of Russian billionaire Alexey Mordashov, who was recently sanctioned by European Union, in the coastal city of Imperia. The 56-year-old Chairman of Russian steel industry firm Severstal is Russia's fourth richest person with a $20.1 billion fortune, as per Bloomberg. His 215-foot yacht named 'Lady M' is worth €65 million (₹543 crore).
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Satyagraha will prove an unconquerable force: Mahindra on protests in Ukraine
text: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday tweeted a video of unarmed Ukrainians protesting against Russian troops in Kherson. Mahindra wrote, "When an army has to face unarmed civilians, they’re facing a weapon more powerful than tanks. Satyagraha will always prove an unconquerable force…Ask the British." In the clip, shots were also fired to disperse the crowd.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: China sets lowest GDP growth target in over 30 years at 5.5%
text: World's second largest economy China has set a GDP growth target of around 5.5% this year, the slowest pace in more than three decades. Chinese Premier Li Keqiang said in his government work report, "Our country will encounter many more risks and challenges." The country will spend 7.1% more on defence this year, outpacing the government's economic growth forecast.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Wait for official announcement: Maker of 'Mriya' reacts to video of its damage
text: Days after the world's largest aircraft 'Mriya' was destroyed by the Russian forces in Ukraine, its manufacturer, Antonov, responded to a viral video allegedly showing the damage sustained by 'Mriya'. It wrote, "Until the AN-225 has been inspected by experts, we cannot report on the technical condition of the aircraft. Please wait for the official announcements about its condition."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Fashion brands H&M, Zara & Mango shut outlets in Russia over invasion of Ukraine
text: Zara owner, Inditex has announced that it will close its shops in Russia and also halt online sales over the country’s invasion of Ukraine. Inditex has 502 stores in Russia, of which 86 are Zara outlets. This comes after fashion retailers Mango and H&M also closed their respective shops in Russia owing to the same reason.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Russia-backed media outlet RT America shuts down, fires most of its staff
text: Russia-backed media outlet RT America is shutting down operations and laying off most of its employees, CNN reported. T&R Productions, the production company behind RT America, attributed the decision to "cease production" to "unforeseen business interruption events" in a memo to its staff. Earlier, satellite operator DirecTV stopped carrying RT America in response to Russian invasion of Ukraine.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Who is Sanjiv Kapoor, the new CEO of Jet Airways?
text: Sanjiv Kapoor, who reportedly resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels this week, will join Jet Airways as its new CEO on April 4. Kapoor, a Wharton School MBA graduate, started his airline career with Northwest Airlines in the US in 1997. He was SpiceJet's COO between 2013 and 2015 and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer between 2016 and 2019.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sanctioned Russian billionaire barred from his European firm's offices
text: Mikhail Fridman, Russian Co-founder of Luxembourg-based investment group LetterOne, has been barred from entering the company's office buildings or speaking to its employees after the European Union (EU) imposed sanctions on him. LetterOne also said that billionaire Fridman and Russian banker Petr Aven have stepped down from the company's board and their assets in the business have been frozen.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Renault shares fall to lowest since Nov 2020 amid Russia-Ukraine war
text: The price of shares of French automaker Renault has fallen since last week to trade at their lowest since November 2020, amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine war. It has reportedly lost around a quarter of its market value after the Russian invasion and growing sanctions. Renault, which owns a majority stake in Russian automaker Avtovaz, is monitoring the situation in Ukraine.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Atal Bihari Vajpayee park to be built on 350-acre land in B'luru: Bommai
text: Presenting the 2022-23 state Budget, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai announced to set up an Atal Bihari Vajpayee park on a 350 acre land in the Jarakabande area of Bengaluru's Yelahanka to increase the city's green cover. The proposed park will be based on the model of Bengaluru's Lalbagh and Cubbon Park. Notably, Bommai has allocated ₹8,409 crore for Bengaluru's development.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: K'taka CM allocates ₹1,000 crore to implement Mekedatu project
text: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai, while presenting the state Budget for 2022-23 today, announced that ₹1,000 crore has been allocated for the implementation of the Mekedatu project. He said the Mekedatu Balancing Reservoir and Bengaluru Drinking Water Project will be implemented by getting a nod from the centre. This comes after the Congress concluded its Mekedatu padayatra on Thursday in Bengaluru.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: NSE invites applications for the role of CEO, seeks IPO experience
text: The National Stock Exchange (NSE) of India is inviting applications from candidates for the role of Managing Director and CEO. The exchange is seeking candidates having IPO (initial public offering) experience and a track record of strengthening corporate governance. The NSE's current Managing Director and CEO Vikram Limaye's five-year tenure is set to end in July 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: UK freezes assets of Russian billionaire & ex-deputy PM, imposes travel ban on them
text: The UK government has announced new immediate sanctions on two Russian oligarchs, which include a full asset freeze and travel bans. The two oligarchs are Arsenal FC's former billionaire shareholder Alisher Usmanov and Russia's former deputy PM Igor Shuvalov. "Putin associates [are] now cut off from their significant UK interests including mansions worth tens of millions," the government said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I found him shrewd, charismatic: Harsh Goenka on meeting Vladimir Putin years ago
text: Amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Harsh Goenka, the Chairman of RPG Enterprises, took to Twitter to recall that he met Russian President Vladimir Putin several years ago. "I found him shrewd, calm, charismatic and nationalistic. They say that the face becomes the mirror of the mind," he wrote. His tweet included an artwork showing Putin with fangs, surrounded by houseflies.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia blocks access to BBC's website, Facebook, Google Play: Report
text: The BBC's website appeared to be blocked in Russia as reports said there were problems accessing the website, hours after it brought back shortwave radio technology to cover the Russia-Ukraine war. BBC Russia's Twitter account claimed that Facebook parent Meta, Google Play Store and German public broadcaster Deutsche Welle also appeared to be blocked in Russia.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US imposes full blocking sanctions against Putin's spokesperson, 7 Russian elites
text: The US announced new full blocking sanctions against seven Russian elites and President Vladimir Putin's spokesperson Dmitry Peskov, calling him a "top purveyor of Putin's propaganda". It also imposed visa restrictions on 19 oligarchs and their families. One of Russia's richest men Alisher Usmanov's property has been blocked from use in US, including his superyacht, which Germany seized recently.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Oil soars to highest since 2008, hits $116/barrel as Russia invades Ukraine
text: Oil prices soared to $116 a barrel on Thursday, the highest level since 2008, as buyers continued to reject Russian crude following its invasion of Ukraine. The invasion has sparked supply concerns across commodity markets from energy to grains. Meanwhile, the OPEC+ has stuck with the 4,00,000 barrel-a-day production increase that was scheduled for April.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ford names its EV unit 'Model e', the name it stopped Elon Musk from using
text: Ford has split its business into two separate entities, one focused on electric vehicles and the other on gas-powered ones. Ford named its electric vehicle unit 'Ford Model e' and the gasoline division 'Ford Blue'. Nearly a decade ago, Ford had stopped Elon Musk's Tesla from naming its car 'Model E' and Tesla eventually named its car 'Model 3'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Chinese company Huawei accused of tax evasion in India: Report
text: A tax investigation on China's Huawei Technologies allegedly found that the telecoms equipment maker manipulated account books to reduce its taxable income in India, Reuters reported citing a government source. On Thursday, the Finance Ministry said that a "major telecom group" did not account for income of ₹400 crore in its books and couldn't justify expenses of ₹480 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Twitter to reopen all offices from March 15, staff can pick work from home 'forever'
text: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal announced that Twitter will reopen all its offices around the world from March 15 after nearly two years. However, he added that employees can work wherever they feel the most "productive and creative" and that includes "working from home full-time forever". They can also choose to work some days in office and some days at home.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ex-Nissan exec found guilty of helping ex-CEO hiding compensation
text: Former Nissan executive Greg Kelly has been given a six-month suspended sentence for helping former CEO Carlos Ghosn hide his compensation from regulators, in Tokyo. A judge suspended Kelly's sentence for three years in his ruling on Thursday, ending months of trial proceedings. The two executives were arrested in Tokyo in November 2018 and charged with various financial misconduct offences.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Amazon, Future Group agree to hold talks to settle 18-month long legal dispute
text: During a Supreme Court hearing on Thursday, Amazon and Kishore Biyani-led Future Group agreed to initiate talks for an out-of-court settlement of the 18-month long legal dispute between the two. "No one is winning. FRL, Reliance and Amazon all have issues," Future Group's counsel Harish Salve said. The court granted them 10 days to explore settlement.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon gods will have to come down to talk to us mortals: Future Retail in SC
text: Amazon's counsel on Thursday in the Supreme Court proposed talks with Future Retail and Reliance to end months-long legal battles between the companies. After Amazon's proposal, advocate Harish Salve, representing Future Retail said, "Amazon gods will have to come down to talk to us mortals." He asked, "What is preventing Amazon's boss from calling up Biyanis (Future Group's Kishore Biyani)?"
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mukesh Ambani's $89.9 bn fortune nearly equals Russia's 4 richest men combined
text: India's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani currently has a net worth of $89.9 billion, which is nearly equal to that of Russia's four richest billionaires combined. Russia's richest man Vladimir Potanin has a net worth of $25.2 billion, as per Bloomberg, while Severstal's ex-CEO Alexey Mordashov and Novatek Founder Leonid Mikhelson's fortunes stand at $22 billion each.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: UK's richest woman Denise Coates earns $400 million in a year from her betting company
text: Denise Coates, the 54-year-old Founder and CEO of Bet365, received £300 million ($400 million) in pay and dividends in a year despite a salary cut, according to a filing by the online bookmaker. The UK's richest woman has earned more than $1.8 billion over the past decade, according to Bloomberg. Her salary makes her one of the world's best-compensated bosses.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Aviation veteran Sanjiv Kapoor appointed Jet Airways CEO
text: The Kalrock Capital and Murari Lal Jalan consortium, Jet Airways' new promoters, has appointed Sanjiv Kapoor as CEO of the airline. Kapoor, who was previously SpiceJet's Chief Operating Officer and Vistara's Chief Strategy and Commercial Officer, resigned as President of Oberoi Hotels on Thursday. "By having Sanjiv as CEO...I'm certain Jet Airways will reclaim its lost glory," Jalan said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex crashes 1,050 points, Nifty below 16,200 amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
text: The Sensex tanked more than 1,050 points on Friday amid weak global cues due to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. The Sensex was trading below 54,100 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 also fell around 320 points to trade below 16,200. Banks and auto stocks, Maruti Suzuki and Axis Bank, were among worst-hit during intraday trade.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I had no idea there was such a shortfall of medical colleges in India: Mahindra
text: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Thursday tweeted, "I had no idea that there was such a shortfall  of medical colleges in India." The billionaire tweeted this in response to a graphic that listed the top destinations for Indian medical students and the number of students who are there. It stated that 23,000 Indian medical students are in China alone.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: How can Indian investors trade in US stocks like Tesla through NSE IFSC?
text: Indian retail investors will be able to trade in eight US stocks, including Tesla, through NSE IFSC platform from today. The platform's market makers will buy shares in US and issue receipts against them to investors. The receipts, issued at low costs, will represent a fraction of the value of shares. Trading in receipts will take place in US dollars.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ikea suspends Russia, Belarus operations; 15,000 staff to be affected
text: Ikea on Thursday said it would suspend its operations in Russia and Belarus in response to the Russia-Ukraine war. The shutdown of operations will affect 15,000 employees, 17 stores and three production sites. "The war has had a huge human impact already. It is also resulting in serious disruptions to supply chain and trading conditions," the company said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Oracle suspends operations in Russia, SAP pauses sales
text: Oracle said it has suspended all operations in Russia, while SAP announced it will pause all sales, after Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov wrote letters to them requesting to end services to Russia. In response to Fedorov's request, Oracle said it had "already suspended all operations". SAP called sanctions against Russia "an important mechanism" in efforts to restore peace.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank freezes Russia lending
text: China-led Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) on Thursday said it has put all activities relating to Russia and Belarus on hold and under review owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. China, despite being the Bank's largest shareholder and holding 26.5% of AIIB's voting power, has opposed sanctions imposed on Russia by governments of various countries.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: YouTube's creators contributed ₹6,800 cr to Indian GDP in 2020: Report
text: Google-owned YouTube on Thursday said its creator ecosystem in India contributed ₹6,800 crore to India's GDP and supported an equivalent of 6,83,900 full-time jobs in the country in 2020. YouTube cited an Oxford Economics report while sharing the company's economic impact in India. "Impact [of our creators, artists] on the economy's overall success will only continue to accelerate," YouTube said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Palihapitiya accused of insider sale of Virgin Galactic shares worth $315 mn
text: Former Virgin Galactic Chairman Chamath Palihapitiya has been accused of selling 10 million of firm's shares for $315 million by leveraging his position before quitting. The lawsuit also alleges Founder Richard Branson nabbed $301 million by selling shares while stock price was "artificially inflated". The suit was filed on behalf of Virgin Galactic to seek damages from directors and officers.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: 12th edition of Bengaluru India Nano to be held from March 7-9
text: The 12th edition of the three-day-long Bengaluru India Nano event with 'Nanotech for Sustainable Future' as its central theme will be held from March 7-9, said Karnataka Minister Dr Ashwathnarayan CN. Over 10 countries and 2,500 registered delegates will be participating in the summit which will have over 40 companies showcasing its nanotech products, services, and innovation and poster sessions.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: IPO-bound LIC appoints insurance veteran Sunil Agrawal as CFO: Reports
text: LIC has appointed former Reliance Nippon Life Insurance CFO Sunil Agrawal as the IPO-bound insurer's CFO, Bloomberg reported. Agrawal served as Nippon's CFO for 12 years till 2018. Prior to that, he worked for ICICI Prudential Life Insurance for five years. He replaced LIC Executive Director Shubhangi Soman and is the first outsider to be appointed to the position.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Reliance to invest ₹1,670 cr in Sanmina to make electronics in India
text: Reliance Industries will be investing ₹1,670 crore in a joint venture with US-listed Sanmina for making electronic products in India. Reliance will hold a 50.1% stake in the JV after the investment in Sanmina's existing Indian entity. The new entity will serve both domestic and export markets. It aims to make hardware for 5G communications, among other things.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Vodafone Idea to raise ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to promoters
text: Vodafone Idea (Vi) on Thursday said its board has approved raising ₹4,500 crore by issuing shares to its promoters on preferential basis. The firm will issue up to 3.39 billion shares at ₹13.30 a share, 20% premium to its current market price, to Vodafone Group's Euro Pacific Securities and Prime Metals and Aditya Birla Group's (ABG) Oriana Investments.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Eveready's Chairman & MD resign post open offer from Burman family
text: Eveready's Non-Executive Chairman Aditya Khaitan and Managing Director Amritanshu Khaitan resigned from their positions following an open offer from Dabur Group's Burman family to buy an additional 26% stake in Eveready. The company said the two have stepped down "to enable [Eveready] to benefit from new leadership and direction". Joint MD Suvamoy Saha will assume charge as Eveready's interim MD.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Apollo 24|7 launches 'One Tap' consultations starting at just ₹250
text: Apollo announced 'One Tap' consultations with their expert doctors using Apollo 24|7 app, starting at just ₹250. "Users will benefit from these consultations, especially in cases of minor ailments, and no-one will have to take medicines without proper medical supervision," Apollo said, calling this a big step towards better healthcare in India. Users can download Apollo 24|7 app for free.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Ashneer no longer a founder, his family engaged in misappropriation of funds: BharatPe
text: A day after BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover resigned as MD, BharatPe said in a statement on Wednesday that he is "no longer an employee, a founder, or a director of the company". BharatPe also alleged that Ashneer's "family and their relatives engaged in extensive misappropriation of company funds" and board reserves the right to take further legal action against him.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia's largest lender Sberbank to exit Europe, cites abnormal cash outflows
text: Russia's largest lender Sberbank is leaving almost all European markets after coming under pressure of Western sanctions that were imposed following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "The group's subsidiary banks have faced abnormal cash outflows and threats to the safety of its employees and branches," it said. Earlier, the European Central Bank (ECB) ordered the closure of Sberbank's European arm.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: EU cuts 7 Russian banks from global payment system SWIFT, bans RT & Sputnik
text: The European Union has said that it is cutting seven Russian banks, including the country's second-biggest lender VTB Bank, from the main international payment system SWIFT. The list doesn't include Russia's largest lender Sberbank and Gazprombank, which handle payments for Russian oil. The EU also banned Russian state-run media outlets RT and Sputnik over disinformation on Ukraine's invasion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia's rating cut to 'junk' by Fitch & Moody's amid sanctions
text: Global rating agencies Fitch and Moody's have each cut Russia's sovereign credit rating by six notches to "junk" status after the country's invasion of Ukraine. Western sanctions imposed on Russia could undermine its capability and willingness to service debt, they said. Meanwhile, index providers FTSE Russell and MSCI announced that they will remove Russian equities from all their indexes.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US oil giant Exxon to exit its last Russian project, won't make new investments
text: American oil giant ExxonMobil will exit its last remaining oil and gas project in Russia and won't invest in new developments in Russia, following Ukraine's invasion. Exxon operates the Sakhalin-1 project on behalf of a consortium that includes Japanese, Indian and Russian companies. Exxon would end over a quarter-century of continuing business presence in Russia by quitting this project.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which major US & European companies have taken action against Russia?
text: British oil companies BP and Shell announced their exit from Russia following its invasion of Ukraine. Europe's Airbus and America's ExxonMobil and Boeing, have cut ties with Russia, while Harley-Davidson and General Motors suspended vehicle exports to Russia. Apple and Dell halted all product sales in Russia, and Apple said, "We are deeply concerned about the Russian invasion of Ukraine."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Biden praises only Ford & GM in State of the Union speech; Tesla CEO Musk reacts
text: World's richest person Elon Musk tweeted to US President Joe Biden after he praised GM and Ford for investing billions on electric vehicles and didn't include Tesla in State of the Union address. "Tesla...created over 50,000 US jobs building EVs & is investing more than double GM + Ford combined. [FYI to person controlling this Twitter]," the Tesla CEO said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India needs to be economically strong to not be lectured on freedom: Zoho CEO
text: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu in a tweet discussing India being "lectured" on democracy, freedom and the global order by others, said, "The only way for India not to get lectured is to be technologically self-reliant and economically strong." He added that sustained efforts will take India 10-20 years to achieve technological parity. "There are no shortcuts," Vembu said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Amazon may file criminal case over Future's transfer of stores to Reliance: Report
text: Amazon is reportedly planning to initiate criminal court proceedings against Future Retail for allowing the transfer of assets to Reliance Industries. Earlier, Reuters reported that Mukesh Ambani-led RIL had started taking over 500 of Future's stores. The development came amid Future's ongoing legal battle with Amazon over its ₹24,713-crore sale of retail assets to RIL.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Grover family used company's money to fund their lavish lifestyles: BharatPe
text: BharatPe on Wednesday alleged that Ashneer Grover and family "grossly abused" company expense accounts to "enrich themselves and fund their lavish lifestyles". The Grover family created "fake vendors through which they siphoned money away from the company's account", it said in a statement. BharatPe removed Ashneer as a founder, a day after he resigned as MD and director.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ashneer's wife says 'time to move on', deletes tweets & videos against BharatPe
text: Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain, who was recently fired by BharatPe, deleted tweets and videos criticising the activities of the company's top officials. "We stand by each of our statements but it's time for us to move ahead towards positivity and away from...endless media drama," she said. She also deleted an alleged audio clip of BharatPe's Bhavik Koladiya abusing Ashneer.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Won't allow deplorable conduct of Grover family to tarnish our reputation: BharatPe
text: While removing Ashneer Grover as an employee, founder and director, BharatPe said in a statement, "The board will not allow the deplorable conduct of the Grover family to tarnish BharatPe's reputation." The company alleged that his family engaged in "misappropriation of funds" and Ashneer submitted his resignation ahead of the board's plan to table the report on the governance review.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Inflation hits all-time-high of 5.8% in 19 nations using euro
text: Consumer inflation in the 19 countries that use the euro currency increased by an annual 5.8% in February 2022,  European Union statistics agency Eurostat said on Wednesday. It's the highest level since recordkeeping for the euro started in 1997. Inflation in Europe, as in other major economies, has been increasing by surging energy prices following Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ship with 4,000 cars including Porsches sinks 2 weeks after catching fire mid-ocean
text: A burnt-out cargo ship carrying around 4,000 cars made by Volkswagen Group, including Lamborghinis, Porsches, Bentleys and Audis, sank on Tuesday off the Portuguese Azores archipelago. The ship sank nearly two weeks after it caught fire mid-ocean. "When the towing started...water started to come in...The ship lost its stability and sank," the captain of the nearest port said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World's largest yacht worth ₹4,500 cr seized by Germany from Russian billionaire: Reports
text: German authorities have reportedly seized the ₹4,500-crore superyacht belonging to Russian billionaire Alisher Usmanov in a Hamburg shipyard. The 512-foot yacht named Dilbar is the world’s largest motor yacht by gross tonnage at 15,917 tons. Usmanov was on a list of billionaires to face sanctions from European Union in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sensex crashes 1,100 points, Nifty below 16,600 amid Russia-Ukraine war
text: The Sensex crashed around 1,100 points on Wednesday after crude oil price surged past $110 per barrel amid Russia-Ukraine war and India reported that its GDP growth slowed to 5.4% in Q3. The Sensex was trading below 55,200 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 fell over 270 points to trade below 16,600 levels.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tesla, Google, Apple & 5 other US stocks to begin trading on NSE IFSC today
text: The NSE International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) platform in Gujarat's GIFT City will start trading in eight US stocks from today. The stocks include Tesla, Amazon, Alphabet (Google), Apple, Meta Platforms (Facebook), Microsoft, Netflix and Walmart. To make US stocks accessible to Indians, market makers will buy shares in US and issue unsponsored depositary receipts against them, NSE said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nike temporarily halts sales in Russia via its website, app
text: Nike is temporarily halting sales from its website and app in Russia, saying that it "cannot guarantee delivery of goods to customers in Russia". An update on its website directed customers to their nearest Nike stores. Ukrainian Member of Parliament Lesia Vasylenko praised Nike saying it's a "great example" of how private companies can impose sanctions against Russia.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Honda suspends car, motorcycle exports to Russia amid invasion
text: Honda has suspended its automobile and motorcycle exports to Russia, amid growing sanctions on Russia in protest against its invasion of Ukraine. A Honda spokesperson said exports to Russia were already suspended as of Wednesday. The firm's suspension is reportedly based on complications with its distribution networks and concerns surrounding sanctions against Russia.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Oil price crosses $110 mark, reaches highest level since July 2014
text: Crude oil price hit its highest level since July 2014 as it rose past the $110/barrel mark on Wednesday as sanctions imposed on Russia continued to mount. Brent crude rose over 5.8% to $111.09/barrel, its highest since July 2014. US West Texas Intermediate jumped nearly 6% to $109.30/barrel, its highest since September 2013.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India trying to increase its footprint in international gaming sector: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said the gaming sector "is huge internationally" and India is trying to increase its footprint in it. "The number of youth connected to this market globally is increasing. That's why...we have focused on Animation Visual Effects Gaming Comic [in Budget 2022]," PM Modi said. "For us, technology is mainstay of making the country self-reliant," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Firm behind Free Fire app loses $132 bn in market value in 5 months
text: Singapore-based Sea Ltd, the owner of Garena Free Fire game, has lost $132 billion in market value from its peak last year in October. Its shares fell 13% in US trading on Tuesday, wiping $11 billion from its market valuation. Sea had earlier lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop after India banned Free Fire's app.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Representations on crypto regulations have been made to govt: Ex-SEBI chief
text: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator has made representations to the government on regulation of cryptocurrencies in India. Tyagi said SEBI has been in discussion with the government since November 2021 and has made several representations. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced in Budget 2022 that a 30% tax will be imposed on all virtual digital assets.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SEBI didn't dilute orders on NSE matter, acted as per remit: Ex-SEBI Chief
text: Former SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi on Wednesday said the regulator didn't "dilute" its orders on the National Stock Exchange issue, and that it "came out with orders within [SEBI's] remit and understanding". This comes days after Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government was analysing if SEBI took "necessary punitive" action in the matter. SEBI's working is transparent, Tyagi added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: UP RERA's NCR forum settled 1,150 property disputes worth over ₹345 cr
text: UP Real Estate Regulatory Authority's (RERA) NCR conciliation forum has so far settled 1,150 disputes involving properties worth over ₹345 crore, officials said. Most of the disputes came from the allottees of the projects in Gautam Buddha Nagar, Ghaziabad, Meerut and Bulandshahr, they added. The cases pertained to delay in registered sale deed and possession of units to allottees.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Adani Group forays into media business with minority stake in Quintillion
text: Adani Group will acquire a minority stake in Quintillion Business Media (QBM) Private Limited as it ventures in the news industry. A joint statement by the two companies said their relationship "marks a strong beginning of Adani Group's foray into Indian media". The deal is only limited to QBM and not any other products of QBM's parent company Quint.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ilker Ayci declines offer to be new Air India CEO
text: Former Chairman of Turkish Airlines, Ilker Ayci, has rejected Tata Sons' offer to be Air India's new CEO. Ayci alleged that his appointment to the position was "coloured" by Indian media, Bloomberg reported citing an email. Earlier, RSS-affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch opposed the appointment of Ayci, who was Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan's advisor in 1990s, citing "national security".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ashneer Grover quits as BharatPe MD, says 'I'm being forced to bid adieu'
text: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover, who's in a tussle with the board over a governance review, has resigned as MD and director. In his letter, Ashneer said, "I write this with a heavy heart as...I'm being forced to bid adieu to a company of which I'm a Founder." Earlier, his wife Madhuri was fired as Head of Controls on funds misappropriation allegations.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Disney, Warner Bros, Sony pausing film releases in Russia over Ukraine invasion
text: Hollywood studios Disney, Warner Bros, and Sony Pictures Entertainment said they would pause theatrical releases of upcoming films in Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The Walt Disney said it is pausing the release of theatrical films, starting with the upcoming Pixar Animation Studios release, 'Turning Red'. WarnerMedia said it would pause this week's release of 'The Batman' in Russia.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: SBI stops handling trade with sanctioned Russian entities: Report
text: India's largest lender State Bank of India won't process any transactions involving Russian entities that have been sanctioned after the invasion of Ukraine, Reuters reported citing a letter. "Transactions involving entities, banks, ports or vessels appearing" on a US, European Union or United Nations sanctions list won't be processed irrespective of the currency used, SBI told certain clients.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Switzerland breaks 207-yr-old policy of neutrality to impose sanctions on Russia
text: Switzerland has broken away from its long-standing policy of neutrality after 207 years and agreed to adopt all the sanctions that the EU has imposed on Russia, due to its invasion of Ukraine. Accordingly, the Swiss assets of certain Russian people and companies will be frozen. "We're in an extraordinary situation where extraordinary measures could be decided," said Swiss President.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: UK oil giant Shell to exit all joint ventures with Russia's Gazprom
text: British oil giant Shell will exit all its joint ventures with Russian government-controlled energy company Gazprom and related entities. Its assets in these ventures are worth about $3 billion. Shell will also stop working on the Nord Stream 2 pipeline project. Describing Russia's actions in Ukraine as "a senseless act of military aggression", Shell said, "We will not stand by."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ashneer quit ahead of PwC report, board reserves right to take action: BharatPe
text: After BharatPe's Ashneer Grover resigned as MD and director, BharatPe said he resigned "minutes after receiving the agenda for upcoming board meeting that included submission of the PwC report regarding his conduct". "The Board reserves the right to take action based on the report's findings," the company added. Co-founder Ashneer said he was being "forced to bid adieu" to BharatPe.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: You treat founders as slaves, cut us down at will: Ashneer to BharatPe investors
