text: In his letter of resignation as BharatPe MD, Co-founder Ashneer Grover alleged that the company's investors and board treat founders as "slaves", pushing "us to build multi-billion-dollar businesses and cutting us down at will". "Today I'm being vilified and treated in the most disgraceful manner...I cease to be a human for you (investors)," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Not a beggar: Ashneer on receiving any compensation after quitting BharatPe
text: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover on Tuesday resigned from the company. When asked if he was offered any monetary compensation by the board, he responded, "I am not a beggar. The board can't even look me in the eyes. I am not at their mercy. They are at our mercy." He also said that he'll be a shareholder at the company.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Do you think I listen to anyone's advice?: Ashneer on his decision to quit BharatPe
text: Ashneer Grover, while responding to a journalist’s query if his decision to resign from BharatPe was a personal one or advised by his lawyer, said, "Do you think I listen to anyone’s advice?...God has given me my mind and I have enough courage to take decisions on my own." He added, "I am Ashneer Grover...I'm not answerable to anyone."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I challenge you to run this company better without me: Ashneer to BharatPe board
text: While resigning as BharatPe's MD, Co-founder Ashneer Grover said in a letter to the board, "Since you clearly believe you can run this company better without me – I'm leaving you with this challenge." "Build incrementally even half of the value I created so far," he wrote. He added that he'll continue as BharatPe's single largest individual shareholder.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: If I start speaking, Sequoia won't be able to invest in India: BharatPe's Ashneer
text: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover, who resigned as MD, in an interview, criticised board chairman Rajnish Kumar, CEO Suhail Sameer and other independent directors and investors, saying, "I have so much dirt on them." "Tomorrow if I start speaking, Sequoia (Capital) will not be able to make a single investment in India. You will have ED, CBI behind them," he claimed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Price of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinder increased by ₹105 in Delhi from today
text: The prices of 19 kg commercial LPG cylinders have been increased by ₹105 in Delhi, effective from March 1. With this increase, now 19 kg commercial cylinder will cost ₹2,012 in the national capital. The price of 5 kg commercial LPG cylinders has also been raised by ₹27. Now a 5 kg cylinder will cost ₹569 in Delhi.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Russia bans residents from transferring money abroad from March 1
text: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a ban on foreign exchange loans and transfers by its residents to outside of the country from March 1, in response to the economic sanctions imposed by the West. It also prohibits companies from buying back their own stocks. This comes after Russia banned flights from 36 countries in a retaliatory move against EU.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: After Amul, Gowardhan milk prices increased by ₹2 per litre
text: A day after Amul increased milk prices by ₹2 per litre, Parag Milk Foods has raised the price of Gowardhan brand of cow milk by ₹2 per litre with immediate effect. "This price hike is being done after almost 3 years due to rise in costs of energy, packaging, logistics and cattle feed," Chairman Devendra Shah said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russian billionaires lose combined $83 billion wealth in 2 months
text: The combined wealth of Russia's 22 richest individuals has plunged by $83 billion since January 2022, as per Bloomberg. The wipeout comes amid extreme market declines following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Lukoil Chairman Vagit Alekperov has lost the most among Russian billionaires with his net worth declining by $13 billion. Meanwhile, Gennady Timchenko has lost almost half of his wealth.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I need to go back & review the situation: FM on LIC IPO amid Russia-Ukraine war
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while speaking on LIC IPO amid the Russia-Ukraine war, told The Hindu BusinessLine, "Now there's a full-scale war. Therefore, I need to go back and review the situation." Sitharaman also said, "Ideally, I'd like to go ahead with it, because it is something we have planned for some time purely based on Indian considerations."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Estée Lauder fires senior exec Demsey for posting racist meme on Instagram
text: The Estée Lauder Companies has fired Executive Group President John Demsey for posting a meme on his Instagram account that contained a racial slur and a joke about COVID-19. The company said Demsey's Instagram posts caused "widespread offence". Demsey, who oversees brands like Clinique and Mac, had apologised last week for "carelessly reposting a racist meme without reading it beforehand."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Visa, Mastercard block Russian financial institutions after sanctions
text: Visa and Mastercard have blocked multiple Russian financial institutions, including the Russian central bank, from their network after the US imposed sanctions over Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We'll continue to work with regulators...to abide fully by our compliance obligations as they evolve," Mastercard said. Visa and Mastercard also promised to contribute $2 million each for humanitarian aid.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: $2.4-bn fraud accused Indian founder of BitConnect has disappeared: US regulator
text: Cryptocurrency investment platform BitConnect's Founder Satish Kumbhani, charged criminally in the US for running a $2.4-billion ponzi scheme, has disappeared from India, officials said. The 36-year-old Kumbhani has "likely relocated from India to an unknown address in a foreign country", SEC attorney Richard Primoff said in a court filing. US SEC has been attempting to locate him since November.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bitcoin briefly rises above $44,000 for the 1st time since Feb 17
text: Bitcoin, the world's largest cryptocurrency, was briefly trading above $44,000 for the first time since February 17 on Tuesday. It rose as much as 6% to $44,183 and was later trading at around $43,400. The surge came amid growing demand for cryptocurrencies following the Russian invasion of Ukraine and escalating sanctions on Russia.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: GM, Harley-Davidson halt shipments to Russia amid ongoing war
text: General Motors and Harley-Davidson have halted their shipments to Russia amid the ongoing war in Ukraine and the resultant economic sanctions. GM cited "a number of external factors, including supply chain issues and other matters beyond the company's control". Harley-Davidson relied on Europe and the Mideast for 31% of motorcycle sales last year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Reliance buys majority stake in designer brand Abraham & Thakore
text: Reliance Retail on Tuesday announced it has acquired a majority stake in designer brand Abraham & Thakore (A&T) for an undisclosed amount. A&T's founders Rakesh Thakore, Kevin Nigli and David Abraham will continue to lead the creative direction of the brand, the company said. Reliance has recently invested in several designer labels including Ritu Kumar and Manish Malhotra's companies.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: GST revenues rise 18% in Feb to cross ₹1.3 lakh cr mark for 5th time
text: Gross revenue collection from GST surged 18% YoY to ₹1,33,026 crore in February 2022, government data showed. This is the fifth time GST collection crossed the ₹1.3 lakh crore mark. Revenues collected in February 2022 are 26% higher than those collected in February 2020. Of the total revenue, central GST is ₹24,435 crore and state GST is ₹30,779 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Burman family makes offer to buy additional 26% stake in Eveready
text: Eveready's single-largest investor Burman family on Monday said it made an open offer to buy an additional 26% stake, or 18.9 million shares, for ₹604.76 crore in Eveready Industries Ltd. The mandatory open offer under the takeover regulations was made as the Burmans acquired an additional 5.26% share of Eveready for ₹122.30 crore, taking their total shareholding to 25.11%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Jet fuel prices touch highest ever after 3.3% hike, fifth hike in 2022
text: Prices of Jet fuel, or Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF), touched their all-time high after a 3.22% rise due to rising crude oil prices. ATF price was hiked by ₹3,010.87/kilolitre to ₹93,530.66/kl in Delhi. This is the fifth time that prices of ATF, which makes up for almost 40% of an airline's running cost, have been hiked in 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Future Retail gets NCLT nod to convene meetings to approve RIL deal
text: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has allowed Future Retail to convene meetings of its shareholders and creditors to seek their approval for the sale of its retail assets to Reliance Retail. The companies had announced the ₹24,713 crore deal in 2020. Notably, Reliance has started taking over the operations of Future Retail stores, as per reports last week.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: US, allies cut selected Russian banks from main international payment system SWIFT
text: The US, EU and their allies have agreed to cut off a number of Russian banks from the main international payment system, SWIFT. The measures also include restrictions on the Russian central bank's international reserves, ending the "golden passports" for wealthy Russians and their families and targeting individuals and institutions in Russia and elsewhere that support the war against Ukraine.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Madhabi Puri Buch appointed as first woman Chairperson of SEBI
text: The government on Monday appointed Madhabi Puri Buch as the first woman chairperson of market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for three years. Buch, a former SEBI Whole Time Member, will be replacing Ajay Tyagi whose tenure ends on February 28. Buch, who studied at IIM Ahmedabad, has previously worked at ICICI Bank and Greater Pacific Capital.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Norway wealth fund, world's largest, to divest its Russian assets
text:
Norway's $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will divest its Russian assets following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We have decided to freeze the fund's investments and have begun a process of selling out (of Russia)," Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre
 said. Norges Bank Investment Management's (NBIM) Russian assets were worth $2.83 billion at the end of 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: UK oil giant BP to exit its 19.75% shareholding in Russian oil firm Rosneft
text: British oil giant BP will exit its 19.75% shareholding in Russian government-owned oil firm Rosneft. "Russia's attack on Ukraine is an act of aggression that is having tragic consequences across the region," BP Chairman Helge Lund said. BP, which has operated in Russia for over 30 years, will no longer report reserves, production or profit for Rosneft.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Russia further isolated from international financial system, Putin must fail: UK
text: UK's Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday said, "We've further isolated Russia from the international financial system this morning." He added, "Working with our partners, and the G7, we are determined to impose the most severe economic measures possible against Russian President Vladimir Putin for his abhorrent campaign against Ukraine." The UK PM also said, "Putin must fail."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Japanese billionaire donates $8.7 mn to Ukraine, says 'Met Ukraine Prez in 2019'
text: Japanese billionaire Hiroshi 'Mickey' Mikitani, the Chairman and CEO of electronic commerce company Rakuten, has donated $8.7 million to Ukraine. He called Russia's attack "a challenge to democracy". In a letter to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Hiroshi said, "I vividly remember the early summer of 2019 as if it were yesterday when I visited Kiev and met with you."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: One thing this war teaches for sure, be Atmanirbhar: Kotak on Russia-Ukraine
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank's billionaire CEO Uday Kotak in a tweet said, "One thing this war teaches for sure: be Atmanirbhar!" He said, "Ukraine Russia conflict highlights that geography matters." He added, "For India, with China on one side and Pakistan on the other, both nuclear enabled, our dependence on Russian military equipment, and the US far away, we have challenges."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Russian central bank raises key interest rate to 20% from 9.5%
text: The Russian central bank on Monday raised its key interest rate to 20% from 9.5% to counter risks of rouble depreciation and higher inflation. Russia has also ordered companies to sell 80% of their foreign currency revenues. Several other measures were also announced by the bank to support domestic markets amid harsh Western sanctions.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Russia's ruble falls 30% against US dollar amid sanctions over Ukraine invasion
text: Russia's ruble plunged nearly 30% against the dollar on Monday after world powers imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The ruble was indicated to be down 27% at 114.33 per dollar in offshore trading, according to Bloomberg News. The US and European Union said they would exclude some Russian banks from the international bank payments system SWIFT.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Amazon sued for $100 mn by US man who lost his leg in crash with delivery van
text: A man is suing Amazon for $100 million in the US after a collision with a delivery van resulted in the amputation of his left leg. Justin Hartley claimed the accident caused him "severe bodily injuries", including a fractured left wrist. He alleged that Amazon is responsible because it puts pressure on employees, causing them to become distracted while driving.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Anil Ambani's family welcomes Khrisha; shares Anmol-Khrisha's wedding pics
text: Anil Ambani's wife Tina Ambani took to Instagram to share a family picture that included her daughter-in-law Khrisha Shah, and captioned it, "Welcoming our daughter! A new chapter for Anmol, a new energy in the house." She also shared several pictures from her son Anmol Ambani and his entrepreneur-wife Khrisha Shah's wedding ceremonies, including 'Mandva Mahurat', mehendi and haldi.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's GDP growth slows to 5.4% in Q3 of FY22 compared to 8.4% in Q2
text: India's GDP growth slowed down to 5.4% during the third quarter of 2021-2022 compared to 8.4% in the previous quarter, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said on Monday. It also estimated that India's GDP will likely grow by 8.9% in 2021-22. In its first advanced estimate, the government had estimated the GDP in 2021-22 to grow by 9.2%.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Old income tax regime with deductions must go: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj
text: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj has said that the old income tax regime must be disincentivised and the new regime must be incentivised with no exemptions. "The new regime will not take over unless we do so," Bajaj said. "What should the simple regime be? The simple regime should be broader tax slabs, lower taxes, no exemptions," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: World's 6th richest man Buffett praises IITian Ajit Jain, calls hiring him 'perfect choice'
text: World's sixth richest man Warren Buffett praised Ajit Jain, who runs all of Berkshire's insurance operations, in his annual shareholder letter. Buffett revealed he hired Jain in 1986 even after Jain said he had no experience in insurance, and called his decision "as perfect a choice as could have been made". Jain, who hails from Odisha, studied at IIT Kharagpur.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Amul increases price for milk across India by ₹2 per litre
text: Amul on Monday said it is increasing the price for its milk across India by ₹2 per litre. The increased price of Amul milk will be applicable from tomorrow, March 1. Amul said that it is increasing the price of milk due to an increase in the prices of energy, packaging, transportation cost and animal feed.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Future Retail suspends store operations amid Reliance takeover: Report
text: India's second-largest retailer Future Retail has suspended most of its online and offline operations amid reports of Reliance Industries taking over its stores including Big Bazaar, reported Reuters. "We regret to inform you that currently stores are non-operational for 2 days," Big Bazaar told social media users on Sunday. Its app and website were also not available for online ordering.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sensex drops 1,000 points, Nifty below 16,400 amid Russia-Ukraine war
text: Sensex fell more than 1,000 points to trade at around 54,850, while Nifty dropped over 280 points to 16,378. This comes amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday ordered nuclear forces to be put on high alert. Other Asian markets also plunged, with Japan's Nikkei falling 0.34% and Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index falling 1.49%.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Who is Madhabi Puri Buch, the first-ever woman to head SEBI?
text: Madhabi Puri Buch has been appointed as the first-ever woman Chairperson of SEBI. She was not only SEBI's first woman whole-time member but also the first person working at SEBI from the private sector. An IIM Ahmedabad alumna, Buch started her career with ICICI Bank, joined Greater Pacific Capital in Singapore and also served at New Development Bank in Shanghai.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US bans transactions with Russian central bank, National Wealth Fund
text: The United States on Monday banned its citizens and companies from carrying out transactions with the Russian central Bank, the National Wealth Fund and the Ministry of Finance. The move will immobilise any Russian central bank assets held in the US, the country's Treasury department said. The US also announced penalties on the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF).
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Apple's 'brilliant' CEO regards Apple users as first love: Warren Buffett
text: Berkshire Hathaway's Chairman Warren Buffett in his annual letter to shareholders said, "Tim Cook, Apple's brilliant CEO...regards users of Apple products as his first love." Listing Apple under "Our Four Giants", Buffett said Berkshire holds a 5.55% stake in Apple. The 91-year-old investor also credited the growth of Berkshire's insurance unit to his hiring of Ajit Jain in 1986.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: World's largest wealth fund to vote against Apple CEO's 2021 compensation
text: Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will vote against ratification of Apple's management remuneration plan. The development comes after proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services urged investors to vote against Apple CEO Tim Cook's compensation of $98.7 million for 2021. Norges Bank Investment Management, which operates the wealth fund, said it would follow the advice.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: FPIs withdraw net ₹35,506 cr in Feb 2022, highest since March 2020
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹35,506 crore in the month of February 2022, the highest amount withdrawn by FPIs since March 2020 at ₹1,18,203 crore. FPIs have been net sellers since October 2021. During February 1-25, FPIs pulled out ₹31,158 crore from equities and ₹4,467 crore from the debt segment, according to depositories’ data.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's oil imports to cross $100 bn in FY22, almost twice of FY21
text: India's oil import bill is set to cross the $100 billion mark in FY22, almost double of what it spent in FY21 at $62.2 billion. India has already spent $94.3 billion on oil imports between April 2021 and January 2022. India imported oil worth $11.6 billion in January 2022, a 50.6% YoY rise against $7.7 billion spent in January 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt's fiscal deficit rises to 59% of FY22 target in Apr 2021-Jan 2022
text: The Centre's fiscal deficit rose to 58.9% of its FY22 target between April 2021 and January 2022, data by the Controller General of Accounts showed. In Budget 2021, the government had aimed for a fiscal deficit of 6.8% of the GDP in FY22. Centre's capital expenditure in April 2021-January 2022 recorded a 22% YoY rise to ₹4.42 lakh crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Credit growth to industry rises to 6.4% in Jan 2022 from 0.7% in Jan 2021
text: Reserve Bank of India's data showed that India's credit growth to industry rose from 0.7% in January 2021 to 6.4% in January 2022. Credit growth to medium enterprises is pegged at 74.7% against 21.8% in January 2021. Credit growth to micro and small industries accelerated to 19.7% from 0.5% and credit to large industries rose to 0.5% against -0.2%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Biocon Biologics acquires Viatris' biosimilars assets in ₹25,169 cr deal
text: India's largest biopharmaceutical firm Biocon Biologics Ltd (BBL) signed a pact with Viatris to acquire the latter's biosimilars business for up to $3.34 billion (₹25,169 crore) in cash and stock. Viatris will receive $2 billion (₹15,071 crore) in cash on closing of the transaction and up to $335 million (₹2,524 crore) as additional payments expected to be paid in 2024.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SC to hear Cyrus Mistry's appeal to drop its remarks against him in 10 days
text: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's appeal to expunge remarks made against him in the Court's 2021 verdict upholding Mistry's removal from the Tata Sons board. The plea said SC's remarks affect Mistry's "reputation, integrity and character". The Court said it will hear the plea in 10 days.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Government assures fuel price stability amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
text: The Centre on Saturday said that it is closely monitoring global energy markets and potential energy supply disruptions amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. The government said, "With a view to ensuring energy justice for its citizens and for just energy transition towards a net zero future, India stands ready to take appropriate action for ensuring ongoing supplies at stable prices."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Nestlé, Carlsberg, Coca-Cola among firms to shut operations in Ukraine
text: Several companies have shut down operations in Ukraine following Russia's invasion on Thursday. World's largest food company Nestlé temporarily closed its three factories in the region, whereas beermaker Carlsberg and bottler Coca-Cola HBC have halted operations and sent their workers home. Oreo maker Mondelez International said it will close its plants if the situation gets too dangerous.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Putin must be held accountable, his assets should be frozen: Richard Branson
text: After Russia invaded Ukraine, billionaire Richard Branson said that Russian President Vladimir Putin must be held accountable for "initiating a war of aggression". "He should not be allowed to travel, his assets should be frozen or seized, including his prized yacht," Branson tweeted. He added, "The least all of us can do is to make sure Putin...pays the price for...aggression."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Norway wealth fund, world's largest, rejects calls to sell Russian assets
text: World's largest sovereign wealth fund's CEO Nicolai Tangen is rejecting calls to sell its Russian assets after the country invaded Ukraine. "If we sold out of Russia now, it would be a wrapped gift to the oligarchs who buy our shares," Tangen said. The Norway-based Norges Bank Investment Management owns 1.5% of every listed company in the world.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Russia to seize foreigners' funds in response to freeze on citizens' money abroad
text: Russia has said it'll respond to the seizure of money of its citizens due to the ongoing invasion of Ukraine, by seizing funds of foreigners and foreign companies in Russia. Moscow does not rule out nationalising the assets of companies registered in the USA, European Union and other "unfriendly jurisdictions", Deputy Head of Russia's Security Council Dmitry Medvedev said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: S&P cuts Russia's credit rating to 'junk' amid Ukraine invasion
text: Standard and Poor's (S&P) has cut Russia's long-term foreign currency credit rating to 'junk' by lowering it to 'BB+' from 'BBB-' amid Ukraine's invasion. The sanctions imposed against it "could carry significant negative implications for the Russian banking sector's ability to act as a financial intermediary for international trade", S&P said. It also cut Ukraine's rating to 'B-' from 'B'.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Air India to operate 2 flights to bring back Indians stuck in Ukraine
text: Air India on Friday said that it will operate two flights from Delhi and Mumbai to Bucharest (Romania) and Budapest (Hungary) on Saturday (February 26) to fly back Indians stranded in Ukraine amid the Russian invasion. The flights have been arranged based upon inputs from MEA on the emerging situation in Ukraine, Air India said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Indian founder of BitConnect indicted for running $2.4 bn crypto ponzi scheme
text: Cryptocurrency investment platform BitConnect's Indian Founder Satish Kumbhani, has been indicted on charges of orchestrating a $2.4 billion global ponzi scheme, federal prosecutors said. It's believed to be the "largest crypto fraud ever charged", the US Justice Department said. Kumbhani is charged with conspiracy to commit wire fraud, price manipulation and international money laundering.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: What is SWIFT, the financial system from which Russia could be cut off?
text: SWIFT, or Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunication, allows the smooth and rapid transfer of money across borders. The Belgium-based system links 11,000 banks and institutions in over 200 countries and Russia's the second-largest country in terms of number of users. If SWIFT excluded Russia, it'd become hard for Russian companies to pay for imports and receive cash for exports.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Will be supporting local humanitarian efforts in Ukraine: Apple CEO Tim Cook
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook has expressed his concern with the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine. Cook tweeted, "I am deeply concerned with the situation in Ukraine. We're doing all we can for our teams...and will be supporting local humanitarian efforts. I am thinking of the people who are right now in harm’s way and joining all those calling for peace."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk's net worth jumps by over $8 billion in a day, re-enters $200-billion club
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reclaimed his position as the only member of the $200-billion club a day after his net worth fell to $198.6 billion. Musk became richer by $8.49 billion on Thursday after Tesla shares jumped 4.81%. The 50-year-old currently has a net worth of $207 billion despite losing over $63 billion in 2022, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Got caught up in FOMO, made deals I shouldn't have: Mittal on Shark Tank India
text: Speaking about his participation in Shark Tank India, Anupam Mittal, the Founder and CEO of Shaadi.com, admitted that he didn’t know about the show’s process. Mittal said, "I got caught in FOMO (fear of missing out). And in Shark Tank, there are your fellow investors...It gets exciting when you invest money...I ended up making several deals I shouldn’t have."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Screenshots of chats between 'yogi' & Chitra found with Subramanian: Report
text: CBI sources alleged that investigators found "a mail trail, some screenshots, and critical evidence" with ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian, based on which it was suspected that he was the 'Himalayan yogi'. As per a source, "screenshots" of conversations between former NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna and the 'yogi' were also found with him. Subramanian has denied having been involved, source added.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Ex-NSE official Subramanian is 'yogi' who guided Chitra Ramkrishna: Reports
text: Former NSE Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian, who has been arrested by the CBI, is the 'Himalayan yogi' who guided former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, as per CBI sources. The email address ‘rigyajursama@outlook.com’, through which Chitra shared information with the 'yogi', was created by Subramanian, sources added. Subramanian was offered ₹1.68 crore to join NSE.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Ex-NSE official Anand's wife's pay raised from ₹60 lakh to ₹1.34 cr in 3 yrs: SEBI
text: According to SEBI, Sunitha Anand, wife of former NSE official Anand Subramanian, arrested by the CBI, was hired at an annual salary of ₹60 lakh at NSE. Between 2013 and 2016, her compensation was more than doubled from ₹60 lakh to ₹1.34 crore. Her contract was foreclosed in December 2016, the same month as Chitra Ramkrishna's exit from NSE.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Govt shouldn't give clearance to Air India's new CEO Ilker Ayci: RSS affiliate
text: The government should not give clearance to the appointment of Ilker Ayci as the CEO and Managing Director of Air India, said RSS-affiliate Swadeshi Jagran Manch's co-convenor Ashwani Mahajan. Citing national security, Mahajan added, "I think the government is already sensitive to the issue and has taken up the matter very seriously." Ayci is the former Chairman of Turkish Airlines.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance takes control of Future Retail stores, offers jobs to staff: Report
text: Reliance Industries is taking over the operation of Future Retail (FRL) stores and is offering jobs to the company's employees, Reuters reported. The development comes amid FRL's ongoing legal battle with Amazon over sale of its retail assets to Reliance. Reliance has reportedly decided to rebrand about 200 stores that would otherwise be closed as FRL failed to make payments.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt allows FDI of up to 20% in IPO-bound LIC via automatic route: Reports
text: The Cabinet has reportedly permitted foreign direct investment (FDI) of up to 20% in IPO-bound Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) under the automatic route. Earlier this month, the state-run insurer filed papers for its IPO, which is expected to be India's biggest-ever public issue. In its meeting on Saturday, Cabinet also simplified and enhanced the existing FDI policy, reports said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Scaling down ops: Future Retail amid reports of Reliance taking over its stores
text:
Amid reports of Reliance Industries taking over operations of its stores and offering jobs to its staff, 
Future Retail said that it is scaling down its operations to reduce losses. In an exchange filing, it said, "The company has been finding it difficult to finance the working capital needs...Company has made a loss of ₹4,445 crore in last four quarters."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: $4.7 mn in crypto crowdfunded for Ukrainian army since invasion: Report
text: Several NGOs and volunteer groups in Ukraine have raised around $4.7 million in crypto-asset donations for the Ukrainian military since the Russian invasion, blockchain analysis firm Elliptic reported. One Ukrainian volunteer group, Come Back Alive, received $3 million in a single bitcoin donation alone on Friday. However, the identity of those behind the donations was not revealed.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Infosys unveils Metaverse Foundry with 100 ready-to-apply use cases
text: Infosys has launched Metaverse Foundry that will help clients create their own metaverse environment, among other things. It already has over 100 ready-to-apply use cases and templates for the clients. Infosys has already worked with a few clients including Roland Garros and the Australian Open where they have created a virtual world where people can buy things around tennis.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Metaverse is beyond being a buzzword today for sure: Infosys Prez
text: Infosys President Ravi Kumar S in an interview discussing metaverse and Infosys' Metaverse Foundry said metaverse is beyond being a "buzzword" today for sure. He added it was "ahead of its time" when the Second Life Founder Philip Rosedale built the original metaverse in 2003. Kumar also said metaverse is a reset to building the internet's next version in 3D.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: British Airways cancels 150 flights over IT outage, rules out cyberattack
text: British Airways has cancelled more than 150 short-haul flights to and from its London Heathrow hub, citing "significant technical issues" following a systems outage. The airline said that the problem had not been caused by a cyberattack but due to a hardware issue. Earlier, UK's National Cyber Security Centre warned companies to bolster their online defences after Russia invaded Ukraine.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CCI doesn't have power to suspend its own orders: Amazon to NCLAT
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) doesn't have the power to keep its own orders in abeyance, Amazon told the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT). Last year, the CCI had suspended a 2019 deal between Amazon and Future Coupons. This is the first time it's happening in India that approval is suspended after two years, Amazon's counsel told NCLAT.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Zomato, Paytm, Nykaa to be included in NIFTY Next 50 index
text: Zomato, Paytm and Nykaa will be included in the NIFTY Next 50 index from March 31, 2022, the National Stock Exchange of India (NSE) has announced. Indian Oil Corporation, Mindtree and SRF Limited will also be included in the index. The index represents the performance of 50 stocks that rank after the top 50 stocks (NIFTY 50) listed on NSE.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bharti Airtel to buy 4.7% stake in Indus Towers from Vodafone Plc
text: Bharti Airtel on Friday announced that it has entered into an agreement with Vodafone Plc to buy 4.7% stake in Indus Towers. The deal will be done on the principal condition that the amount paid shall be inducted by Vodafone as fresh equity in Vodafone Idea (VIL) and simultaneously remitted to Indus Towers to clear VIL's outstanding dues, it said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian sent to CBI custody till March 6
text: NSE's former Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian has been remanded to CBI custody till March 6 following his arrest in connection with the investigation into a stock market manipulation case. Subramanian is the "yogi" who guided the actions of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, reports said quoting CBI sources. It was earlier alleged that the "yogi" had influenced Subramanian's appointment.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: US sanctions Russian banks that together hold around $1 trillion in assets
text: US President Joe Biden announced new economic sanctions on Russia following the Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We've now sanctioned Russian banks that together hold around $1 trillion in assets," he said. "Today, we're also blocking four more major Russian banks...every asset that they have in America will be frozen. This includes VTB, the second-largest bank in Russia," Biden added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: UK announces its biggest-ever sanctions against Russia, bans Russian banks
text: The UK has announced its biggest-ever economic sanctions against Russia after the Russian invasion of Ukraine. It's banning Russian banks from the UK finance system, stopping them from accessing sterling and clearing payments through the UK. Russian companies will be banned from raising funds in the UK and the UK will limit the money Russians can deposit in UK banks.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: EU announces sanctions targeting 70% of Russian banking market, key govt-led firms
text: The European Union has approved a package of further sanctions against Russia after it invaded Ukraine, which includes financial sanctions, targeting 70% of the Russian banking market and key state-owned companies. It's also banning exports to target the energy sector, and banning sale of aircraft to Russian airlines. Further, diplomats and business people won't get privileged visa access to EU.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Delhi approves Film Policy 2022, to give ₹3 cr subsidy for film production
text: Delhi government on Thursday approved the Film Policy 2022 aimed to create jobs and boost the economy in the national capital. Delhi government will give a subsidy of up to ₹3 crore for film production, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia announced. He added that a ₹50 crore Delhi Film fund will be set up to support film producers.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Russian billionaires lost $39 billion in 1 day after Ukraine invasion
text: The net worth of Russia's 22 richest individuals plunged by a combined $39 billion in one day after the invasion of Ukraine, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. The wipeout came as Moscow's benchmark index closed 33% lower on Thursday, recording the fifth-worst plunge in market history. Lukoil Chairman Vagit Alekperov lost the most as his fortune fell by $6.2 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Is crypto illegal or not? Make your stand clear: Supreme Court to govt
text: The Supreme Court has asked the Centre to clarify if cryptocurrencies are "illegal or not". "You have to make your stand clear," the court bench said. The court was hearing a case related to the ₹20,000-crore GainBitcoin scam. In 2018, Amit Bhardwaj and his brother Vivek were accused of running GainBitcoin, a ponzi scheme promising huge returns on Bitcoin investments.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia-Ukraine conflict wipes over $200 billion from crypto market
text: The market cap of all cryptocurrencies has plunged by $200 billion following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The market cap of all cryptocurrencies now stands at approximately $1.56 trillion, down from a high of $1.77 trillion during the last 24 hours, data from CoinMarketCap showed. Bitcoin is trading just over $35,500, a decline of 9% in the last 24 hours.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: My family's hearing sirens, explosions & they don't know what to do: Ukrainian CEO
text: Speaking about Russia's invasion, a Ukrainian CEO, who lives in the UK, said, "My family's in Kyiv and they can't leave the country. They hear explosions and...sirens. They don't know what to do." "My team is based in 3 major [Ukrainian] cities...No one taught me what CEO needs to do when the war starts," Musemio's Olga Kravchenko wrote.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Indian economy to be among worst hit in Asia amid Russia-Ukraine war: Nomura
text: India, Thailand and the Philippines will be the biggest losers among Asian economies as the Russia-Ukraine war drives up prices of oil and other commodities, as per a Nomura report. Every 10% rise in crude oil price will shave off around 0.2 percentage points from GDP growth in India and add around 0.4 percentage points to inflation, the report said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Pak's 2nd-largest bank fined $55 mn for anti-money laundering violations by US
text: National Bank of Pakistan has been fined $55 million for anti-money laundering violations by two US authorities. "[NBP] allowed serious compliance deficiencies in its New York branch to persist for years despite repeated regulatory warnings," the New York State Department of Financial Services' Superintendent said. Shares of Pakistan's second-largest bank fell 7.4% on Friday, the most in a year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Russian stocks post biggest-ever slump of 45%, erase $250 billion in value
text: Russian stocks slumped as much as 45% on Thursday, their biggest-ever drop, after the country launched a military operation in Ukraine. This wiped out over $250 billion in stock market value, as per Bloomberg. Earlier, the Russian ruble also fell to its level on record. The market crash came as Western countries said they'll impose unprecedented sanctions on Russia.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex jumps 1,100 points a day after crashing 2,702 points amid Ukraine crisis
text: The Sensex jumped more than 1,100 points in early trade on Friday, a day after it crashed 2,702 points following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Sensex was trading near 55,700 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped more than 330 points to trade near 16,600 levels. On Thursday, Sensex and Nifty logged their second worst day since March 2020.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ex-NSE official allegedly appointed on a yogi's advice arrested by CBI: Reports
text: The CBI has reportedly arrested Anand Subramanian, NSE's former Group Operating Officer, in connection with the probe into a 2018 stock market manipulation case. Earlier, market regulator SEBI penalised ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and others over alleged governance lapses in Subramanian's appointment. CBI in its investigations stated that a 'Himalayan yogi' allegedly influenced his appointment.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India refunds ₹7,900 cr to UK's Cairn Energy to settle retrospective tax dispute
text: The Indian government has refunded ₹7,900 crore to Britain's Cairn Energy Plc to settle a dispute over the levy of retrospective taxes, the company said on Thursday. Cairn, now known as Capricorn Energy Plc, said, "Net proceeds of $1.06 billion have been received." In August 2021, India brought a law to scrap all retrospective tax demands and refund money collected.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Pay compensatory dues of ₹4,200 cr to Adani Power: SC to Raj discoms
text: The Supreme Court on Friday ordered three state-run discoms in Rajasthan to pay a total compensatory tariff of ₹4,200 crore to Adani Power. The discoms have been granted four weeks to pay a sum of ₹3,000 crore along with 9% interest. Adani Power had filed a contempt petition seeking a payment of ₹6,738 crore from three discoms towards compensatory tariff.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IKEA names Susanne Pulverer as 1st woman CEO for India business
text: World's largest furniture retailer IKEA announced the appointment of Susanne Pulverer as its first woman CEO and Chief Sustainability Officer for its India business. Pulverer will replace outgoing CEO Peter Betzel and this will be her third stint in India. She joined Sweden-based IKEA in 1997 and moved to India in 2007 to head purchasing function for IKEA South Asia.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex ends 1,329 points higher, recovers half of Thursday's losses
text: The Sensex jumped around 1,329 points to close at 55,858.5 on Friday, recouping nearly half of its losses from yesterday and ending a seven-day losing streak. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped 410 points to close at 16,658. The Sensex had crashed 2,702 points on Thursday following Russia's invasion of Ukraine, recording its second worst day since March 2020.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Wall Street opens 2% lower amid Russia-Ukraine crisis
text: Wall Street opened 2% lower on Thursday following Russia's invasion of Ukraine and global crude oil prices crossing the $100/barrel mark. Dow Jones Industrial Average was trading over 2% or 665 points lower at 32,467.08 while S&P 500 was down 1.51% at 4,161.53 points. The tech-heavy Nasdaq, on the other hand, traded 1.71% or 222 points lower at 12,815.11.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: UK's Lloyds on 'heightened alert' for Russian cyberattacks on banks
text: Britain-based bank Lloyds has been on "heightened alert" for cyberattacks from Russia amid the ongoing crisis in Ukraine. "We've been on...alert...internally around our cyber risk controls and we've been focused on this now for quite a while," Lloyds CEO Charlie Nunn said. The government and banking industry leaders in a meeting about Russia had discussed preparation for potential cyberattacks.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Firm behind Free Fire app no longer Southeast Asia's biggest listed firm
text: Singapore-based Sea Ltd, the owner of Garena Free Fire game, has lost its title as Southeast Asia's biggest publicly-traded company after its shares plunged to an 18-month low. It was overtaken by the Indonesian bank PT Bank Central Asia. Sea had earlier lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop after India banned Free Fire's app.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tesla was ignorant of Bitcoin's environmental impact: Musk's brother
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk in interaction with TechCrunch said Tesla was "very ignorant" of Bitcoin's environmental impact when it announced that it would purchase Bitcoin worth $1.5 billion. "It didn't take...long to get a million messages telling us what we were doing to the environment," he added. Kimbal said he doesn't agree with cryptocurrency's environmental impact.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Musk, his brother face probe over possible insider trading in US: WSJ
text: The US SEC started a probe last year to see whether recent stock sales by Tesla CEO Elon Musk and his brother Kimbal Musk "violated insider trading rules", the WSJ reported. The probe began after Kimbal sold $108 million-worth shares, a day before Musk polled on offloading his stake. Musk claims Kimbal didn't know about the poll ahead of it.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Moody's raises India's GDP growth forecast to 9.5% from 7% for 2022
text: Moody's has raised India's GDP growth forecast for 2022 to 9.5% from 7% earlier, citing a stronger economic recovery after the COVID-19 pandemic. It retained GDP growth forecast for 2023 at 5.5%. The credit ratings firm's forecast projects 8.4% growth for FY 2022-23 and 6.5% for FY 2023-24. RBI had projected India's GDP growth at 7.8% for 2022-23.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Indian economy poised for recovery, but high oil prices worrisome: CEA
text: Chief Economic Advisor Anantha Nageswaran said the Indian economy is poised for growth but high crude oil prices are a cause for concern. He added that the country's banking sector is stable and credit offtake is also poised to take off. "We're not unique to the phenomenon of uncertain growth and high inflation due to the pandemic," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Operations running normally in Ukraine amid Russian attack: Nestle
text: World's largest food company Nestle said that operations in Ukraine were running normally after Russian forces fired missiles at several cities in Ukraine. The company is closely monitoring the situation and have business continuity plans in place, it added. Nestle is operating in Ukraine for more than 25 years and has three factories and about 5,000 employees in the country.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RBI cancels registration of PC Financial for violating guidelines
text: In its first major action against a digital lender, RBI cancelled the registration certificate of PC Financial Services for "gross violations" of the central bank's guidelines. RBI said the company had violated outsourcing and know-your-customer norms. "The company was also found to be charging usurious rate of interest and other charges to its borrowers in an opaque manner," RBI added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: New age tech firms going public key challenge to capital markets: SEBI chief
text: SEBI chief Ajay Tyagi said new age tech companies, which are generally loss making, accessing public market is a key challenge to capital markets. The flourishing landscape of environment, social and governance (ESG) investments is another major challenge due to absence of uniform ESG evaluation matrices, Tyagi added. New age tech companies have raised ₹43,283 crore through IPOs in FY22.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ₹18,000 crore recovered by banks from Mallya, Nirav Modi, Choksi: Centre to SC
text: Banks have recovered ₹18,000 crore from fugitives Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta told the Supreme Court. The SC was told that the value of cases registered under the PMLA against the three is now ₹67,000 crore. As of July 2021, banks had recovered ₹13,109 crore after the sale of assets belonging to the three.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex crashes 2,702 points to end at 54,530 amid Russia's attack on Ukraine
text: The Indian benchmark indices crashed nearly 5% on Thursday amid Russia's military operation in eastern Ukraine with the Sensex plunging 2,702 points. The Sensex ended at 54,530, while the broader Nifty 50 also fell 823 points to close at 16,240. The indices recorded their second worst day since March 2020, the month when India imposed COVID-19 restrictions, as per Bloomberg.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex crashes 2,000 points as Russia announces military operation in Ukraine
text: The Sensex crashed over 2,000 points on Thursday as investors turned cautious following Russian President Vladimir Putin's announcement of a military operation in eastern Ukraine. The Sensex was trading at 55,100 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 slumped over 590 points to trade at 16,450 levels. Other Asian markets were also trading lower following the news.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who is Natasha Bassett, 27-yr-old actress rumoured to be dating Musk?
text: Natasha Bassett, the rumoured girlfriend of the world's richest man, Elon Musk, is a 27-year-old Australian actress, a screenwriter and a director. She grew up in Sydney and moved to New York to attend drama school, and played Britney Spears in the 2017 biopic about the singer. She will appear as Elvis Presley's girlfriend Dixie Locke in an upcoming film.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Very upset by Putin's decision to go to war: Ethereum's Russia-born Co-founder
text: Vitalik Buterin, Ethereum's 28-year-old Russian-born Co-founder, tweeted, "Very upset by Putin's decision to abandon the possibility of a peaceful solution to the dispute with Ukraine and go to war instead." He added, "This is a crime against the Ukrainian and Russian people." He also said, "I want to wish everyone security, although I know that there will be no security."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk falls out of $200-billion club, loses $13.3 billion in a day
text: No person in the world currently has a fortune of over $200 billion as Elon Musk's wealth fell by $13.3 billion on Wednesday. The Tesla CEO was the only member of the $200-billion club but his fortune now stands at $198.6 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. He has lost about $72 billion this year, but still remains world's richest.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: What are the crypto ad guidelines applicable in India from April 1, 2022?
text: Advertising Standards Council of India's (ASCI) guidelines, applicable on ads of crypto-related products from April 1, 2022, say such ads shouldn't carry the words "currency", "securities", "custodian" and "depositories". Ads should carry a disclaimer saying, "Crypto products & NFTs are unregulated and can be highly risky." Information on past performance shall not be provided in a biased manner.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ashneer's wife shares alleged audio clip of BharatPe's Koladiya abusing Ashneer
text: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain Grover took to Twitter to share an alleged audio clip of Bhavik Koladiya, one of the original Co-founders of BharatPe, allegedly "threatening" and abusing Ashneer over a call. In her tweet, Madhuri called Koladiya "BharatPe 3rd party vendor as per company". BharatPe has fired Madhuri over charges of 'misappropriation of funds'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nykaa initially saw job applicants' passion not experience: Founder
text: Nykaa Founder Falguni Nayar in an interaction with Investcorp MD Sanjay Kohli revealed Nykaa, in its early days, did not check if job applicants had the relevant experience. "Anyone who was passionate about Nykaa, and Nykaa's vision of doing something, we used to recruit them," she added. Nayar also said Nykaa is always "willing to give people a chance".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Biden's aides feared US sanctions won't stop Putin from attacking Ukraine: Report
text: US President Joe Biden's own aides feared that sanctions wouldn't stop Russian President Vladimir Putin from invading Ukraine, Bloomberg reported. The US officials spent hundreds of hours over five months to finalise sanctions on Russia, including sanctions on two large Russian financial institutions. Biden warned Russia of "further consequences" after Russia attacked Ukraine on Thursday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Reawakened nightmares of '65 & '71 wars: Mahindra on air raid sirens in Ukraine
text: Sharing a video of air raid siren sounds in a Ukrainian city amid Russia's attack, businessman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "I've lived through two (Indo-Pakistani) wars during my childhood: '65 & '71." "I remember how spine chilling it was when air raid sirens went off in Mumbai. This sound has reawakened those nightmarish memories," he added on Twitter.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Oil hits $100 a barrel for 1st time since 2014 as Ukraine crisis escalates
text: Oil prices surged to $100 a barrel for the first time since 2014 after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a military operation in eastern Ukraine. Brent crude hit a high of $101.34 per barrel in early Asia trade on Thursday, the highest since September 2014. Russia is the world's second-largest oil producer, which mainly sells crude to European refineries.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russian currency crashes to lowest on record after attacks on Ukraine
text: The Russian ruble sank to its lowest level on record after Russian President Vladimir Putin launched a military operation in Ukraine, as per Bloomberg. Ruble fell as much as 9.4% in local trading to 89.60 against the US dollar, before paring some of its losses. The Moscow Exchange halted trading for several hours after stocks also fell most on record.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Russia-Ukraine war may hit commodities beyond oil and gas: Raghuram Rajan
text: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan told CNBC that the Russia-Ukraine war has the potential to affect not just oil and natural gas but various essential commodities like wheat. "Grain prices can also go up because Ukraine and Russia contribute a great amount of wheat exports to the world." On the global economic recovery, Rajan said that recovery is at risk.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Russia-Ukraine crisis wiped out ₹8 lakh crore from Indian markets in 1st hour
text: Indian investors' wealth tumbled by over ₹8 lakh crore in the first hour of trade after Russia launched a military operation in Ukraine. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies crashed to ₹2,47,46,960.48 crore at around 10.15 am on Thursday from ₹2,55,68,668 crore on Wednesday's close. The Sensex slumped by more than 2,000 points during intraday trade.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI's view may have delayed crypto bill: Deputy Governor
text: The views of the RBI on cryptocurrency may have delayed the government's proposed legislation on crypto assets, RBI Deputy Governor Michael Patra said on Wednesday. Central Bank Digital Currency will be introduced in FY23 but India will proceed gradually on the subject as there are concerns on privacy, its impact on monetary policy formulation and energy intensity, Patra added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bharti Airtel acquires strategic stake in blockchain startup Aqilliz
text: Bharti Airtel has acquired a strategic stake in Singapore-based blockchain technology startup Aqilliz. The startup has developed a patented hybrid blockchain platform, Atom, that integrates differential privacy and federated learning on a distributed digital ledger. Airtel aims to deploy Aqilliz's technologies at scale across its adtech, digital entertainment and digital marketplace offerings.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Nykaa insiders including CFO sold stock worth ₹143 cr last week: Report
text: Nykaa-parent FSN E-Commerce Ventures sold stocks worth ₹143 crore last week, Moneycontrol reported quoting data on BSE. The sellers include CFO Arvind Agarwal, CTO Sanjay Suri, CEO of private label beauty brands Reena Chhabra, CEO NykaaMan Nihir Parikh and Vice President Neha Grover. They sold 9,84,528 shares at an average price of ₹1,424 per share.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: No plans to spin off EV business, but change coming: Ford CEO
text: Ford Motor CEO Jim Farley denied reports which claimed he's considered spinning off its electric vehicle (EV) or internal combustion businesses and said there are "no such plans". The company is reinventing itself by removing costs and ramping up for large-scale EV, software sales, Farley added. "I can't turn to ICE organisation and say go be Tesla," he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rolls-Royce CEO Warren East to step down at the end of the year
text: Rolls-Royce CEO Warren East will step down from his position at the end of the year. This comes as Rolls-Royce reported a profit in 2021 spurred by cost cuts implemented by East and a restart of long-distance travel that had eaten into the company's jet-engine income. Rolls-Royce still forecasted stagnant margins and revenue growth of less than 10% in 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Employer must pay damages for delay in payment of EPF contribution: SC
text: The Supreme Court ruled that the employer is obligated to pay damages for delay in payment of Employees' Provident Fund (EPF) contribution of an employee. The Court was hearing a plea against a Karnataka High Court order stating the same. The two-judge bench said the employer is liable to make deductions and deposit the EPF contribution in the worker's account.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Indus Towers shares end 18% lower as Vodafone plans to sell stake
text: Shares of Indus Towers ended over 18% lower on Thursday after Vodafone announced that it'd sell 2.4% stake in the company through a block deal to Bharti Airtel, who's also a promoter. The stake is reportedly estimated to be valued at over ₹3,300 crore. Bharti Airtel holds close to 42% stake in Indus Towers while Vodafone holds about 28% stake.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 40% of workers in India could switch jobs this year: Survey
text: Nearly 40% of workers in India may switch jobs this year, according to a survey, which included 1,024 respondents. Respondents in India reported some of the highest levels of engagement (85%) and wellbeing (89%) at work globally, Qualtrics' report said. However, only 62% of them may stay with their current employer for the next 12 months, the report added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tata may review Air India CEO Ayci's appointment if govt nod delayed: Report
text: Tata Sons may reportedly consider other options for Air India's CEO post, if there's a delay in security clearance of recently appointed CEO and MD Ilker Ayci. Ayci is seen as close to Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan, who's considered as a Pakistan ally. The Ministry of Home Affairs will reportedly carry out thorough background check of Turkish national Ayci.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India Ratings pegs India's FY22 GDP growth at 8.6% on data revision
text: India Ratings and Research (IRR) revised its GDP growth forecast for FY22 to 8.6%, down from the 9.2% projected earlier. According to IRR, the National Statistical Organisation will likely peg FY22's GDP growth at ₹147.2 lakh crore. IRR believes the major reason for the downward revision to be the upward revision of FY21's GDP growth rate from -7.3% to -6.6%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Hindustan Unilever splits Chairman & CEO posts, Sanjiv Mehta to remain CEO
text: Hindustan Unilever (HUL) has announced the separation of the roles of chairman and CEO as the company seeks to boost governance standards. Sanjiv Mehta will continue as the CEO and MD, while Nitin Paranjpe, who is currently the Chief Operating Officer, will take over as the Non-executive Chairman. The change will be effective from March 31, the company said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Inflation peaked in Jan, its momentum is declining: RBI Deputy Governor
text: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Deputy Governor Michael Patra said inflation in India has reached its peak and its momentum "is actually declining". Referring to inflation rates breaching RBI's 6% target ceiling, Patra said policymakers had room to keep borrowing costs lower for longer to support the economy. Inflation rose to its seven-month high of 6.01% in January this year.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: What are the major announcements made in Rajasthan Budget 2022-23?
text: In his 2022-23 Budget speech, Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot announced 50 units of free electricity for households consuming up to 100 units monthly. Chiranjeevi Yojana health insurance will be increased from ₹5 lakh to ₹10 lakh, he added. All state government employees appointed on or after January 1, 2004, will be entitled to the pension scheme like earlier, Gehlot stated.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: BharatPe sacks Ashneer's wife Madhuri amid funds misappropriation charges: Reports
text: BharatPe has reportedly terminated the services of Madhuri Jain, Head of Controls and wife of Co-founder Ashneer Grover. "Reasons for termination are misappropriation of funds and authorisation of inflated bills," Moneycontrol quoted a source as saying. Earlier, reports said Jain was named in a preliminary report by Alvarez and Marsal as directly connected to financial discrepancies at BharatPe.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: World's richest man Elon Musk dating 27-yr-old actress Natasha Bassett: Reports
text: Elon Musk, the 50-year-old Tesla CEO who's the world's richest man, is dating 27-year-old Australian actress Natasha Bassett, reports said. A few days ago, she was photographed leaving Musk's private jet in Los Angeles. Musk and Bassett were friends first and began dating after Musk's split with Canadian singer Grimes, with whom he had his son 'X Æ A-Xii'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Can't tolerate mudslinging by anyone: BharatPe's Rajnish on Ashneer's claims
text: BharatPe board Chairman Rajnish Kumar, in response to the letter by Co-founder Ashneer Grover that accused him of being biased and prejudiced amid a row over the governance review, said he cannot "tolerate this type of mudslinging by anyone". "Should...board members have any doubts about my impartiality in the matter, I have no intention to continue," Kumar added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: BharatPe accuses Ashneer of spreading false content, says it's 'unbecoming of an MD'
text: BharatPe has asked Co-founder Ashneer Grover to stop "spreading false and inflammatory content" about the firm's senior management. BharatPe said in a letter, "Your conduct...is completely unbecoming of a managing director." Earlier, Ashneer alleged that Bhavik Koladiya, one of the original Co-founders, used "foul language" on a call with him and that board Chairman Rajnish Kumar was with him.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ashneer's wife used BharatPe funds for beauty treatments, US & Dubai trips: Report
text: Madhuri Jain Grover, the wife of BharatPe's Co-founder Ashneer Grover, used company funds for personal beauty treatments, buying electronic items and family trips to the US and Dubai, reports said on Wednesday. She also allegedly paid her personal staff out of company accounts and produced fake invoices. BharatPe has fired Madhuri, the company's controller, on charges of misappropriation of funds.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ashneer should've shown maturity: BharatPe's Rajnish amid governance review row
text: Amid a row over the governance review at BharatPe, board Chairman Rajnish Kumar has said that Co-founder Ashneer Grover "should've shown maturity". "The whole strategy of Ashneer is to make out a case that governance review is biased against him," he alleged. Earlier, Ashneer in a letter to the board of BharatPe parent Resilient Innovations accused Rajnish of being biased.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ashneer's wife Madhuri posts videos of BharatPe officials allegedly drinking in office
text: After BharatPe's Head of Controls Madhuri Jain was fired, she tweeted videos of Suhail Sameer (CEO), Shashvat Nakrani (Co-founder) and other officials allegedly drinking and smoking in office. "Now you may indulge in...'drunken orgies' without having to wait for me...to leave office," Ashneer Grover's wife wrote. "You have no pain for what Ashneer...built...and you snatched," she said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Young entrepreneur shares pic with Ratan Tata, says 'Blessed to have him as mentor'
text: Arjun Deshpande, a young entrepreneur whose pharma startup Generic Aadhaar received investment from Ratan Tata, recently took to social media to share a picture with the Chairman Emeritus of Tata Sons. "In every meet, there are new learnings and motivation for me and I am truly blessed to have Ratan Tata Sir as my Mentor," Deshpande captioned the picture.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nykaa settles suit with L'Oreal over IP rights infringement after 2 yrs
text: Nykaa has announced the settlement of its 2019 litigation with L'Oreal. The France-based firm had filed a case against Nykaa over similarity in certain packaging causing an alleged IP rights infringement and obtained a restraining order, preventing Nykaa from using the packaging on its own brands. As per the settlement, the modified artwork adopted by Nykaa was approved by L'Oreal.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Russia's richest people lose $32 billion this year amid Ukraine crisis
text: The net worth of Russia's 23 billionaires has fallen by $32 billion to $343 billion so far this year amid the Ukraine crisis, as per Bloomberg. Gennady Timchenko, who's a close ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin, has seen his wealth disappear by almost a third this year. Meanwhile, Novatek shareholder Leonid Mikhelson's fortune has fallen by $6.2 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nooyi shares account from 2009 when both Obama, Manmohan Singh said 'she's one of us'
text: On President's Day that US observes, ex-PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi recalled meeting ex-PM Manmohan Singh and ex-US President Barack Obama in 2009. She shared an excerpt from her memoir, which read, "Obama began introducing the American team to his Indian counterpart. When he got to me...Singh exclaimed, 'Oh! But she's one of us!'" Obama responded, "She's one of us, too!"
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Reliance took 15 yrs to become a $1 bn company, 38 yrs to hit $200 bn: Ambani
text: Mukesh Ambani said, "It took Reliance 15 years to become a $1-billion company, 30 years to become a $10-billion company, 35 years to become a $100-billion company and 38 years to touch $200 billion." He added, "I foresee at least 20-30 new Indian energy and tech companies will grow as big as Reliance, if not bigger, in next 10-20 years."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air to hire 350 cabin crew, pilots by March 2023: Report
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Akasa Air is reportedly planning to hire over 300-350 cabin crew members and pilots by March 2023. The airline is offering 80% higher salaries to pilots than SpiceJet, ET reported. A spokesperson said pilot and cabin crew hiring is currently underway and the employee strength will depend on the level of the airline's network and operations.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ambani says 'India will emerge as global New Energy leader'; gives 3 reasons
text: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani said, "I have absolutely no doubt that India can, and India will emerge as a global New Energy leader." Ambani said, "First: India is a country full of entrepreneurial spirit, innovation and youth." He added, "Second: We now have a proactive and forward-looking policy, and third, our entrepreneurs now have assured financing options."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: UK woman whose boss shouted she 'must be in her menopause' wins ₹20 lakh payout
text: A 54-year-old woman named Leigh Best has been awarded over £20,000 (over ₹20 lakh) payout by an employment tribunal in the UK after her boss allegedly shouted she 'must be in her menopause'. The incident happened in March 2020 when her boss made the remark following an argument over an order mix-up. She was fired in May 2020.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Will visit IRS just to say hi: Musk as Warren discusses his taxes
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk, in response to US Senator Elizabeth Warren discussing his taxes on CNN, said, "Will visit IRS next time I'm in DC just to say hi, since I paid the most taxes ever in history for an individual last year." Warren had brought up Musk not having had paid anything in taxes in 2018 on the channel.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India to have 1 billion smartphone users by 2026: Deloitte study
text: India will have one billion smartphone users by 2026 with rural areas driving the sale of internet-enabled phones, according to a Deloitte study. India had 1.2 billion mobile subscribers in 2021, of which about 750 million are smartphone users, the study revealed. The country is poised to be the second-largest smartphone manufacturer in the next five years.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Strike against power privatisation in Chandigarh impacted telecom towers: COAI
text: The Cellular Operators Association of India (COAI) on Wednesday said that the strike by Chandigarh electricity department employees against power privatisation has impacted telecom towers, leading to disruption in mobile network connectivity. Chandigarh electricity department employees launched a three-day strike on Tuesday against the Union Territory administration’s decision to privatise it.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: Govt tracking crude prices to decide possible cut in fuel tax: FM
text: Government is keeping an eye on geopolitical developments affecting crude oil prices to take a call on a possible duty cut in fuel prices, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. This comes after Brent crude touched its seven-year high of $99.50/barrel amid rising Russia-Ukraine tensions. Indian fuel prices have remained unchanged for over two months despite rise in global oil prices.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tata Housing to invest ₹270 cr to develop 2 residential projects in Maldives
text: Tata Housing, a subsidiary of Tata Sons, said it will invest around ₹270 crore to develop two luxury residential projects at Nadhee and Odean, in Male, Maldives. The company will construct around 117 housing units with three bedroom apartments in these two projects. This is the second phase of Tata Housing's projects after completion of social housing project in Maldives.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Vistara to increase total staff count to 5,000 this year: CEO Vinod Kannan
text: Vistara plans to significantly increase its staff strength to 5,000 from the current 4,000 by the end of 2022 as it focuses on "increasing capacity utilisation", CEO Vinod Kannan said. "This will include everyone on Vistara's payroll and won't include outsourced third-party partners," he added. Vistara also plans to add 20 more aircraft by the end of 2023.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India's fuel demand expected to grow 5.5% next fiscal: Govt
text: India's fuel demand is likely to grow 5.5% in the fiscal year beginning April 1 as economic activity is getting back on track after COVID-19 pandemic, the Petroleum Planning and Analysis Cell (PPAC) said. Fuel consumption in 2022-23 is estimated to rise to 214.5 million tonnes from expected sales of 203.2 million tonnes in 2021-22, government estimates showed.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PMJJBY subscribers not eligible for shares at discounted rates: LIC
text: Subscribers of Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) are ineligible for shares at a discounted price in the upcoming LIC IPO, the insurer clarified on Tuesday. "It is a group insurance product and [PMJJBY policyholders] aren't eligible," LIC said in a statement. This comes after LIC Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said PMJJBY subscribers are eligible for discounted shares.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Snacks maker Bikaji Foods files IPO papers, founders to dilute stake
text: One of India's largest FMCG companies Bikaji Foods International has filed draft papers with markets regulator SEBI to raise funds via IPO. The company said it will offer for sale (OFS) 2.93 crore shares by its existing promoters and shareholders. The Indian snacks and sweets maker's Founders Shiv Ratan Agarwal and Deepak Agarwal will sell 25 lakh shares each.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Sanjeev Sanyal joins PM's Economic Advisory Council as full-time member
text: Noted economist Sanjeev Sanyal has been inducted as a full-time member of the Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM), the council's Chairman Bibek Debroy announced on Tuesday. Prior to this, Sanyal was serving as the Principal Economic Advisor in the Finance Ministry. The EAC-PM is an independent body that advises the Prime Minister on economic and related issues.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: There's a buzz for LIC IPO in market, going ahead with it: Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday said the government is going ahead with the Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) IPO amid concerns raised over rising Russia-Ukraine tensions. "There is a buzz in the market and there is interest for LIC IPO," she said. The way the IPO prospectus has been crafted has generated a lot of interest, Sitharaman added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: UK imposes sanctions on 5 key Russian banks, freezes assets of 3 Putin aides
text: The UK has announced the first sanctions against Russia in connection to the situation in Ukraine by targeting five key Russian banks and three allies of Russian President Vladimir Putin. The individuals targeted in the sanctions have a high net worth and any assets they have in the UK will be frozen, PM Boris Johnson said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Cadila Healthcare shares fall as Biological E's vaccine gets nod for 12-18 age group
text: Cadila Healthcare's shares fell over 3% on Tuesday after the Indian drug regulator DCGI granted emergency use approval to rival Biological E's COVID-19 vaccine Corbevax for children of 12-18 years age. Prior to this, Cadila Healthcare's ZyCoV-D and Bharat Biotech's Covaxin had received approval for use in adolescents. Corbevax is India's first indigenously developed RBD protein sub-unit vaccine.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Virgin Hyperloop fires half its staff as it switches from passenger travel to freight
text: Virgin Hyperloop has laid off almost half of its employees as the company developing the high-speed mass transportation system pivots from passenger travel to freight. The company confirmed to Financial Times that 111 employees were laid off on Friday. Backed by billionaire Richard Branson’s Virgin Group, Virgin Hyperloop conducted the first-ever test of Hyperloop technology with humans in 2020.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Porsches, Lamborghinis on ship burning mid-ocean may be worth ₹1,150 cr: Report
text: A fire on the ship off the coast of Portugal's Azores Islands, that broke out on February 16, is expected to generate at least $155 million (over ₹1,150 crore) in expected losses for Volkswagen, risk solutions company Russell Group has estimated. The ship was carrying Volkswagen group's Porsche, Audi, and Lamborghini vehicles. The ship was reportedly carrying over 4,000 cars.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ashneer files arbitration plea, calls BharatPe investigation against him illegal: Reports
text: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover filed an arbitration plea in the Singapore International Arbitration Centre claiming that BharatPe's investigation against him is illegal, ET and Livemint reported. He claims BharatPe kept the investigation opaque and gave him no chance to present his case. Grover also sought indemnity from any future action against him in his settlement talks with BharatPe.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Worst experience: Lido employee takes to social media amid reports of shutdown
text: Amid reports of edtech startup Lido Learning shutting its operations, one of its employees shared a post to talk about his "worst experience" in the industry. Rishabh Kumar wrote, "The company closed its business...without...any notice to anyone...Suddenly on February 4...the founder announced the organisation has no funds...and they're shutting it down. They have no funds to credit salaries."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Startup Lido Learning, backed by Ronnie Screwvala, shuts operations: Report
text: Edtech startup Lido Learning, backed by entrepreneur Ronnie Screwvala, Shaadi.com's Anupam Mittal, among others, has apparently shut operations. As per employees, Lido Learning's Founder Sahil Sheth informed them that the startup is going through financial constraints. Founded in 2019, the startup had raised $10 million in September last year in a round led by Screwvala's Unilazer Ventures.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IDFC FIRST Bank MD gifts shares worth ₹3.95 cr to driver, 4 others to buy houses
text: IDFC FIRST Bank MD and CEO V Vaidyanathan has gifted 9 lakh shares of the bank held by him worth ₹3.95 crore, to five individuals, including a driver and house help, to help them purchase homes. Additionally, the Rukmani Social Welfare Trust has disposed of 2 lakh equity shares to support social activities. Vaidyanathan is a trustee of Rukmani trust.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Air India flight gets water salute in Maldives for 46 yrs of air service
text: Air India on Monday shared a video of one of its flights receiving a water cannon salute on landing at Male airport in Maldives. The aircraft was welcomed to commemorate 46 years of air service between India and the Maldives. The airlines mentioned that the first flight between the two countries was operated from Thiruvananthapuram to Male in February 1976.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who are the 5 people to whom IDFC First Bank CEO gifted shares worth ₹3.95 cr?
text: IDFC First Bank CEO V Vaidyanathan on Monday gifted shares worth ₹3.95 crore to five people - his trainer Ramesh Raju, househelps Pranjal Narvekar and Santosh Jogale, driver Algarsamy C Munapar and office support staff Deepak Pathare, to purchase houses. In 2020, he gifted shares to his former mathematics teacher for lending him ₹500 when he was a broke student.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex crashes 1,000 points, Nifty below 16,900 amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
text: The Sensex tanked more than 1,000 points in early trade following a sell-off in global markets after Russia ordered deployment of troops in two breakaway regions in Ukraine. In the pre-opening session, the Sensex fell 1,245 points lower to 56,438.6, while the broader Nifty 50 plunged 359 points at 16,848. US stock index futures also tumbled amid the geopolitical tensions.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Indian investors lose ₹9.1 lakh crore amid Russia-Ukraine crisis since Feb 16
