text: The geopolitical tensions between Ukraine and Russia have eroded the market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies by ₹9.1 lakh crore since February 16, Moneycontrol reported. On Tuesday, the Indian benchmark indices crashed by around 2% after Russia recognised two breakaway regions in Ukraine as independent and ordered troop deployment there. The Sensex opened 1,245 points lower at 56,439.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Blackmailers circulating same complaints for 3 years: Indiabulls after ED searches
text: After the ED searched its premises in Mumbai, Indiabulls Housing Finance said that ED's case report was based on an FIR filed by Ashutosh Kamble, who's part of "the long-running extortion racket" against it. "The FIR is a copy-and-paste of earlier several patently false...and malicious complaints that blackmailers have been circulating for three years now," the company added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 'Growth' stocks like Meta, Apple, Amazon still not cheap: JP Morgan
text: Analysts at JP Morgan said that despite some sharp falls in the market over the last six months, tech-dominated "growth" stocks like Facebook (Meta), Apple, Amazon, Netflix and Google are "still not outright cheap". Talking about the Russia-Ukraine crisis, the analysts said it shouldn't drive a return to big tech names which were safe even during the COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Alibaba leads China tech stocks drop amid regulatory action fear
text: Alibaba led the decline in Chinese technology stocks following a Bloomberg report that authorities have begun another round of checks on its fintech business arm. The tech stocks have been dropping amid worries over Beijing's regulatory plans for the sector. The Hang Seng Tech Index fell over 3% on Tuesday, heading for the lowest close since its inception in 2020.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Swiggy preparing for $800 million IPO early next year: Report
text: Swiggy has started preparations to raise at least $800 million through an IPO early next year, the Nikkei reported. The food and grocery delivery platform reportedly plans to position itself as a logistics company and has begun adding independent directors to the board. Notably, Swiggy raised $700 million last month, reportedly doubling its valuation to $10.7 billion in six months.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Women reluctant to join company boards: Union Finance Minister
text: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said women are reluctant to join company boards. "I have actually made a lot of attempts on my own level as a minister in calling up some people and saying please would you not want to come to a board?" she said. "No, I have not had enough women coming," Sitharaman added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Officer's Choice whisky maker Allied Blenders picks banks for IPO: Report
text: Allied Blenders & Distillers, which makes Officer's Choice whisky, has chosen ICICI Securities and Axis Capital to manage its IPO, Bloomberg reported. The Mumbai-based company plans to file preliminary offer documents by April and is targeting to list as soon as this year. Bloomberg earlier reported that Allied Blenders is planning to raise as much as $300 million through IPO.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SC to hear Cyrus Mistry's petition against his removal from Tata Sons on Mar 9
text: A three-judge bench of the Supreme Court agreed to hear Cyrus Mistry's petition against the court's order upholding Mistry's removal from the position of Chairman of Tata Sons. The arguments on the review petition will be heard on March 9. Mistry alleged oppression of minority shareholders and said his removal from Tata Sons was an instance of such oppression.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Vedant Fashions shares fall below IPO price for 1st time since listing
text: Ethnic wear brand Manyavar's owner Vedant Fashions' shares fell below the IPO price for the first time since its listing on Tuesday. The stock listed at ₹936 on February 16 with gains of 8% from its issue price of ₹866 per share. The stock had hit a high of ₹993 on listing day and has declined nearly 16% since then.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Oil price hits highest level since 2014 amid Russia-Ukraine tensions
text: Crude oil price hit its highest level since 2014 on Tuesday pushing prices to near $100 per barrel as tensions between Russia and Ukraine escalated after Moscow ordered troops into two breakaway regions in eastern Ukraine. The global benchmark, Brent crude LCOc1, was up $3.48 at $98.87 at 09:00 GMT, having earlier reached $99.38, the highest since September 2014.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PMJJBY policyholders eligible for LIC IPO at discount: Chairman
text: Subscribers of Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) are eligible for LIC's upcoming IPO at a discount, Chairman MR Kumar said. PMJJBY is a pure term insurance policy available to people in the age group of 18-50 years for a premium of ₹330 per annum per subscriber. The LIC IPO may reportedly open for subscription from March 10-14.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Jet Airways appoints Ex-SriLankan Airlines CEO Vipula Gunatilleka as CFO
text: Jalan-Kalrock Consortium, the promoters of Jet Airways, have named former SriLankan Airlines CEO Vipula Gunatilleka as the airline's Chief Financial Officer (CFO). Gunatilleka has been tasked with reviving the grounded carrier and will take on the role from March 1. He is reportedly considered as a "turnaround specialist" and was hired by SriLankan Airlines for its restructuring in 2018.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt analysing whether SEBI took adequate measures in NSE case: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government is studying the National Stock Exchange (NSE) matter to see if SEBI has taken "necessary punitive" action over it. She added the government won't tolerate any doubt over the credibility of the institutions. Ex-NSE MD and CEO Chitra Ramkrishna is accused of providing confidential information to an "unidentified Himalayan Yogi".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Can't compare profits of insurers with manufacturing firms: LIC Chairman
text: LIC Chairman MR Kumar said that profits of insurance companies cannot be compared with manufacturing companies as dynamics of the businesses are "different". IPO-bound LIC has generated over ₹50,000 crore surplus in the past two years, out of which 95% goes to policyholder, he added. The remaining 5% may appear small but then it is not so, he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: My wife doesn't listen to me: Ashneer on wife wearing dress by designer he rejected
text: After Ashneer Grover's wife wore a dress designed by a 'Shark Tank' contestant he'd rejected, he addressed accusations of hypocrisy, saying, "Clearly my wife has a mind of her own and...doesn't listen to me." He said the designer left a dress for his wife Madhuri, adding, "I don't know what [she] liked, she wore it to 'The Kapil Sharma Show'."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bachchan family, Hema Malini and others attend Anmol Ambani's wedding
text: Actors Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan, Abhishek's sister Shweta Bachchan and Hema Malini were among the celebrities who attended the wedding of businessman Anil Ambani's son Anmol Ambani in Mumbai, on Sunday. Fashion designer Sandeep Khosla was also among the attendees. Philanthropist Pinky Reddy, the wife of GVK Group's GV Sanjay Reddy, also attended the wedding.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Amazon, Reliance to compete for IPL telecast rights for a record ₹50,000 cr: Report
text: Amazon and Reliance Industries are expected to take on Sony Group and Walt Disney's India units for exclusive five-year TV and digital broadcast rights of IPL, Reuters reported on Sunday. The cost to acquire these rights could run to a record ₹50,000 crore, the report added. Disney-owned Star India paid ₹16,348 crore in 2017 to have these rights until 2022.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Half of India's population under 25, suitable for Olympic Movement: Nita Ambani
text: Businesswoman and International Olympic Committee (IOC) member Nita Ambani said, "Nearly half of India's population, over 600 million people, are under 25 years of age." She added, "This makes India one of the most crucial and exciting places to nurture and grow the Olympic Movement." India will host the IOC Session in 2023 after 40 years.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 4 senior executives at Better.com resign amid reports of more layoffs in March
text: Four more senior executives of Better.com have resigned, three months after the company fired 900 employees over a Zoom call. The latest resignations include Clayton Carol, VP of Finance; Christian Wallace, Head of Real Estate; Paul Tyger, General Manager of Purchase; and Stephen Rosen, Head of Sales. Reports suggest that the company is preparing for a massive layoff next month.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: I don't use social media: Nilekani as he lists 3 devices he uses for work
text: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani in an interview revealed that he doesn't use social media. Speaking about the three modes he works with, he said, "In the create mode to work...I use a laptop...For the curate mode...or just browse, I use an iPad; and for...communication I use...phone." He added that he uses Twitter to broadcast information and not for discussions.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: China asks biggest state-owned banks to report exposure to Jack Ma's Ant Group: Report
text: Chinese authorities have asked the biggest state-owned firms and banks to conduct thorough checks on their financial exposure and other links to billionaire Jack Ma's Ant Group and report the findings, reported Bloomberg. This is reportedly the most thorough and wide-ranging scrutiny into Ant's deals. In 2020, China suspended Ant's $35-billion IPO that was set to be the world's largest.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Woman told to remove hijab at UCO Bank branch in Bihar, bank responds
text: A Muslim woman was allegedly asked to remove her hijab for withdrawing money at a UCO Bank branch in Bihar's Begusarai and a video of the same also went viral online. UCO Bank responded to the video by saying it "respects the religious sentiments of citizens...doesn't discriminate...on basis of caste or religion". It said it's checking facts on the issue.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Who is Anmol Ambani's wife Khrisha Shah?
text: Businessman Anil Ambani and Tina Ambani's son Anmol Ambani has got married to Khrisha Shah. According to reports, Shah was born and brought up in Mumbai and is a social worker and entrepreneur. She founded Dysco, a social network company. She was earlier an employee of Accenture in the UK and later returned to India to become an entrepreneur.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Fraudster Madoff's sister, her husband found dead in apparent murder-suicide in US
text: The sister of late Bernie Madoff, who was convicted of masterminding the world's largest Ponzi scheme, and her husband have been found dead in Florida. Sondra Wiener, 87, and her husband Marvin were found with gunshot wounds, the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office said, adding that it appeared to be a murder-suicide. Madoff died aged 82 in US prison last year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vedanta makes oil discovery in Rajasthan's Barmer
text: Vedanta in a statement said, "We've informed the Petroleum Ministry of an Oil Discovery (named 'Durga') in our exploratory well in Rajasthan's Barmer." The block where the discovery was made was awarded to Vedanta in October 2018 and is one of the 41 blocks awarded to it in OALP-I round of bidding. Vedanta holds 100% participating interest in the block.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt to 'scrupulously' carry out background check of Air India's new CEO: Report
text: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) will "scrupulously" carry out a thorough background check of Air India's new CEO and MD Ilker Ayci, a Turkish national, PTI reported. Tata Group named Turkish Airlines' former Chairman Ayci as Air India's CEO. MHA carries out a thorough background check of all foreign nationals when they're appointed in the key positions, PTI added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Anil Ambani's son Anmol Ambani marries Khrisha Shah in Mumbai, pic surfaces
text: Businessman Anil Ambani and Tina Ambani's son Anmol Ambani got married to Khrisha Shah in Mumbai.  GVK Vice Chairman GV Sanjay Reddy's wife Pinky Reddy took to Instagram to share photos from the event. Several personalities including actors Amitabh Bachchan, Jaya Bachchan, Abhishek Bachchan and NCP MP Supriya Sule attended the wedding.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Dr Lal PathLabs, Metropolis and other labs' shares fall as COVID-19 eases
text: The shares of listed Indian clinical labs including Dr Lal PathLabs and Metropolis Healthcare have fallen at least 30% this year as COVID-19 testing reduced due to the easing of the outbreak. The stock of Thyrocare Technologies has already lost a fifth of its value in 2022. Shares of these companies had at least doubled in the previous two years.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Some businesses I invested in had terrible products: Shark Tank's Ghazal
text: Ghazal Alagh of 'Shark Tank India' has said certain businesses that she invested in turned out to have terrible products. "There have been deals where you...loved their products, but then you...checked those products [on internet] and you go like, 'What do you do now'," she said. "Now [if] products don't have a good rating, it is your problem," she added.
author: Ramanpreet Singh Virdi

headlines: Govt gets 5 proposals worth ₹1.5 lakh crore for chip, display plants
text: The government has received five applications for the establishment of semiconductor and display plants under its ₹76,000 crore PLI scheme. The Ministry of Electronics and IT said the companies have proposed to invest a total of $20.5 billion (₹1.53 lakh crore). Vedanta-Foxconn JV, IGSS Ventures and ISMC have proposed to set up semiconductor plants with a total $13.6 billion investment.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Digital-asset universe can benefit from the 'crypto winter': Ethereum Co-Founder
text: Vitalik Buterin, the Co-Founder of the Ethereum blockchain, has said that the digital-asset universe can benefit from the 'crypto winter'. "The winters are the time when a lot of those applications fall away and you can see which projects are actually long-term sustainable," said Buterin. Crypto winter refers to a prolonged bearish period where asset prices fall over many months.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Tata Technologies to hire 1,000 more people in FY 2023: CEO
text: Tata Technologies will hire at least 1,000 more people in FY2023 than its planned recruitment of over 3,000 innovators over 12 months under its expanded talent acquisition program, said CEO Warren Harris. "That speaks to the fact that increasingly, we are not opportunities constrained," he added. The company had announced its decision to recruit over 3,000 people in January.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: PharmEasy parent gets SEBI's approval for ₹6,250 crore IPO
text: PharmEasy parent API Holdings has received the Securities and Exchange Board of India's (SEBI) approval for its ₹6,250 crore initial public offering (IPO). According to the company's draft papers, the proceeds will be used to prepay or repay an outstanding debt of ₹1,929 crore. The offer is entirely a fresh issue and its founders and investors will not sell shares.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt to create equity fund for startups with 20% limited stake: MoS IT
text: The government will create an equity fund for startups with a 20% limited stake, the Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar said at an event conducted by the Confederation of Indian Industry. The fund will be managed by private fund managers, Chandrasekhar said, adding that "this will create required private equity capital as an addition to what exists today".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Union Budget will help in implementing National Education Policy: PM
text: Union Budget will help in implementing the National Education Policy, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday. "National Digital University is an unprecedented step. The problem of shortage of seats can be resolved. There will be unlimited seats. I urge all the stakeholders to ensure digital uni starts as soon as possible," PM Modi added.
author: Sakshi Sharma

headlines: New policy to cut green hydrogen cost by 40-50%: India's largest oil firm IOC
text: India's largest oil firm Indian Oil Corporation (IOC) has said that the offer to waive transmission charges on green energy will help cut the cost of manufacturing green hydrogen by 40-50%. The cost will go down further if electrolyzers are indigenously manufactured instead of the present practice of importing them, said Director for Research & Development S.S.V. Ramakumar.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Future Retail pays $14 mn interest on USD notes in grace period
text: Future Retail has paid $14 million for interest due on the dollar-denominated notes (USD notes) listed on Singapore stock exchange after missing the due date last month. The company told the NSE last month that it had 30 days to make the payment. Future Retail had cited continued impact of COVID-19 and its financial situation as reasons for missing payment.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Investors shouldn't worry about govt control post IPO: LIC Chairman
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said potential investors shouldn't worry about government control post LIC's IPO as the insurance company's decisions are taken by the board, not the government. He added that LIC is well-capitalised and that he doesn't believe it requires capital at the moment.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Credit Suisse denies alleged wrongdoing after client data gets leaked
text: Credit Suisse said it "strongly rejects" allegations of wrongdoing after media outlets published findings of investigations into a leak of data on the bank's accounts. The bank allegedly has human rights abusers and businessmen who had been placed under sanctions as its clients. The bank said about 90% of the reviewed accounts are either closed or in process of closure.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India growing at 9.2%, among fastest-growing large economies: NITI Aayog CEO
text: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Monday said the Indian economy is growing at 9.2% and is among the fastest-growing large economies in the world. "Today, India is witnessing unprecedented levels of economic development and technological disruptions," he said. The Centre's Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme will add $520 billion to India's output in the next five years, Kant said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: IPO-bound LIC may not sell entire stake in IDBI Bank: Chairman
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) Chairman MR Kumar on Monday said the IPO-bound insurance company may not sell its entire stake in IDBI Bank. LIC may use the bank's large network of branches to market its insurance services, Kumar said. "[IDBI Bank] has been the strongest contributor to the bancassurance channel for us," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ex-Police Commissioner criticises 'Gehraiyaan', Mazumdar-Shaw says 'Watch whole film'
text: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner Bhaskar Rao criticised 'Gehraiyaan' and tweeted, "We started watching [it], 20 minutes later, stopped." "I'm fan of Deepika...she's idolized by millions...Extramarital and destruction of home...Wrong message. Am I old fashioned[?]" he said. "Watch the whole film it's really well made with...twists," Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw replied.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: We'll have another pandemic with a different virus: World's 4th richest person Gates
text: World's fourth richest person and Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates told CNBC that the risks of severe disease from COVID-19 have "dramatically reduced" but "we'll have another pandemic". "It will be a different pathogen next time," he said. Gates added, "The cost of being ready for the next pandemic is not that large. It's not like climate change."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which countries are preferred by India's millionaires for their kids' education?
text: As per the Hurun India Wealth Report 2021, 70% of India's millionaires that were surveyed preferred sending their children abroad for education. Of these, 29% preferred the US for their kids' education, 19% preferred the UK, 12% preferred New Zealand and Germany found favour with 11%, the report said. Mumbai has the most number of millionaire households at 20,300.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Which are now the world's 10 most valuable firms as Meta loses ranking?
text: Apple is the world's most valuable company with $2.8-trillion market value, followed by Microsoft with $2.2 trillion, as per Bloomberg. Aramco, Alphabet, Amazon and Tesla rank between 3rd and 6th with a market value of $2 trillion, $1.8 trillion, $1.6 trillion and $905.7 billion, respectively. Tencent now ranks 10th after Meta fell to the 11th position with $565.4-billion market value.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tesla may accept Dogecoin as payment at Supercharger stations in future, hints Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said in future Tesla charging stations may be able to accept Dogecoin as payment. Ryan Zohoury, founder of Tesla Console, tweeted, "Ten minutes after...new Santa Monica Superchargers opened and they're already almost full!" while tagging Musk. "And futuristic diner/ drive-in theater planned for Hollywood area! And of course, you can pay in Ðoge," Musk replied.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: SEBI proposes new disclosure norms for IPOs of loss-making firms
text: SEBI has proposed to tighten disclosure standards for new-age technology companies that are planning to list their shares but don't fulfil the three-year profitability track. As per its proposal, such companies will have to disclose more details about how they arrived upon their IPO price. This comes as shares of several firms, including Paytm and Zomato, plunged post their listing.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: You must learn different ways to plait your hair: 'Yogi' told ex-NSE chief Chitra
text: In a detailed order released by SEBI against former NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna and others, some of her e-mail conversations with the 'Himalayan yogi' have been revealed. In one of the emails, the ‘yogi’ wrote, "Today you are looking awesome. You must learn different ways to plait your hair which will make your looks interesting and appealing!! Just free advice."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Met 'yogi' 20 yrs ago on banks of Ganges: Ex-NSE chief Chitra Ramkrishna told SEBI
text: Former NSE chief  Chitra Ramkrishna, who was questioned by the CBI over allegations of sharing information with a 'Himalayan Yogi', met the latter 20 years ago on the banks of the Ganges. Calling him a "spiritual force", Ramkrishna told SEBI that he gave her his email address for further communication which she used for personal and professional matters.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Names of 3 Indian cities with the most millionaire households released by Hurun
text: As per the Hurun India Wealth Report 2021, Mumbai has the highest number of millionaire households in India, followed by Delhi and then Kolkata. The report defines such households as those that have a net worth of at least ₹7 crore. It further said that such households have increased by 11% to 4,58,000 households, as compared to last year.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Planning Seychelles trip, we can enjoy sea bath: 'Yogi' to ex-NSE CEO in e-mail
text: As per e-mail correspondence shared by SEBI between ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna and an unknown 'yogi', the latter planned a trip to Seychelles with her. "Keep bags ready I'm planning a [trip] to Seychelles...will try if you can come...If you know swimming...we could enjoy a sea bath in Seychelles and rest on the beach," the 'yogi' wrote to Ramkrishna.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: I'm prepared for failure: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala on starting Akasa Air
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala at the CII Real Estate Confluence 2022 said, "Lots of people have questioned why I've started an airline. I said I'm prepared for failure." He added, "It's not that I have bet my life on it or I have mortgaged my wife's jewellery and done it." He further said he hopes to prove his critics wrong.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Hurun survey shows brands preferred by Indian millionaires; Mercedes top car brand
text: As per Hurun India Luxury Consumer Survey 2021, high net worth individuals' most-preferred luxury car brand is Mercedes-Benz and luxury sports car brand is Lamborghini. Their most-preferred hospitality brand is Taj, followed by Oberoi. Rolex is the most-preferred luxury watch brand, Tanishq is the most-preferred Indian jewellery brand and Louis Vuitton is the most preferred luxury goods brand.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: IndiGo Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal resigns from board, will cut down stake
text: IndiGo operator InterGlobe Aviation Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal has resigned as Non-Executive Director from the company's board with immediate effect. In his resignation letter, Gangwal wrote, "I've been a long-term shareholder...for more than 15 years and it's only natural to...think about diversifying one's holdings." He said he plans to reduce his stake in IndiGo "over the next 5 plus years".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Apple investors urged to vote against Tim Cook's $99 mn pay package
text: Apple shareholders have been urged by Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) to vote against the $98.7 million pay package awarded to CEO Tim Cook last year. The advisory firm has cited concerns around the magnitude of Cook's equity award, adding that "half of the award lacks performance criteria". The package includes $3 million in salary and $82.3 million in stock awards.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Berkshire had no prior knowledge of Microsoft-Activision deal: Buffett
text: Billionaire Warren Buffett said his company Berkshire Hathaway, which invested in Activision Blizzard last year, "had no prior knowledge" that Microsoft was planning to acquire the video game maker. Berkshire held nearly 14.7 million shares in Activision Blizzard as of December 31. The stock purchase was made ahead of Activision's $69-billion deal with Microsoft, which was announced in January.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Ford Motor exploring ways to run EV business separately: Report
text: Ford Motor is reportedly considering ways to separate its electric-vehicle operation from its 118-year-old legacy business. CEO Jim Farley has considered spinning off Ford's EV operations or its internal combustion engine business, Bloomberg reported citing sources. Since splitting the firm may be difficult, Ford could separate EV business internally under a broad reorganisation, the report said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tesla changes S Korea ad as probe finds exaggerated claims on battery
text: Tesla changed an advertisement on its South Korean website about the driving range for its Model 3 after an antitrust regulator found that it exaggerated the specifications of its batteries. The description of Tesla's Model 3 was changed to say the vehicle is capable of travelling a "maximum" of 528 kilometres on a single charge, from "more than" 528 kilometres.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: BBMP invites suggestions from public for upcoming Budget for B'luru
text: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has invited suggestions and instructions of the public for the upcoming Budget 2022-23 for the city. BBMP said that a suggestion box has been placed near the BBMP office and said that general public can give their suggestions through the box. Bengaluru's Budget is usually announced 15 days after the state Budget is presented.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Foreign COVID vaccine firms can do business here, but on India's terms: Govt
text: Union Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said that major foreign COVID-19 vaccine manufacturers were demanding indemnity and sovereign immunity waiver to supply vaccines in India. The government made it clear that they are welcome to do business here but on "India's terms", he added. The conditions put forth by these companies strengthened India's plan of developing indigenous vaccines, he further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Retail inflation for farm, rural workers rises to 5.49%, 5.74% in Jan
text: Retail inflation for farm workers rose to 5.49%, while that of rural labourers rose to 5.74% in January, mainly due to higher prices of certain food items, official data showed. Food inflation for farm workers stood at 4.15% and for rural labourers at 4.33% in January 2022 compared to 2.99% and 3.17%, respectively, in the previous month.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India signs its first-ever bilateral free trade agreement with UAE
text: India and the UAE signed their first-ever bilateral free trade agreement on Friday. The Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) is expected to raise the total trade up to $100 billion in the next 5-years and will cut import duties on various products while boosting the export of jewellery and apparel. Notably, UAE is India's third-largest trading partner.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Traders object after Delhi's Palika Bazaar named in US' notorious markets list
text: Palika Bazaar Association has objected after the Delhi market was named in the US' Notorious Markets List of 2021 for allegedly selling counterfeit products. It demanded to drop the market's name from the list, condemning the "false allegations". The list identified 35 physical markets globally that are "reported to engage in or facilitate substantial trademark counterfeiting or copyright piracy".
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Air passenger traffic falls by 17% in January to 64 lakh: DCGA
text: Air passenger traffic for January 2022 went down by 17% at 64.08 lakh passengers compared to January 2021, as per DGCA data. This was 43% lower as compared to December last year. The passenger load factor (PLF) of SpiceJet was at 73.4% followed by IndiGo at 66.6%. IndiGo was the largest airline with 55.5% market share in January.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt focusing on making gem, jewellery sector self-reliant: Piyush Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said that India needs a "self-reliant" gem and jewellery sector and the government is focusing towards helping boost both domestic as well as export growth. The proposed policies in Budget 2022 will help facilitate exports through e-commerce, Goyal added. The sector contributes 7% to the GDP and employs around 50 lakh people, he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Boards fail when they allow CEOs to be imperial: Indra Nooyi
text: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi at the NASSCOM Technology and Leadership Forum 2022 said that when boards allow CEOs to be imperial, they fail in their duties. "There are many CEOs, mostly men who are imperial, because...the belief is that when you become CEO, you've been anointed...king," Nooyi added. "That's not what people expect from the CEO," she further said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India-UAE trade pact to help jewellery sector get export boost: Commerce Secy
text: Commerce Secretary BVR Subrahmanyam said that India's jewellery sector will get a huge export boost after the India-UAE trade pact as it will now get duty-free access in the UAE market. The gulf nation will also get greater access to the gold market here as India will give duty concessions on imports of up to 200 tonnes/year, he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: I hope you change your mind: Poonawalla to Djokovic on COVID-19 vaccination
text: Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla on Thursday tweeted to Novak Djokovic about the tennis player's view on COVID-19 vaccination. "I respect your views on not getting vaccinated and love watching you play, but I hope you change your mind," tweeted Poonawalla. Djokovic has said that he'd rather miss tournaments than be forced to get a COVID-19 vaccine.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Meta falls from ranks of world's 10 most valuable companies
text: Meta Platforms, formerly known as Facebook, fell out of the world’s 10 largest companies by market value after it closed on Thursday with a value of $565 billion, as per Bloomberg. On February 3, the company announced a drop in its daily active user base for the first time ever, which then wiped out $240 billion from its market capitalization.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Bill Gates makes his first-ever visit to Pakistan, eats lunch with PM Imran Khan
text: Microsoft Co-founder and the world's fourth-richest person, Bill Gates, is on his first-ever visit to Pakistan. Gates on Thursday called on Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan and was briefed about efforts to tackle the coronavirus pandemic and eradicate poliovirus from the country. The Pakistan PM also hosted a luncheon in honour of Bill Gates.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I became the world's richest man for 7 minutes, overtook Elon Musk: YouTuber
text: UK-based YouTuber Max Fosh claimed he overtook Elon Musk as the world's richest person for seven minutes. In a video, he explained how he registered a new company 'Unlimited Money Limited' with 10 billion shares and priced them at £50 each, valuing his company at £500 billion ($680 billion). Later, he dissolved the company after being "accused of fraudulent activity".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bill Gates conferred Pakistan's second-highest civilian award on his first-ever visit
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates was conferred the Hilal-e-Pakistan award by Pakistan President Arif Alvi for his contribution to "eradication of polio and the betterment of the people" of the country. The award, which is Pakistan's second-highest civilian award, was given to Gates on his first-ever visit to Pakistan. PM Imran Khan also hosted a luncheon in honour of Gates.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ashneer's wife says BharatPe board accepted a resignation she never tendered: Report
text: BharatPe's Head of Controls and Ashneer Grover's wife Madhuri Jain Grover has reportedly written to the company's board, alleging she never tendered the resignation it had accepted. BharatPe told ET it "never sought any resignation" from Jain and hence its acceptance of such "doesn't arise". "She was asked to go on compulsory leave of absence on January 20," BharatPe said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I don't drink but anything habit-forming is good business: Shark Tank's Ashneer Grover
text: Shark Tank judge and BharatPe Co-Founder Ashneer Grover said he never drinks but he thinks that "anything habit-forming is good business". "Bira (craft beer company) has been my biggest portfolio investment...I've been investing in the company for five years," he revealed during a talk show. Grover said he invested in 'In a Can' because it had "potential to develop habits".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ship carrying thousands of luxury cars to US catches fire, drifts in sea without crew
text: A 650-foot-long Panama-flagged cargo ship carrying thousands of new Volkswagen Group vehicles from Germany to the US caught fire earlier this week. Its 22 crew members were evacuated from Felicity Ace near Portugal, but the burning ship continued to drift in the Atlantic Ocean on Thursday. The ship reportedly carried nearly 4,000 cars including 1,100 Porches and 189 Bentleys.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: LIC likely to launch ₹59,760 crore IPO on March 11: Reports
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India is expected to launch its IPO at $8 billion (₹59,760 crore)  on March 11, three sources have informed Reuters. LIC’s IPO is expected to be India’s largest-ever public issue. As per reports, the shares of LIC could be priced between ₹2,000-2,100 each, where 10% of the total offer size will be reserved for policyholders.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: CBI questions ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, accused of sharing info with 'yogi'
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation is questioning former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna amid the controversy that she shared confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi'. It has also issued a Look Out circular against her, Ravi Narain and former COO Anand Subramanian. The questioning comes a day after raids were conducted by the Income Tax department on Ramkrishna's office and residence.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IndiaMART, Delhi's Palika, 3 other Indian markets on US' list of notorious markets
text: E-commerce website IndiaMART and four Indian markets, including Delhi's Palika Bazaar and Tank Road, have featured on US' Notorious Markets List of 2021. The other two markets are Mumbai's Heera Panna and Kolkata's Kidderpore. The list identified 42 online and 35 physical markets in the world that are "reported to engage in or facilitate substantial trademark counterfeiting or copyright piracy".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk posts meme comparing Canada PM to Hitler, deletes it later
text: Elon Musk on Wednesday posted a meme comparing Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau with Adolf Hitler. Musk shared an image of the former German dictator, with text that read, "Stop comparing me to Justin Trudeau. I had a budget." The meme was shared by Musk in response to an article detailing Trudeau's order sanctioning crypto wallets associated with truckers' protests.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: My father, Tatas, Winston Churchill: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala on his role models
text: At a CII event, billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala shared that his father is his "first role model" for giving him "morals, thoughts, guts and curiosity". His second role model is the house of Tatas and third is ex-British PM Winston Churchill for "tenacity and sheer guts". The 61-year-old added that he looked up to American billionaire George Soros for trading.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: $26 bn wiped off Meituan's m-cap after China asks food delivery apps to cut fees
text: Shares of Chinese food delivery giant Meituan fell the most in nearly seven months on Friday, wiping out $26 billion from its market capitalisation. The development came after the Chinese government issued guidelines asking online food delivery platforms to reduce fees for restaurants in regions hit by COVID-19 pandemic. The benchmark Hang Seng Index closed 1.9% lower on Friday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Visa, Amazon agree to end dispute over credit card fees
text: Visa credit cards will be accepted at all Amazon stores and sites as part of a global agreement, the payments giant said. Earlier, Amazon said it would stop accepting payments made via Visa credit cards issued in the UK, citing high transaction fees, but later halted the plan. Both the companies were in talks to resolve the dispute over fees.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Buffett, who called crypto 'rat poison', invests $1 bn in crypto-friendly bank
text: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway recently bought a $1 billion stake in Brazil-based digital neobank NuBank. Even though NuBank does not allow crypto trading, its investment unit NuInvest lets users dabble in crypto and bitcoin exchange-traded fund. Buffett had earlier said crypto is "probably rat poison squared" and "has no unique value at all".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Didn't expect from you: FM as Manmohan criticises govt's economic policy
text: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday reacted to former PM Manmohan Singh's comments about the government's handling of the economy. "I have great regards for you (Singh). I did not expect this from you," Sitharaman said. She added that Singh was more remembered for having brought India to "fragile five" and rampant inflation during his tenure.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Air travel may get costlier as jet fuel prices hit record high
text: Air travel may get costlier as oil marketing companies raised the aviation turbine fuel (ATF) prices by 5.2% on Wednesday hitting a record high. This is the fourth hike in ATF prices in less than two months following a spike in global oil prices. Currently, India has some of the world's highest rates of taxation on the ATF.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Housing prices rise by 6%, sales rise by 7% in B'luru in 2021: Report
text: According to a report by property brokerage firm PropTiger.com, the housing prices increased by 6% in Bengaluru in 2021. The report 'Real Insight Residential- Annual Round-up 2021' further stated that the housing sales increased by 7% in Bengaluru last year. "It seems very likely that we will see an increase in prices in 2022," said Rajan Sood, PropTiger.com's Business Head.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Housing price rise by 7%, sales rise by 36% in Hyd in 2021: Report
text: Hyderabad housing markets witnessed the growth of 7% in annual price hike in 2021, a report by PropTiger stated. Hyderabad also reported a 36% rise in housing sales during 2021, with Bachupally, Tellapur and Miyapur reported to be the most preferred localities by homebuyers. Reportedly, the average per square foot rate of housing projects in Hyderabad now stands at ₹5,900-₹6,100.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: Biggest coal miner Coal India warns output may fall without price hike
text: World's biggest coal miner Coal India has warned that production may fall if the company isn't able to raise prices on an "urgent" basis. The company said it's facing cost pressures from a rise in salaries and on higher prices of diesel used to power mine equipment. Over 70% of electricity generation in India is done by Coal India.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 50% of our staff from India, country's role growing: Capgemini CEO
text: Over 50% staff in Capgemini are from India and the nation's role in the company is only growing as it becomes a big centre of innovation, said the French IT firm CEO Aiman Ezzat. As of December 2021, the company's total headcount stood at 324,700. "In future, there will probably be more Indian senior executives overall in Capgemini,'' he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Q3 results reflected true performance, drawn with full transparency: SpiceJet
text: The SpiceJet said that company's Q3 results reflected its true performance and ''these have been drawn with full transparency''. This comes after many attributed SpiceJet's profit to the compensation received from Boeing for the grounding of its 13 Boeing MAX aircrafts. SpiceJet reported a net profit of ₹42.5 crore in Q3 after reporting loss in the past seven consecutive quarters.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: CBI questions ex-ABG Shipyard CMD in India's biggest bank fraud case
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) recently questioned former ABG Shipyard Chairman and MD Rishi Agarwal in connection with its probe into the country's largest bank fraud case. CBI has also issued lookout circulars against Directors of the company to ensure they do not leave the country. ABG Shipyard allegedly cheated a consortium of banks of ₹22,842 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India, UAE may sign free trade agreement on Feb 18: Reports
text: India and UAE may reportedly sign a proposed free trade agreement, which would give both countries duty-free access to a number of products from different sectors, on February 18. PM Narendra Modi and the Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi will hold a Virtual Summit on Friday. This would be second such agreement to be signed by the current government.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India's mobile subscriber count fell by 1.28 cr in Dec 2021: TRAI
text: The mobile user count in India fell by 1.28 crore in December 2021 compared to the previous month, TRAI data showed. Reliance Jio lost about 1.29 crore wireless subscribers bringing its user base to 41.57 crore whereas Vodafone Idea lost 16.14 lakh mobile subscribers bringing user base to 26.55 crore. In contrast, Airtel gained 4.75 lakh customers in December 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: He's best man for the CEO job: Quess Corp Chairman on Srinivasan
text: India's largest staffing firm Quess Corp's chairman Ajit Isaac praised the appointment of new CEO Guruprasad Srinivasan and called him the "best man for the job". Last week, Srinivasan took charge as MD & CEO of Quess, replacing Suraj Moraje, who announced his sudden exit from the company. Quess stock declined after the news even after posting strong Q3 performance.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Navi US Total Stock Market Fund of Fund NFO closes on Feb 18
text: Navi Mutual Fund announced that its latest NFO closes tomorrow. It stated that this Fund of Fund will invest in units of Vanguard Total Stock Market ETF, world's 3rd-largest ETF, that represents almost entire investable US stock market. With total expense ratio of 0.06% (subject to change within overall 1% limit), the NFO is available on Groww, Coin, among others.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Offering myself for auction as a star player, jokes Anand Mahindra on Pillow Fight C'ship
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a video about the PFC Pillow Fight Championship which recently took place in the US. He jokingly wrote, "I am offering myself for auction as a star player for this league. After a holiday with my 4-year-old grandson, I think I’m fit, trained & ready to fight! Opening bid: ₹50,000."
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Infosys to hire 55,000 or more freshers in FY23: CEO Salil Parekh
text: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh said, "We will recruit 55,000 college graduates in this financial year, and we will hire that or a higher number next year." Of the 55,000 people Infosys is hiring this year, 52,000 are from India. Parekh added, "We want to reskill our employees and make them career-ready for what they can do with the new technologies."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: In 2009, billionaire Munger said Tesla would fail: World's richest man Musk
text: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person, Elon Musk, recalled a 2009 incident when billionaire Charlie Munger described "all the ways" in which his company Tesla would fail. "Made me quite sad, but I told him I agreed with all those reasons...but it was worth trying anyway," tweeted Musk. He was responding to Munger calling for a ban on cryptocurrency.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I'm heartbroken, we fell short of expectations: Vistara CEO to customers
text: Vistara CEO Vinod Kannan has written an open letter to customers where he admitted that the airline fell short of customers' expectations "in the last few months". "Knowing that you have been inconvenienced and disappointed with our services has been heartbreaking for me," he added. Addressing flight disruptions and Vistara's app and website issues, he said, "Grievances haven't gone unnoticed."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla needs to buy $500 million of local parts in India to get import tax cut: Report
text: The government reportedly wants Elon Musk-led Tesla to source at least $500 million worth of auto parts from India for it to be eligible for import tax cuts on electric vehicles. Tesla can start at a lower base but needs to ramp up Indian parts purchases by 10-15% a year until a satisfactory level is achieved, Bloomberg reported citing sources.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ratan Tata honoured with Assam's highest civilian award; CM shares pics
text: Tata Trusts Chairman Ratan Tata was on Wednesday honoured with Assam's highest civilian award, 'Assam Baibhav', by Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma. "The visionary industrialist and philanthropist has made exceptional contribution towards furthering cancer care in Assam," the Assam CM said. The award carries a citation, a medal and a cash amount of ₹5 lakh.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Dated Brent, main price benchmark for physical crude, hits $100 amid Ukraine crisis
text: Dated Brent reached $100.80/barrel on Wednesday for the first time since September 2014 amid Russia-Ukraine tensions, according to S&P Global Platts. The dated Brent crude oil benchmark, which refers to the price of cargoes bought and sold in North Sea, sets a baseline for over half the world's physical crude cargoes. A Bloomberg report called it "world's most-important oil price".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Mohandas Pai argue on Twitter over 'yogi ran NSE' report
text: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw and Infosys' former CFO Mohandas Pai engaged in an argument on Twitter over a SEBI report that claimed a Himalayan yogi influenced former National Stock Exchange (NSE) MD Chitra Ramkrishna's decisions. "No yogi ran NSE! Please stop spreading such falsehoods," tweeted Pai. In response, Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "So do we junk the SEBI report?"
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor gets bail in ₹300-crore fraud case
text: A special PMLA Court in Mumbai on Wednesday granted bail to Yes Bank Co-founder Rana Kapoor and Avantha Group's Gautam Thapar in an alleged fraud case of over ₹300 crore. ED claimed Kapoor obtained a bungalow in a prime location in Delhi after Thapar's firm was extended a loan. However, both will remain in jail in connection with other cases.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: Australian whisky firm's CEO quits after video shows him smoking meth pipe
text: The CEO of Australia's largest listed whisky company has resigned after a video in which he appeared to be smoking a methamphetamine pipe became public. An Australian newspaper reported that Lark Distilling's Geoff Bainbridge was seen "fondling himself in skimpy black underwear" and making sexual remarks. Bainbridge said he's been a "victim of extortion" due to this video for years.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's largest FMCG company HUL hikes prices twice in 2 months
text: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL), India's largest fast-moving consumer goods (FMCG) company, has undertaken another round of price hikes across product categories. This is the second price hike by the company in two months. The move is in line with the management's commentary after December quarter earnings, wherein it indicated "calibrated price hikes" as it expected higher input price inflation.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ex-NSE MD accused of sharing info with Himalayan 'yogi' raided by I-T dept: Reports
text: The income tax (I-T) department on Thursday conducted searches at the Mumbai residence of former Managing Director of the National Stock Exchange (NSE), Chitra Ramkrishna, reports said. This comes days after market regulator SEBI alleged that Ramkrishna shared confidential information about NSE with an unknown Himalayan 'yogi'. She was fined ₹3 crore for violating securities contract rules.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: LIC to raise ₹65,400 crore in India's largest-ever IPO: Reports
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India is reportedly looking to raise ₹65,400 crore through its IPO, which will be India's largest-ever public issue. Shares of LIC could be priced between ₹2,000-2,100 each, with discounts to some retail investors, BloombergQuint reported citing sources. The IPO may open for subscription from March 10-14, if approvals come on time, the report said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Industrialist Rahul Bajaj's memorial to be set up in Pimpri-Chinchwad
text: Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has decided to set up a memorial of former Bajaj Group Chairman and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj, who passed away last week. "Bajaj contributed immensely to development of Pimpri-Chinchwad," the standing committee chairman said. "Had it not been for the initiative of Rahul Bajaj, Pimpri-Chinchwad would have never become internationally known," he added.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: President of B'luru's Raghavendra Bank arrested in money laundering case
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested K Ramakrishna, the President of a Bengaluru-based cooperative bank, Sri Guru Raghavendra Sahakara Bank Niyamitha, in a money-laundering case. The case is linked to the alleged misappropriation of public funds worth ₹1,000 crore. ED alleged the bank officials siphoned off the money deposited by the public. They reportedly cheated over 40,000 depositors.
author: Dharini Mudgal

headlines: RBI cancels Mantha Urban Cooperative Bank's licence citing weak financials
text: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Wednesday cancelled Mantha Urban Cooperative Bank's licence citing inadequate capital and earning prospects and asked it to cease banking operations from February 16. RBI has requested Maharashtra's Cooperation Commissioner to issue an order for winding up the bank. The continuance of the bank is prejudicial to the interests of its depositors, RBI said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ED to probe ABG Shipyard's directors in ₹22,842 cr fraud case: Reports
text: The ED will reportedly open a money-laundering probe against ABG Shipyard's erstwhile management and directors for allegedly diverting funds out of the total ₹22,842-crore fraud amount. ED is examining documents related to the case to map money-laundering trails, reports said. Earlier, CBI issued lookout circulars against the accused in India's biggest bank fraud case to prevent them from fleeing.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: UP RERA fines 9 real estate developers ₹1.40 cr over non-compliance
text: Uttar Pradesh Real Estate Regulatory Authority has imposed a penalty of ₹1.40 crore on nine real estate developers for not complying with its orders. RERA has asked promoters to submit the compliance report within 15 days and deposit the penalty amount within 30 days. Failing to do so, the sum shall be recovered as arrears of land revenue, RERA warned.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt releases draft MSME policy, outlines 8 action areas
text: MSME Ministry has released the draft National Policy for MSMEs in India and has proposed eight "specific action areas" to ensure the sector's rapid growth. The action areas include linking MSMEs with transport infrastructure for improved cross-border trade, creation of two sets of MSME database with different verticals and a focused institution to encourage technology upgradation, R&D projects.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LIC sees decline in policy issuance due to COVID-19 pandemic
text: LIC said that the total number of individual and group policies has witnessed a decline due to the COVID-19 pandemic. According to the DRHP filed by LIC, the total number of individual and group policies issued in India decreased by 16.76% to 62.43 million for fiscal 2020 and it further decreased by 15.84% to 52.54 million for fiscal 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: China courts freeze $157 mn of Evergrande assets over missed payments
text: A Chinese court has ordered the freezing of Evergrande Group assets worth $101 million, according to a filing by Shanghai Construction Group. Last week, a Guangzhou court had frozen $57 million assets of a different Evergrande unit. Many suppliers and contractors have launched legal actions against Evergrande, which is having liabilities of over $300 billion, over missed or late payments.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Salary increments in India to touch 5-yr high of 9.9% in 2022: Survey
text: Salary increments in India will touch a five-year high of 9.9% in 2022 as organisations are planning to invest in new-age capabilities, as per Aon's 26th Salary Increase Survey. The study analysed data across 1,500 companies from more than 40 industries. E-commerce and venture capital, hitech/IT and IT enabled services (ITeS) are industries with the highest projected salary increases.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: UK's inflation rises to 5.5% in January, highest since 1992
text: The United Kingdom's Consumer Price Index reached its highest levels since March 1992 at 5.5% in January. It edged up from 5.4% in December and raised probability that the Bank of England (BoE) may raise its main interest rate for the third time in a row. The BoE has forecast Britain's annual inflation rate to peak at 7.25% in April.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India and UAE complete talks on bilateral pact to boost trade
text: India and the United Arab Emirates (UAE) have completed negotiations for a Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) between the two countries, the Indian External Affairs Ministry said on Wednesday. It added that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi Sheikh Mohamed bin Zayed al Nahyan will hold a Virtual Summit on February 18 to discuss bilateral cooperation.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Punjab and Sind Bank to raise ₹4,600 cr by issuing shares to govt
text: The Punjab and Sind Bank on Thursday said its Board has given approval to raise ₹4,600 crore by issuing preference shares to the government. The Delhi-headquartered lender had posted a net profit of ₹301 crore in the October-December 2021 quarter. The Bank recorded a net loss of ₹2,376 crore in the same quarter a year ago.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: GAIL to connect Srinagar to gas grid; Mumbai-Nagpur line by May 2023
text: GAIL India plans to lay a pipeline to Srinagar via Jammu to take the environment-friendly natural gas to the Kashmir Valley, Chairman Manoj Jain said. By May 2023, GAIL will complete a 700-km pipeline from Mumbai to Nagpur. The company is on track to meet the target of mid-2022 for completing major portions of Urja Ganga project, he added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 27-yr-old Evan Luthra became millionaire at 17, set to become billionaire at 30
text: Delhi's 27-year-old entrepreneur Evan Luthra, who became a millionaire at the age of 17 after learning coding from YouTube, is set to become a billionaire by the time he hits 30, according to the New York Post. He built and invested in over 300 companies. "I was bitten by the 'digital bug' aged around 12," Luthra said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Chinese company Huawei's premises in India raided by Income Tax Dept: Reports
text: The Income Tax Department conducted raids at Chinese company Huawei's premises in Delhi, Gurugram and Bengaluru on Tuesday, according to multiple reports. The officials looked at financial documents, account books and company records as part of a tax evasion investigation against the company. Huawei has said that its operations in the country were "firmly compliant" with the law.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Fake news: Nilekani on post claiming he has launched crypto project
text: Nandan Nilekani, the billionaire Co-founder of Infosys, has clarified that he has not launched any cryptocurrency-based project. "You may have encountered a post on various social media platforms claiming that I have launched a crypto project. This is fake news," Nilekani tweeted. He further urged people to avoid clicking on the post and report it as misleading or false information.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Indians 'world's most spoilt customers', want discount even at lowest price: Ashneer
text: BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover during a conversation with Raj Shamani said, "Indian customers are the world's most spoilt customers." He said, "They want everything at the lowest price, in the smallest size and they want it now...And even after that, they want a discount." He added, "In the US, things are expensive in the city and cheaper in the outskirts."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bumped me off my paid seat: Man accuses IndiGo of succumbing to 'VIP pressure'
text: A Twitter user named Birender Dhanoa accused IndiGo of succumbing to "VIP pressure". "They bumped me off my paid seat because some former bureaucrat and "party" couldn't be anywhere except row 1," he tweeted. In another tweet, he claimed that another passenger encountered a similar situation, to which IndiGo replied, "We're sorry for the inconvenience...our team will get in touch."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Belgians allowed to request 4-day work week with no loss in salary
text: Belgian employees can now request to work four days a week instead of five without losing their salary, after Belgium's seven-party coalition federal government reached a deal on Tuesday. Employers will still have the right to turn down requests for a condensed work week, on the condition that they explain their refusal in writing, Deputy Prime Minister Pierre-Yves Dermagne said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I left Bihar with a tiffin & dreams in my eyes: Billionaire Agarwal on moving to Mumbai
text: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal tweeted that he's among millions of people who came to Mumbai "to try their luck". "I left Bihar with...a tiffin box, bedding, and dreams in my eyes. I arrived at Victoria Terminus station, and for the first time...saw a kaali peeli taxi...and the City of Dreams," he wrote. Agarwal urged youngsters to "work hard".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: There's no such thing as balancing work, family: Indra Nooyi in note for husband
text: Former PepsiCo CEO Indra Nooyi shared a note for her husband Raj Nooyi for Valentine's Day saying, "The truth is, there's no such thing as balancing work and family. It's a constant juggling act." "Our life partners...make this juggling possible," she added. Nooyi also shared that her husband often told her he's at the bottom of her priority list.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Just another day in the markets, not for faint-hearted: Mahindra on rollercoaster video
text: Sharing a video showing a rollercoaster ride, billionaire businessman Anand Mahindra wrote, "Just another day in the markets. Not for the faint-hearted." His tweet came as the Sensex ended 1,736 points higher on Tuesday, a day after it tanked around 1,747 points. The Indian benchmark indices nearly recouped Monday's losses to record their best day in over a year.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nilekani shows his phone's home screen, says 'No WhatsApp, only essential apps'
text: Nandan Nilekani, the billionaire Co-founder of Infosys, took to Twitter on Tuesday to share a picture of his smartphone's home screen. "No WhatsApp. No notification badges. Only essential apps," Nilekani tweeted. He also said that he prefers to control his digital life using multiple devices.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Cathie Wood's ARK buys Sea shares that lost $16 bn after India app ban
text: Cathie Wood's ARK Invest bought over 1,45,000 shares of Garena Free Fire game's owner Sea Ltd after it lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop. Sea closed 18% lower in New York on Monday after India banned its game Free Fire. India banned 54 apps on Monday, of which 'Garena Free Fire- Illuminate' was one.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Talent crunch is real: Wipro's Rishad Premji on tech industry
text: Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji took to Twitter to acknowledge the talent crunch in technology industry. "The technology industry in India now employs over 5 million people and added 450,000 new jobs this year...yet the talent crunch is real!" Premji wrote in a tweet quoting NASSCOM's annual strategic review. He further said this presents a great opportunity for new job creation.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla shares jump after CEO Musk discloses 21.2% stake in company
text: Shares of Tesla jumped nearly 5% on Tuesday after its billionaire CEO Elon Musk disclosed that he owns one-fifth of the electric carmaker. According to the SEC filing, Musk held 231 million shares of Tesla as of December 31, 2021, representing a shareholding of 21.2%. The stake is worth around $202 billion at Monday's closing price of $875.76 per share.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Make provisions in scrappage policy to boost vehicle purchase: Panel to govt
text: A Parliamentary Standing Committee has suggested the government to make provisions for "upfront financial incentives in the scrappage policy to boost demand for purchase of new vehicles". The proposed financial incentives would encourage end-users to discard their old and polluting vehicles and go in for the purchase of the new BS-VI compliant vehicles, the committee said in its report.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: East Delhi civic body extends property tax amnesty scheme till March 31
text: East Delhi Municipal Corporation (EDMC) has extended the last date for availing the amnesty scheme for payment of property tax to March 31. EDMC Mayor Shyam Sunder Aggarwal said that a 100% rebate on interest and penalty will be given on payment of outstanding property tax. This could be the last extension in the scheme, another EDMC official said.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: India's trade deficit touches $17.42 billion in January: Govt
text: India's trade deficit in January touched $17.42 billion, the Commerce Ministry data showed. The country's exports in January rose 25.28% to $34.50 billion compared to $27.54 billion in January 2021, while the imports rose to $51.93 billion in January from $42.03 billion last year. The rise in exports was due to good performance in the engineering, petroleum and jewellery sectors.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India's highway construction falls to 4-year low during April-Jan
text: India's highway construction fell to a four-year low of 22.2 km/day during April 2021-January 2022, the government data showed. India built highways at a pace of 30.4 km/day in the same period in FY21. The sharpest fall was recorded in January 2022 during which only 499 km highway stretches were constructed compared to 1,929 km in January 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: CBDT issues refunds worth over ₹1.71 lakh cr in 1.97 cr cases in FY22
text: The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) has issued refunds worth ₹1.71 lakh crore to over 1.97 crore taxpayers between April 1, 2021 and February 14, 2022. A total of ₹63,234 crore has been issued as income tax refunds in 1.95 crore individual cases. Corporate tax filed by companies accounted for 2.28 lakh cases and ₹1.08 lakh crore as refunds.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Initiate next gen reforms to improve ease of doing business: FM to SEBI
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Tuesday asked the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to initiate next generation reforms to improve India's ease of doing business. Further, she asked SEBI to "be prepared for the possible market turbulence on account of US Federal Reserve's actions". Sitharaman also appreciated the regulator's initiatives to strengthen investor protection.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions lists at 8% premium over IPO price
text: The shares of Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions got listed with an 8% premium over its IPO issue price of ₹866 per share on Wednesday. The stock got listed at ₹936 on the BSE and ₹935 on the NSE. The ₹3,149-crore IPO of Vedant Fashions, which was a complete offer for sale, was subscribed 2.57 times during February 4-8.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: SpiceJet reports ₹42.5 cr net profit after 7 consecutive quarterly losses
text: SpiceJet reported a consolidated net profit of ₹42.5 crore in the October-December quarter after reporting net losses in the past seven consecutive quarters. The airline's consolidated revenue rose 33.8% YoY from ₹1,692 crore to ₹2,263 crore. Earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization were down 52.4% YoY from ₹244.3 crore to ₹116.4 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Future Retail allowed by SC to approach HC to resume Reliance deal
text: The Supreme Court has allowed Future Retail to approach the Delhi High Court for seeking continuation of proceedings before the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT). Kishore Biyani-led Future Retail is seeking to resume the process of NCLT approval for its deal with Reliance. The Supreme Court had reserved its order on Future Group's plea earlier this month.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Jet fuel prices touch highest ever after a 5.2% price hike in Delhi
text: Jet fuel, or Aviation Turbine Fuel (ATF) prices reached their highest ever after a 5.2% price hike due to rise in international oil prices. ATF price was hiked by ₹4,481.63 to ₹90,519.79/kilolitre in Delhi, according to a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. The rate is higher than ₹71,028.26/kilolitre reached in August 2008 when international crude oil prices touched $147/barrel.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Oil prices drop from 7-year high amid reports of Russian troops' withdrawal
text: Oil prices fell over 3% from a seven-year high on Tuesday after Russia said some of its military units were returning after military exercises near Ukraine. Brent crude was down $2.87, or 3%, at $93.61/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude dropped $3.49, or 3.7%, to $91.97/barrel. Both oil benchmarks hit their highest since September 2014 on Monday.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SEBI makes separation of Chairperson and MD, CEO's role voluntary
text: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) on Tuesday said provision for separation of roles of a listed company's Chairperson and Managing Director or Chief Executive Officer is applicable on a "voluntary basis". The regulator had earlier mandated the separation of the role of Chairperson and MD/CEO of listed companies to be applicable from April 1, 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Zoho reports ₹1,918 cr profit, ₹5,230 cr revenue in FY21: Reports
text: Zoho reported a profit of ₹1,918 crore in FY21, a 139.5% YoY increase from ₹800.8 crore, Entrackr reported. Its operational revenue grew by 22.3% YoY from ₹4,274 crore in FY20 to ₹5,230 crore in FY21 while its employee benefit expenses rose 58.4% YoY to ₹1,725 crore. The United States continued to be Zoho's biggest market with a 42.7% share.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Lookout circular against ABG Shipyard Directors in India's biggest bank fraud case
text: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has issued a lookout circular against ABG Shipyard Directors in India's biggest bank fraud case to ensure they do not leave the country. The company allegedly cheated a consortium of banks led by the State Bank of India (SBI) of ₹22,842 crore. According to CBI's complaint, ABG Shipyard owes ₹7,089 crore to ICICI Bank.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's IT sector sees highest growth in a decade, adds 4.5 lakh new jobs in FY22
text: India's IT sector is set to become a $227 billion industry in 2021-22, registering a 15.5% growth, the highest in a decade, industry body NASSCOM said. NASSCOM President Debjani Ghosh termed it as a year of "resurgence". In its yearly strategic review, NASSCOM said the industry added 4.5 lakh new jobs, taking its overall direct employees to 50 lakh people.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Berkshire bought Activision's $1 bn worth shares before Microsoft takeover
text: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway bought nearly $1 billion of shares in Activision Blizzard before Microsoft agreed to acquire it for $68.7 billion, according to a regulatory filing. Berkshire said it owned 14.7 million shares worth about $975 million of Activision as of December 31. Microsoft's plan to buy Activision Blizzard, which is its largest-ever acquisition, was announced in January.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India's Free Fire app ban causes company behind the game to lose $16 billion
text: Garena Free Fire game's owner Sea Ltd lost over $16 billion in its biggest daily market value drop after India banned the game's app. 'Garena Free Fire - Illuminate' was one of the 54 apps banned by the government on Monday. "Sea is a Singaporean company and we aim to partner in India's digital economy mission," the company told Bloomberg.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Banning cryptocurrency most advisable choice open to India: RBI Deputy Governor
text: RBI's Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar at a recent event said that banning cryptocurrency is "perhaps the most advisable choice open to India". He added, "We have examined the arguments proffered by those advocating that cryptocurrencies should be regulated and found that none of them stand up to basic scrutiny."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk donates $5.7 billion of Tesla shares, one of the biggest to charity in history
text: World's richest person Elon Musk donated over 5 million shares of Tesla to charity from November 19-29, a regulatory filing has revealed. The shares were worth around $5.7 billion, making it one of the biggest to a charity in history, Bloomberg reported. In October, Musk said he'd donate $6 billion if UN can explain how that would solve world hunger.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Not justified to say crypto ban will cause losses: RBI's Deputy Governor
text: RBI's Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar termed the argument that banning cryptocurrencies would lead to a loss of wealth as "not justified". Giving three reasons, he said, "Investors can be provided with a reasonable exit". He added, "Cryptocurrency investors were fully aware of the risks," and "There's no data to justify the amount of investment or number of investors".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Paytm CEO's stake value falls below $1 billion as stock hits new low
text: The value of Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma's stake in the company has fallen below $1 billion after the share price dropped to a new record low on Tuesday. Paytm parent One 97 Communications' shares declined 2.7% during intraday trade to ₹840.05 on BSE. The value of Sharma's shares have eroded by over $1.5 billion since its listing in November.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Hiranandani Group to invest ₹3,500 cr in in-house platform Tez
text: Hiranandani Group plans to invest ₹3,500 crore in its in-house consumer tech platform Tez over the next 2-3 years. The platform will be launching this year at an initial outlay of about ₹1,000 crore. "We have a road map to launch two highly sought-after services in 2022, followed by another three in the next year," Hiranandani CEO said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Better.com's Zoom layoffs in US added 1,000 employees for the firm in India
text: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com's 900 layoffs, which took place over a Zoom call last year, effectively added 1,000 employees for the firm in India, a regulatory filing showed. The layoffs changed the geographic mix for Better.com, as per Bloomberg. On June 30, Better.com had 3,100 employees in lower-wage India, while on December 31, it had 4,100 employees in India.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Mamaearth's parent company Honasa Consumer acquires BBLUNT
text: Mamaearth's parent company Honasa Consumer Private Limited has acquired beauty brand BBLUNT. Godrej Consumer Products divested its entire stake in Bhabani Blunt Hair Dressing Private Limited, and the right to use the 'BBLUNT' brand name for products, and said it'll receive a total of ₹84.5 crore from the divestment. BBLUNT's salon business will continue to operate as an independent entity.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Zomato shares dip below IPO price for 1st time since listing in July
text: Shares of food delivery platform Zomato fell below the issue price of ₹76 for the first time since its listing in July 2021 on Tuesday. The stock hit a low of ₹75.75 during intraday trade on BSE, but recovered some of its losses. Zomato's shares hit an all-time high of ₹169.10 in November and have declined over 50% since then.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No wonder he was so loved: Sonia Gandhi in letter to Rahul Bajaj's son
text: Congress president Sonia Gandhi condoled Rahul Bajaj's demise in a letter to the late industrialist's son, Rajiv Bajaj. "The name Bajaj stood for quality that one could trust, for fairness and honesty," she wrote. "Your father, in a way, served as a moral compass for the world of Indian industry...No wonder he was so widely admired and loved," she added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Investors lose ₹8.5 lakh crore on Monday as Sensex logs worst fall in 10 months
text: Investors lost nearly ₹8.5 lakh crore on Monday as the Sensex crashed 1,747 points to close at 56,405. Data showed that investor wealth, measured by the combined market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies, fell to ₹255.42 lakh crore from ₹263.90 lakh crore. The Sensex witnessed its worst single-day fall in ten months as the Ukraine crisis triggered a global selloff.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex surges 1,736 points in best day in a year, nearly recoups Monday's losses
text: Indian benchmark indices logged their best day in over a year on Tuesday as Sensex jumped 1,736 points to end at 58,142. The Nifty 50 jumped 510 points to close at 17,352. The Sensex nearly recouped its losses from Monday as Russia-Ukraine geopolitical tensions eased. The Sensex had plunged 1,747 points in its worst fall in 10 months on Monday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex jumps 1,400 points a day after crashing 1,700 points
text: The Sensex jumped over 1,400 points to cross 57,800 during intraday trade on Tuesday, a day after it crashed over 1,700 points. The broader Nifty 50 also jumped over 400 points to trade above 17,200 levels. On Monday, the Indian benchmark indices logged their worst fall in 10 months amid global fears of a Russian invasion in Ukraine.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Monday's market crash wiped $4 billion off Gautam Adani's fortune
text: India's second richest person and Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani lost nearly $4 billion in net worth on Monday as his group's stocks plunged amid the market crash. His current net worth stands at $82.8 billion, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. No individual in the world lost more money than Adani on February 14, Moneycontrol reported.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Affordable vaccines saved over 30 million lives: Cyrus Poonawalla
text: While speaking at a felicitation ceremony in Pune on Monday, Chairman of the Serum Institute of India (SII) Cyrus Poonawalla said affordable vaccines like those produced by SII have saved more than 30 million lives across the world. "Our vaccines are low cost and of high value, this is the secret of our success," Poonawalla further said.
author: Nakul Ahuja

headlines: Vedanta to make semiconductors in India with iPhone maker Foxconn
text: Vedanta has signed a memorandum of understanding with Taiwan's Foxconn, which is known for making Apple's iPhones, to manufacture semiconductors in India. Foxconn will invest $118.7 million to set up a joint venture company with Vedanta and the latter will be a majority shareholder of the new venture. Vedanta's Anil Agarwal will be the Chairman of the joint venture.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Aditya Birla, Franklin Templeton invest in UAE's digital bank Zand
text: Aditya Birla Group and Franklin Templeton have invested in UAE-based digital bank Zand. Abu Dhabi's Al Hail Holding, Al Sayyah & Sons Investments, Global Development Group, Yusuff Ali of Lulu Group, and Zand co-founder Olivier Crespin also invested in the bank. Earlier in December, Zand shareholders completed the acquisition of the majority of shares in Dubai Bank from Emirates NBD.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Rolls-Royce's electric small plane may be out by 2025: Official
text: Rolls-Royce's fully-electric small aircraft with 8-18 seats will likely be ready in three to five years, the company's electrical division president Rob Watson said.
