The aircraft's range will keep improving with better battery technology and it may ''eventually be able to fly 400 km in the 2030s'', Watson added. Rolls-Royce manufactures engines for Airbus and Boeing aircraft.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Poor nations got SII's vaccines at price of a cup of tea: Cyrus Poonawalla
text: The Chairman of Serum Institute of India (SII), Cyrus Poonawalla, said that the vaccines manufactured by the company were made available to poor nations at a price of a "cup of tea". Two-thirds of the world population has been protected by one or more of SII's vaccines, he added. Over 170 countries worldwide use SII vaccines, Poonawalla further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Future Retail reports ₹1,063 cr net loss in Q3, 86.85% rise in revenue
text: Future Retail Limited (FRL) reported consolidated net loss of ₹1,063.36 crore in Q3 FY22 as compared with a net loss of ₹846.92 crore in Q3 FY21. The company's revenue in the October-December 2021 quarter jumped 86.85% YoY from ₹1,506.87 crore to ₹2,815.68 crore. FRL's total expenses rose 62.66% YoY from ₹2,391.43 crore to ₹3,890.02 crore in the reported quarter.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Cipla shares plunge after promoters sell 2.5% stake in block deal
text: Pharmaceutical giant Cipla's shares plunged over 3% on Tuesday as its promoters sold 2.5% stake to institutional investors through a block trade. Promoters Yusuf Khwaja Hamied and Mustafa Khwaja Hamied sold the stake to raise funds for personal purposes, Cipla said. Earlier, reports said the deal may fetch them ₹1,849 crore. The promoter group now holds 34.23% of the company.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Refund amount with interest to Sohna's Hilltown's buyers: NCDRC to Supertech
text: National Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission (NCDRC) directed Supertech to refund entire paid-up amount to home buyers of Hilltown Project in Sohna (Haryana) within six weeks. The refund will include interest at a rate of 9% per annum. The order follows Supertech's failure to pay pre-EMIs since 2018 under its subvention scheme and its failure to deliver the project's possession.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Centre cuts agri-cess on crude palm oil to 5% to check price rise
text: The Centre has reduced the agri-cess for crude palm oil from 7.5% to 5% with effect from February 12. This move will benefit the domestic edible oil refiners and also check prices of cooking oils, the government said. ''After reduction of the agri-cess, the import tax gap between CPO and Refined Palm Oil has increased to 8.25%,'' the government informed.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Coal India net profit jumps 48% in Q3; firm declares 2nd dividend
text: Coal India has reported a 47.7% rise in consolidated net profit to ₹4,558.4 crore for the October-December quarter compared to net profit of ₹3,085 crore in the year-ago period. The company's consolidated revenue from operations rose 20% to ₹28,434 crore from ₹23,686 crore in Q3 of FY21. Coal India's board approved a second interim dividend of ₹5 per share.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: LIC files draft papers with SEBI to seek approval for India's biggest IPO
text: State-run Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) on Sunday filed the Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) with capital markets regulator SEBI for an initial public offering (IPO). The IPO is expected to be the country's largest public issue. The LIC will offload over 31.62 crore shares of face value ₹10 each, according to the draft prospectus.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 13-yr-old girl gets ₹50 lakh funding on Shark Tank for her anti-bullying app
text: A Class 8 girl became the youngest contestant to pitch her entrepreneurial idea for an anti-bullying app at Shark Tank India. A student of Pathways School Gurugram, 13-year-old Anoushka Jolly received funding of ₹50 lakh for her app 'KAVACH', which lets students and parents report incidents of bullying anonymously, thereby allowing concerned authorities to intervene in the matter.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: What is the ₹22,842 cr ABG Shipyard case, biggest bank fraud registered by CBI?
text: The CBI in its biggest bank fraud case booked Mumbai-based ABG Shipyard, its directors and ex-Chairman Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal for allegedly defrauding 28 banks, including SBI, of ₹22,842 crore. The company's loan account became an NPA in 2013. An E&Y forensic audit report in 2019 identified fraud and attributed it to diversion of funds, misappropriation and criminal breach of trust.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Retail inflation rises to 7-month-high of 6.01% in January 2022
text: The retail inflation accelerated to a seven-month-high of 6.01% in January 2022, breaching the 6% upper limit of the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) tolerance band, government data showed on Monday. The retail inflation was 5.66% in the preceding month of December. Earlier, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that inflation close to 6% should not create any panic.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex crashes over 1,700 points to close at 56,405 in worst fall in 10 months
text: The Sensex fell 1,747 points on Monday to end at 56,405 while the Nifty plunged 531 points to close below the 16,900 level, at 16,842. This is the worst fall that the benchmark indices have seen in 10 months. This comes as fears of a possible invasion of Russia in Ukraine triggered a global selloff.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tatas appoint Ilker Ayci as CEO and MD of Air India
text: Former Turkish Airlines Chairman Ilker Ayci has been appointed as the CEO and Managing Director of Air India, a release by Tata Sons said on Monday. This came after the Air India board met to consider Ayci's candidature, the release said, adding, "This appointment is subject to requisite regulatory approvals." Ayci said he's "delighted and honoured" to accept the appointment.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: All men die, not all men truly live: Rajiv Bajaj's WhatsApp status after father's demise
text: Bajaj Auto MD Rajiv Bajaj, the son of industrialist Rahul Bajaj, paid tribute to his father in a WhatsApp status that read, "All men die, not all men truly live," Moneycontrol reported. Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj passed away at the age of 83 on Saturday. He was cremated with full state honours in Pune on Sunday.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex crashes over 1,400 points, Nifty slips below 17,000
text: Indian equity benchmark Sensex fell by more than 1,400 points to around 56,732 and the Nifty slipped below the 17,000-mark. All the stocks were in the red zone on the Sensex-30 shares barring TCS. The BSE Midcap and Smallcap indices were also in red. ICICI Bank, SBI, Tata Steel and L&T shares tanked more than 3%.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Rahul Bajaj cremated with full state honours, sons Rajiv & Sanjiv perform last rites
text: Industrialist Rahul Bajaj, the late Chairman Emeritus of Bajaj Auto, was cremated with full state honours in Maharashtra's Pune on Sunday. The last rites of the Padma Bhushan-awardee, who passed away at 83 on Saturday, were performed by his sons Rajiv Bajaj and Sanjiv Bajaj. Rahul Bajaj breathed his last in a Pune hospital on Saturday due to illness.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who is Ilker Ayci, Air India's new MD and CEO?
text: Tata Sons appointed 51-year-old Ilker Ayci, the Istanbul-born ex-Chairman of Turkish Airlines, as Air India's MD and CEO. He's 1994 alumni of Bilkent University and after a research stay on political science at Leeds University in the UK in 1995, he completed an International Relations Master's program in Istanbul in 1997. Ilker resigned as Turkish Airlines Chairman in January 2022.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Big B recalls Air India ad from his college days as airline returns to Tata Group
text: Actor Amitabh Bachchan recalled an old Air India advertisement from his college days after the airline returned to the Tata Group. "I remember the banner ad, in the late 50's on a striking building in Connaught Place, New Delhi, that I'd pass by as I travelled to University," tweeted Bachchan. Quoting the advertisement, he added, "There's an air about India!"
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Govt, RBI working in complete harmony on crypto, other issues: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government and the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) are working in complete harmony on all matters including cryptocurrencies. "[We are] respecting each other's domain...There's no turfing here," the Finance Minister added. She further said that the RBI and the Ministry of Finance are onboard and discussions regarding cryptocurrencies are taking place.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 5G spectrum auction expected to be held in May: Telecom Secretary
text: Telecom Secretary K Rajaraman told PTI the 5G spectrum auction is expected to be held in May this year. "Telecom Regulatory Authority of India has indicated that they will send it (recommendations on rules regarding the sale process) by March," Rajaraman said. He added that it will take the department two months to start the auction after getting those recommendations.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt extends police modernisation scheme with ₹26,275 crore outlay
text: The Union Home Ministry has approved the continuation of the Modernisation of State Police Forces scheme for five years up to 2025-26 with an outlay of ₹26,275 crore. The Ministry said the scheme includes security-related expenditure in Jammu and Kashmir, northeastern states and Maoists-affected areas. The scheme also aims to raise new battalions and develop high-tech forensic labs.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: TVS Supply Chain files draft papers to raise funds via IPO
text: Chennai-based logistics firm TVS Supply Chain Solutions has filed a draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with the SEBI seeking approval to raise funds through an IPO. The offer comprises a fresh issue of ₹2,000 crore and an offer for sale of 5.94 crore shares. The company plans to use part of the IPO proceeds to repay some of its debt.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Only 5 of 15 MSME technology centres completed since 2015: Govt data
text: Only 5 out of 15 proposed MSME technology centres (TCs) have been completed in the last seven years, government data showed. The TCs were proposed under the Technology Centre Systems Programme (TCSP) and were due to be completed by 2020-21. Work at five TCs at Bhiwadi (Rajasthan), Pudi (Andhra Pradesh), Bhopal (Madhya Pradesh), Rohtak (Haryana) and Puducherry was completed.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Kalanithi Maran rejects SpiceJet's ₹600 crore settlement offer
text: SpiceJet's former promoter Kalanithi Maran and his firm KAL Airways have rejected the airline's one-time settlement offer of ₹600 crore to end the share-transfer dispute between the parties, the Supreme Court was informed on Monday. The settlement offer is not feasible as the total amount owed to Maran is around ₹920 crore, the lawyer representing Maran told the court.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Adani Wilmar's consolidated PAT rises 66% YoY to ₹211.4 cr in Q3
text: Adani Wilmar reported a 66% YoY rise in its consolidated profit after tax (PAT) to ₹211.4 crore in Q3. The company's revenue from operations grew 40% YoY from ₹10,229 crore in Q3 FY21 to ₹14,378.7 crore. The company's consolidated operating profit grew 35% YoY to ₹1,420 crore and its FMCG segment's sales rose 46% YoY rise to ₹704 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt likely to extend COVID-19 loan guarantee scheme for 6 months: Reports
text: The government is likely to extend the Loan Guarantee Scheme for COVID-19 Affected Sectors (LGSCAS) by another six months, Moneycontrol reported. The ₹50,000 crore scheme has allocated less than 5% of the scheme's funds since 2021. Under the scheme, scheduled commercial banks will provide credit with an interest rate capped at 7.95% per annum for healthcare sector projects.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LIC's embedded value set at ₹5.39 lakh crore
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) on Sunday filed the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI for an IPO. The draft papers revealed that LIC's embedded value stood at ₹5,39,686 crore as on September 30, 2021. The embedded value of a life insurance company represents the sum of present value of future profits and the net value of assets.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Import duty on crude palm oil cut to 5.5% to cool edible oil prices
text: Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs (CBIC) reduced the effective duty on crude palm oil import from 8.25% to 5.5%. CBIC aims to control cooking oil prices and support domestic processing companies with this move. Effective from Sunday, CBIC has cut agri infra development cess to 5% and extended reduced import duty on crude oils by six months.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: IL&FS group to resolve ₹55,000 crore debt by March 2022
text: Infrastructure Leasing & Financial Services (IL&FS) group would resolve debt of ₹55,000 crore by March 2022, the company's board stated in its affidavit filed before the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT). Led by Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak, the bank's board said the debt would be resolved through asset monetisation, restructuring and insolvency proceeding initiatives.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LIC reserves up to 10% of issue size for policyholders in its IPO
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) has decided to reserve a maximum of 10% and 5% of its IPO issue size of 31.6 crore shares for policyholders and employees respectively. The quantum of discount on the share price will be announced later. Policyholders who fail to update their PAN details by February 28 will not be eligible for this quota.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FPIs withdraw net ₹14,935 cr between Feb 1-11, turn sellers for 4th month
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew a net ₹14,935 crore between February 1 and February 11 and have been net sellers for the fourth consecutive month. As per data from depositories, FPIs took out ₹10,080 crore from equities and ₹4,830 crore from the debt segment. This comes after US retail inflation recorded its biggest rise in 40 years at 7.5%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: SBI expects to recover ₹8,000 cr from written-off accounts in FY22
text: State Bank of India (SBI) is expecting to recover around ₹8,000 crore from written-off accounts, including from National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) resolved cases, in FY22. During the October-December quarter, SBI recovered ₹1,500 crore while between April-December 2021, it recovered ₹5,600 crore, SBI said. The bank's non-performing assets dropped from 4.9% in Q2 FY22 to 4.5% in Q3 FY22.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Multidimensional approach key to achieve $1 tn exports by 2030: CII
text: A report by Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) said India needs to adopt a multidimensional approach to take the country's merchandise exports to $1 trillion by 2030. The CII report recommends finalising free trade agreements, attracting global firms and addressing domestic manufacturing issues to achieve the target. It added that India needs to integrate closely with global value chains.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Wholesale Price Index eases to 12.96% in January; food prices rise
text: Wholesale price-based inflation eased for the second consecutive month in January 2022 at 12.96% even as food prices soared, the government said on Monday. After remaining in double digits since April 2021, Wholesale Price Index in December 2021 stood at 13.56%. Inflation in food articles spiked to 10.33% in January 2022 from 9.56% in December 2021.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rahul Bajaj, former Chairman of Bajaj Group, passes away aged 83
text: Former Chairman of Bajaj Group and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj passed away on Saturday aged 83. "It is with deep sorrow that I inform you about the passing away of Shri Rahul Bajaj, husband of the late Rupa Bajaj and father of Rajiv/Deepa, Sanjiv/Shefali and Sunaina/Manish. He passed away...in the presence of his closest family members," Bajaj Group stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: IBM execs called older staff 'dinobabies', favoured millennials, emails reveal
text: IBM executives discussed how to force out older employees and called them "dinobabies" who should be made an "extinct species", Bloomberg reported quoting emails revealed in a court filing. The officials expressed frustration over the company having a much lower share of millennials in its workforce than a competitor. IBM is facing age bias complaints by former employees in US.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Piyush Goyal shares meme featuring Shark Tank's Anupam Mittal, he replies
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has shared a Shark Tank meme featuring Shaadi.com Founder Anupam Mittal to mock the Opposition. The minister informed that India added eight new unicorns in 40 days of 2022 and mocked the Opposition, saying it can't digest it. Reacting to the meme, Mittal tweeted, "Piyush Goyal [It] appears like India is finally very Modivated."
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: We have lost a visionary: Rahul Gandhi on Rahul Bajaj's demise
text: Former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi condoled the death of industrialist and former Chairman of Bajaj Group, Rahul Bajaj, on Saturday. "We have lost a visionary whose courage made us proud," he tweeted. Dr Purvez K Grant, Chairman of Ruby Hall Clinic, where Bajaj passed away, said, "He was under treatment for cardiac and lung-related problems for the last one month."
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: I once tried to raise money for BharatPe from Anupam, made a pitch to him twice: Ashneer
text: Shark Tank India judge Ashneer Grover, speaking on Figuring Out podcast, revealed he knew co-judge Anupam Mittal (Shaadi.com Founder) from back when he was raising investment for BharatPe. "I...once tried to raise money...from him. I got the money from elsewhere, so I never ended up taking his money...I had made a pitch to him not once but twice," said Ashneer.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: I've made multi-billion dollar businesses, it was possible due to honesty: Ashneer Grover
text: Speaking on Figuring Out podcast, BharatPe Co-founder Ashneer Grover spoke about his "brutal honesty". "I have to keep myself honest otherwise the market will kill you," he stated. "In the last fours years whatever businesses I've made, these are multi-billion dollar businesses and it was possible because there's some level of honesty with yourself and with...your stakeholders," Ashneer added.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Deora shares old pic of late Rahul Bajaj, calls him 'most outspoken industrialist'
text: After former Bajaj Group Chairman Rahul Bajaj's demise, Congress' Milind Deora tweeted an old image of the industrialist and wrote, "Hard to come to grips with the news that India's most outspoken industrialist, Rahul Bajaj is no more." "Many of us knew of Rahul uncle's health was deteriorating but the news of his passing comes as a shock," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Bajaj was a successful entrepreneur, instrumental in the industry: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari took to Twitter to express his "heartfelt tributes" to Rahul Bajaj, the former Chairman of Bajaj Auto, who passed away aged 83 on Saturday. Calling Bajaj a "successful entrepreneur, philanthropist", Gadkari said he has had a personal relationship with the Padma Bhushan awardee for many years. "Rahul ji...has been instrumental in the industry," he further wrote.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Rahul Bajaj's death leaves a void in the world of industry: President Kovind
text: President Ram Nath Kovind condoled the demise of industrialist and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj and said he was a "doyen of Indian industry". He added, "His career reflected the rise and innate strength of the nation's corporate sector. His death leaves a void in the world of industry." Bajaj's funeral will be held with full state honours in Maharashtra.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: No visits to duty-free, wear minimum jewellery: Air India in new cabin crew advisory
text: Air India on Sunday issued a new advisory for its cabin crew in a bid to improve the airlines’ performance. The new advisory asked the cabin crew to wear minimum jewellery "to avoid any delays at customs and security checks." It also asked them to not visit duty-free shops and to proceed to the gates after security checks.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Industrialist Rahul Bajaj's funeral to be held with full state honours in Maharashtra
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday announced that former Bajaj Group Chairman and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj's funeral will be held with full state honours. The industrialist died aged 83 on Saturday, with the Bajaj Group stating that he passed away in the presence of his closest family members.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: He was a great conversationalist, pained by his demise: PM on Rahul Bajaj
text: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday condoled the death of ex-Bajaj Group Chairman Rahul Bajaj and said, "[He] will be remembered for his noteworthy contributions to the world of commerce and industry." He added, "Beyond business, he was passionate about community service and was a great conversationalist. Pained by his demise." Bajaj will be accorded a state funeral in Maharashtra.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bajrang Dal stage protests, put posters at KFC, Hyundai, Kia showrooms in Guj
text: Several Bajrang Dal members staged protests at outlets and showrooms of KFC, Pizza Hut, Hyundai and Kia in Gujarat days after their Pakistani distributors' posts on Kashmir. Hundreds of posters reading 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' were also put up at the outlets. "Kashmir, including PoK, is an integral part of India," the posters read.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: India has lost a great son, nation builder: Mazumdar-Shaw on Bajaj's demise
text: Condoling the demise of industrialist Rahul Bajaj, Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw tweeted, "I am devastated - he was a dear, dear friend and will miss him dearly." She further wrote, "The country has lost a great son and nation builder." Bajaj, who had resigned as the Chairman of Bajaj Auto last year, passed away aged 83 on Saturday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Thanks for letting me clamber up onto your broad shoulders: Mahindra on Rahul Bajaj
text: After industrialist Rahul Bajaj's demise, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "'I stand on the shoulders of giants.' Thank you, Rahulbhai, for letting me clamber up onto your broad shoulders, advising me, cheering me on, encouraging me to be bold." "Your footprints on the sands of Indian Business will never be extinguished," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: SEBI bars Anil Ambani, others from securities market for 3 months
text: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has barred Anil Ambani and three associates from securities market for alleged siphoning of funds from Reliance Home Finance (RHFL). They have also been restrained from associating with any listed company, stock market intermediary or any public company that intends to raise money.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna took advice from unknown 'yogi' on key decisions: SEBI
text: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, who's been fined ₹3 crore for violating securities contract rules, was guided by an unknown Himalayan 'yogi' she had never met, SEBI said. Ramkrishna consulted him for employee appointments, appraisals and shared NSE data with him, SEBI said. She told SEBI he was a "spiritual force that could manifest itself anywhere...didn't have any physical...co-ordinates".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: ABG Shipyard booked for cheating banks of ₹23,000cr in CBI's biggest bank fraud
text: In the biggest bank fraud case ever registered by the CBI, the agency has booked ABG Shipyard and its former MD Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal among others, for allegedly cheating 28 banks of ₹22,842 crore. As per the complaint filed by the State Bank of India, the company owes ₹2,925 crore to it and ₹7,089 crore to ICICI Bank.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Spine of Indian business cracks: Harsh Goenka on Rahul Bajaj's demise
text: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka described the demise of industrialist and Padma Bhushan awardee Rahul Bajaj as the cracking of the "spine" of Indian business. "A close family friend, he was a visionary, straight talking and very respected for his value systems," he said. "He leaves behind the two most capable sons in Indian industry, Rajiv and Sanjiv," Goenka added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: No e-comm firm has been found guilty of predatory pricing yet: MoS
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has received certain complaints against e-commerce companies alleging predatory pricing but it has not found any company guilty so far, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry, Som Parkash, said. "Imposition of unfair or discriminatory prices...by a dominant enterprise or group is prohibited under provisions of...Competition Act, 2002," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's tea exports decline to 175 mn kg in first 11 months of 2021
text: India's tea exports came down to 175.38 million kg in the first 11 months of 2021 compared to 189.83 million kg in the corresponding period in 2020, the Tea Board said. The decline in exports is due to shortage of containers, high ocean freight and less offtake by the 'lucrative' Iran market due to payment issues, as per industry experts.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: IRCTC to fully resume cooked meals service in trains from Feb 14
text: IRCTC will resume serving cooked meals on all trains, starting February 14. The services were stopped in March 2020 due to COVID-19 pandemic. In January this year, IRCTC had resumed serving cooked meals in 80% of its trains and is now expanding the resumption across the board. The services are being completely restored amid decline in COVID-19 cases, IRCTC said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Noel Tata joins two main Tata trusts as trustee: Reports
text: Noel Tata has been reportedly inducted as a trustee on the board of Sir Dorabji Tata Trust and Allied Trusts which are the two main Tata Trusts controlling the Tata Sons. The move happened last week as part of the succession planning exercise, The Economic Times reported. Noel stepped down from all executive roles at Tata Group in November 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Make December AGM results public  or face action: SEBI to Dish TV
text: SEBI has asked Dish TV to ''immediately'' disclose the voting results of its December 30 annual general meeting. In its advisory, dated February 9, SEBI said, ''the disclosure has already been delayed by 37 days'' and warned the company that further delay would result in initiation of regulatory action. Dish TV is already fighting a legal battle with Yes Bank.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: NSE, its 2 former CEOs fined ₹7 cr by SEBI over lapses in hiring
text: SEBI has penalised the National Stock Exchange (NSE), its former CEOs Chitra Ramkrishna and Ravi Narain, and two other officials. They allegedly violated the securities contract rules related to the appointment of Anand Subramanian as Group Operating Officer and adviser to the Managing Director. While Ramkrishna was fined ₹3 crore, NSE and Narain were fined ₹2 crore each by SEBI.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Rahul Bajaj was under treatment for cardiac, lung-related problems: Doctor
text: Industrialist Rahul Bajaj, who passed away aged 83 on Saturday, was under treatment for cardiac and lung-related problems at Ruby Hall Clinic in Pune for the last one month, the hospital's managing trustee Dr Purvez Grant told ANI. His condition had deteriorated in the last few days, Grant told Indian Express. Bajaj's funeral will be held on Sunday in Maharashtra.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Rahul Bajaj was a rare businessman who spoke truth to power: Kotak
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO Uday Kotak took to Twitter to condole the demise of former Bajaj Auto Chairman Rahul Bajaj and called him "bold and fearless". Kotak wrote, "A rare businessman who spoke truth to power. A proud Indian. Built world-class enterprise." The industrialist is survived by two sons, Rajiv Bajaj and Sanjiv Bajaj, and a daughter Sunaina Kejriwal.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Show the world your Kotak Fan Card: Kotak Mahindra Bank
text: With the arrival of the new season of T20, Kotak Mahindra Bank aims to bring a new way of celebrating cricket through its #KonaKonaCricket campaign. The key objective of the campaign is to encourage cricket fans to show the world how much they love and support their favorite teams through their fan card with Kotak MyTeam Debit and Credit card.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Not doing anything to legalise or ban crypto at this stage: FM on 30% tax
text: Speaking in Rajya Sabha, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said that many people asked if the government is legitimising cryptocurrencies after it announced a 30% tax on income from 'virtual digital assets'. "We have taxed the profit emanating from the transactions. I am not doing anything to legalise it or ban it...at this stage," she clarified during a debate on Budget.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: McDonald's files trademarks for virtual restaurant featuring home delivery
text: McDonald's has filed trademarks with the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) to open a virtual restaurant that will deliver food online and in-person. The filings aim to trademark "operating a virtual restaurant featuring actual and virtual goods" and home delivery. The company has also trademarked providing entertainment services, including "online actual and virtual concerts".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla sued over 'racial segregation' claims at factory by California
text: Tesla has been sued by California's civil rights regulator after it received complaints from hundreds of workers and "found evidence that Tesla's Fremont factory is a racially segregated workplace". Black workers are subjected to racial slurs, drawings and are assigned the most physically demanding jobs, the regulator said. Tesla earlier said it was expecting the lawsuit and called it "misguided".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ambani, Adani should be worshipped as they create jobs: BJP MP
text: During a parliamentary debate over unemployment, BJP MP and former Union Minister KJ Alphons said, "Be it Reliance, be it Ambani, be it Adani, be it anybody, they must be worshipped. Yes, because they provide jobs." He added that every industrialist who creates money in India creates jobs and they need to be respected.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Tata, Hyundai among 20 companies selected by govt for automobile PLI scheme
text: Centre has released a list of 20 companies approved under 'Champion OEM Incentive Scheme' of the Production Linked Incentive (PLI) Scheme for automobile and auto component industry. Ashok Leyland Limited, Ford India Private Limited, Hyundai Motor India Limited, Mahindra & Mahindra Ltd, Suzuki Motor Gujarat Private Limited, Tata Motors Limited, Bajaj Auto Limited are among the selected applicants.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Amul's ad features Shark Tank's Ashneer & contestant he rejected; Ashneer replies
text: Amul's latest topical has featured Shark Tank India judges Ashneer Grover and Ghazal Alagh and contestant Niti Singhal who failed to secure an investment after presenting her convertible and reversible clothes. Grover told Singhal on the show, "I don't think anyone will wear this." Responding to Amul's cartoon, which had the catchphrase 'Yeh sabko digest hota hai', Grover said, "Honoured!"
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Very happy Chandrasekaran's tenure has been extended, he deserves it: Murthy
text: Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy said he is "very happy" that N Chandrasekaran has been reappointed as the Executive Chairman of Tata Sons for another five years. "Chandrasekaran is a highly respected and successful corporate leader in India. His tenure at both TCS and Tata Sons has been very lustrous...He richly deserves it," Narayana Murthy told Moneycontrol in an email.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Sons re-appoints N Chandrasekaran as Chairman for another 5 years
text: Tata Sons' board has unanimously approved the reappointment of N Chandrasekaran as Executive Chairman for another five years. The company's Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata expressed his satisfaction on the progress of Tata Group under Chandrasekaran's leadership and recommended his term be renewed. "I'm delighted at the opportunity to lead Tata Group for another five years," Chandrasekaran said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Twitter users share memes after US' inflation hits a 40-year high
text: After US' retail inflation hit a 40-year high, Twitter users shared memes and jokes about it. US Representative Lee Zeldin wrote, "Last time inflation was this high I was 2 years old...learning how to do my first sit-up." One user shared a meme calling US senators "professional looters". US President Joe Biden said, "We'll make it through this challenge."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I've tried to convince Tesla India head to set up plant in India: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari told News18 that he had an interaction with Tesla's India head a few days back and tried to convince him to set up a plant in the country. "Tesla is welcome in India, we don't have any problem...We have all ancillaries available, you can get quality production...good sales here...If you start here, you're welcome," Gadkari said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Billionaire Soros buys Amazon-backed EV startup Rivian shares for $2 bn
text: Billionaire investor George Soros bought nearly 20 million shares of Amazon-backed EV startup Rivian in the December-quarter, filings revealed. The shares were worth about $2 billion at the time. Rivian, which is 20% owned by Amazon, is yet to produce a consumer vehicle. Shares of Rivian fell 9% on Friday and are down 43% for the year to date.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Ford considering producing electric vehicles in India for export
text: Ford told Reuters it is exploring the possibility of using a plant in India to produce electric vehicles (EVs) for export. In September 2021, Ford announced it would cease local manufacturing in India, citing an operating loss of $2 billion over the past 10 years. The US-based automaker may also consider selling electric cars in India, its spokesman said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's internet economy likely to reach $1 trillion by 2030: Report
text: India's internet economy is surging by over 50% year over year and may reach $1 trillion by 2030, a report by consulting firm RedSeer said. The internet economy includes sectors like e-tailing, e-health, food tech, online mobility and quick commerce. ''In just 2021, more than $40 billion of funding and 42 new unicorns were born,'' RedSeer CEO Anil Kumar said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Dyson accused of profiting from unlawful conditions at supplier firm
text: Ten former workers of Malaysian firm ATA IMS, Dyson's parts supplier, have claimed Dyson "unjustly" benefitted from "unlawful" and "exploitative" conditions at ATA's factory. "These allegations relate to employees of ATA...If proceedings were to be issued we would robustly defend them," Dyson said. It added that it takes its responsibilities towards workers of suppliers "extremely seriously".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Passenger vehicle wholesales dip 8% in January amid chip shortage
text: The passenger vehicle dispatches from factories to dealers in India dropped 8% in January, mainly due to chip shortage, auto industry body SIAM said. The total passenger vehicle wholesales dropped to 2,54,287 units in January 2022 as compared to 2,76,554 units in January 2021. Two-wheeler dispatches declined 21% to 11,28,293 units from 14,29,928 units in the year-ago period.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Stellantis recalling 20,000 plug-in minivans for fire risks
text: Chrysler-parent Stellantis is recalling nearly 20,000 plug-in hybrid minivans and has urged owners to stop recharging them and park them away from structures and other vehicles, after reports of 12 fires in parked vehicles. It will be recalling 16,741 vehicles in the US, 2,317 in Canada and another 750 outside North America. The recall covers 2017-2018 Chrysler Pacifica Hybrid vehicles.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Freshworks reports 44% rise in total revenue at $105 mn in Q4
text: US-headquartered software-as-a-service (SaaS) company Freshworks said its total revenue surged 44% for the quarter ended December 31 to touch $105.5 million. It reported a loss of $56.4 million, from $3.4 million loss it reported in the year-ago period. Freshworks said it expects total revenue of $107.0 million-$109.0 million for the first quarter of 2022.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: I don't check my house's price every day: CEO on Freshworks share price
text: Speaking about the decline in Freshworks' share price since its IPO, CEO Girish Mathrubootham told Moneycontrol, "I am not looking at the price of my house every day when I wake up." Stating that "stock market is something that we cannot control", he said, "Markets will go up, markets will go down, and...over the long term, things will automatically self-correct."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Gautam Adani's son meets CM Mamata, discusses investment plans: Report
text: Billionaire Gautam Adani's son Karan Adani met West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and discussed possible investments in the state, a top government official told PTI. The development comes two months before West Bengal's annual global business summit. The duo reportedly had discussions regarding the construction of the proposed deep-sea port at Tajpur. In December, Gautam Adani had also met Banerjee.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Bank of Baroda to acquire Union Bank's 21% stake in IndiaFirst Life
text: Bank of Baroda has announced acquisition of a 21% stake of Union Bank of India in IndiaFirst Life Insurance. However, the valuation of the deal was not disclosed by the bank. On completion of the acquisition, BoB will hold a 65% stake in IndiaFirst Life, Union Bank will hold 9% and Carmel Point Investments India will have the remaining 26%.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Walmart allows vaccinated US workers to go mask-free
text: Walmart on Friday informed its staff that fully vaccinated workers in the United States will no longer be required to wear masks in the company's facilities unless required by a state or local mandate. The company further said, workers who work in clinical care settings or with direct customer contact, will be required to wear masks, regardless of vaccination status.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Ruchi Soya to launch ₹4,300-crore FPO in last week of Feb: Report
text: Ruchi Soya is likely to launch its follow-on public offer (FPO) in the last week of February to raise up to ₹4,300 crore, PTI reported. It had received SEBI's approval to raise funds through an FPO in August last year. Ruchi Soya is launching the FPO to meet SEBI's norm of minimum public shareholding of 25% in a listed entity.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Investor Ruchir Sharma joins Rockefeller Capital as Chairman
text: US-based financial advisory firm Rockefeller Capital Management has roped in Indian investor Ruchir Sharma as the Chairman of its international business. Sharma, who is Morgan Stanley Investment Management's former Chief Global Strategist, will act as an advisor to the firm. He will also form an investment company, Breakout Capital, in partnership with Rockefeller, CEO Gregory Fleming said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India's industrial output growth falls to 10-month low in December
text: India's industrial production growth fell to a 10-month low of 0.4% in December 2021, according to data released by the government on Friday. The Index of Industrial Production (IIP) rose 0.4% in December 2021 as compared to an increase of 1.3% in November. As per use-based classification, capital, consumer durables and consumer non-durables saw their output shrink in December 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sensex falls 773 points to close at 58,153; Nifty ends below 17,400
text: The Sensex fell over 773 points on Friday to close at 58,153, while the Nifty 50 slumped 231 points to end at 17,375. The Indian benchmark indices fell amid weak global cues, after US' 40-year-high inflation fuelled fears of aggressive rate hikes. Grasim Industries, Tech Mahindra, Infosys, HCL Technologies and UPL were the top Nifty laggards.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions fixes issue price at ₹866/share for IPO
text: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions has fixed the issue price at ₹866 per share which is also the upper end of the price band of its IPO. The price band was ₹824-₹866 per share. The company fetched ₹3,149.19 crore through its IPO by receiving bids for over 6.53 crore shares against the total issue size of over 2.54 crore shares.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Indian crypto exchange CoinDCX crosses 1 crore-user mark
text: India's first crypto unicorn, CoinDCX which claims to be the nation's safest crypto exchange, announced that it now has 1 crore+ users. The brand states that this milestone follows CoinDCX's growth since its inception, adding that, this is a firm step towards the company's vision to provide safe, secure, and easy access to digital assets to 5 crore Indian users.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Why worry? Make it an NFT: Mahindra as bored guard draws eyes on painting worth crores
text: After a 'bored' security guard drew eyes on a painting insured for ₹7.4 crore in Russia, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra reacted to the news article by saying, "Why worry? Just convert the new 'creation' into an NFT!" Anna Leporskaya's Three Figures was painted between 1932 and 1934 and was part of an abstract art exhibition.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Crypto is a threat to financial stability; value not even a tulip: RBI Governor
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das cautioned cryptocurrency investors by saying, "Keep in mind that...cryptocurrencies have no underlying (value). Not even a tulip." They're a threat to our "macroeconomic and financial stability", he added. Notably, the 'tulip mania' of 17th century is cited as an example of a financial bubble, where the price of something rises rapidly, outpacing its true value.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Digital rupee will be exactly like normal rupee, except it'll be on phone: RBI
text: RBI Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar explained that digital rupee, which will be launched in 2022-23, will be "exactly like normal rupee". "It will be 1-to-1 convertible...Like normal rupee is kept in your purse or pocket, the digital rupee will be...in your cellphone device," he said. Governor Shaktikanta Das said RBI can't give a timeline on its release yet.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Binance, led by world's richest crypto billionaire, to invest $200 million in Forbes
text: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance has said that it's making a $200 million strategic investment in the 104-year-old news publisher Forbes. Binance is led by world's richest crypto billionaire, CEO Changpeng Zhao, who has a fortune of $82.6 billion, as per Bloomberg. "Our investment...is to help them build Web3 infrastructure," Zhao said, adding that Forbes' editorial independence is "sacrosanct".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Everything is back as normal now: Airtel after brief outage of internet services
text: Airtel on Friday restored its internet services after it suffered a "brief disruption". "We deeply regret the inconvenience this may have caused you...Everything is back as normal now, as our teams keep working to deliver a seamless experience," Airtel tweeted. Several users across India complained that Airtel's mobile internet and broadband services and Thanks app weren't working.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Business won't get affected by allegations, trust the board: BharatPe CEO to staff
text: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer has told employees in a letter that the allegations against the company won't have any bearing on "medium to long term health of the business". "I would just request all of you to keep your trust on the board of BharatPe," he said. This comes amid tensions between Co-founder Ashneer Grover and BharatPe's board.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Zomato shares fall 6% day after it reports loss of ₹63.2 cr in Q3
text: Zomato shares on Friday fell 6% to around ₹88, a day after it reported a consolidated loss of ₹63.2 crore in the October-December quarter. The firm's consolidated net loss narrowed from a net loss of ₹352.6 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations rose 82.7% year-on-year from ₹609.4 crore to ₹1,112 crore.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Ratan Tata gets custom-made electric Nano car; pic surfaces
text: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata has received a custom-built electric Nano from Electra EV. Founded by Ratan Tata himself, Electra EV offers EV powertrain solutions to Tata Motors and various other automakers. "It is a moment of truth for team Electra EV when our Founder takes a ride in the custom-built 72V Nano EV," Electra EV wrote on LinkedIn.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Pic shows India's first pilot's licence earned by JRD Tata in 1929
text: A post shared by Tata Group shows India's first pilot's licence earned by JRD Tata. "On February 10, 1929, JRD 'Jeh' Tata earned the first commercial aviator's certificate in India...setting...stage for the...dream of giving wings to the nation," the post read. "Jeh not only set up India's first airline...but also went on to pilot its inaugural flight," it said.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: What does RBI Governor's 'not even a tulip' remark on cryptocurrencies mean?
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "Cryptocurrencies don't have any underlying, not even a tulip." He referred to the 'tulip mania' of 17th century in Holland, a speculative market bubble followed by a subsequent crash. Speculation drove the price of tulips to all-time-highs, around $750,000 at its peak in today's value, before the demand suddenly ended and prices hit staggering lows.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Thums Up becomes a billion-dollar brand in India
text: Thums Up became a billion-dollar brand in India in 2021, "driven by focussed marketing and execution plans", The Coca-Cola Company Chairman James Quincey said during an earnings call. Launched in 1977 by Ramesh Chauhan of Parle, the brand was acquired by Coca-Cola in 1993. For the full year, Coca-Cola reported 17% growth in net revenue, driven by China and India.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Kerala businessman gifts Mercedes-Benz to employee of 22 years, says 'we're partners'
text: A Kerala businessman, who owns the digital retail store MyG, gifted a Mercedes-Benz GLA 220D to the company's chief business development officer, who's been working with him for 22 years. "We're partners, he [CR Anish] isn't an employee. I'm very happy. It's a proud moment," AK Shaji said. "Hope you loved your new cruising partner," the businessman wrote on Instagram.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensodyne, Naaptol asked to discontinue 'misleading' ads; Naaptol fined ₹10 lakh
text: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has ordered GlaxoSmithKline Consumer Healthcare to discontinue advertisements of Sensodyne toothpaste in India. The ads showing dentists practicing outside India endorsing the products qualify as "misleading", CCPA said. It also asked Naaptol Online Shopping to discontinue misleading ads like 'Magnetic Knee Support' and imposed a ₹10-lakh penalty.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: World catches a cold when US sneezes, not this time please: Kotak on 40-yr high inflation
text: After US' retail inflation hit a 40-year high, billionaire banker Uday Kotak said, "7.5% inflation and 0% interest rates! You'd think it's an emerging market with poor institutional governance. It's the...USA!" "When US sneezes, world catches a cold. Not this time please, Mr USA," Kotak wrote. "In 2013, India paid the price for its taper tantrum," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Reliance Industries to invest ₹50 crore in EV tech firm Altigreen
text: Reliance Industries (RIL) on Thursday announced that it will invest ₹50.16 crore in Bengaluru-based Altigreen Propulsion Labs. However, RIL did not disclose the percentage of equity to be acquired. Incorporated on February 8, 2013, Altigreen provides electric vehicle technology and solutions for commercial last-mile transportation. It had a turnover of ₹103.82 lakh in 2020-21.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: PB Fintech Founders to reduce 2.4% stake via $140-mn block deal
text: PB Fintech Founders Yashish Dahiya and Alok Bansal will be selling shares worth 2.4% of their stake in a block deal worth $130-140 million, filings revealed. Dahiya will be selling up to 70 lakh shares, while Bansal will sell 38.9 lakh shares. The founders' cumulative stake will reduce to 8.01% on a fully diluted basis from 10.33% currently.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Zomato reports loss of ₹63.2 cr in Q3, revenue up 83% to ₹1,112 cr
text: Zomato on Thursday reported a consolidated loss of ₹63.2 crore in the October-December quarter. Its revenue from operations rose 82.7% YoY from ₹609.4 crore in Q3 FY21 to ₹1,112 crore in Q3 FY22. Zomato reported that its gross order value grew 84.5% YoY and 1.7% QoQ to ₹5,500 crore while the number of orders it received grew 93% YoY.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 44 unicorns added between 2020 & 2021 showcase India's innovation: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Thursday that 44 unicorns have been identified in India between 2020 and 2021. "They have created wealth. They showcase India's talent and innovation," Sitharaman said while replying on the Union Budget 2022 in the Lok Sabha. As of January 14, 2022, India had 83 unicorns, with a total valuation of $277.77 billion.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Focused on building sustainable business: Nykaa Founder after Q3 profit slump
text: As shares of Nykaa fell by 7.5% on Thursday, Founder and CEO Falguni Nayar said that she's focused on building a long-term sustainable business with an eye on profitability. Nykaa is "investing for the future" and has seen an increase in user base, she added. On Wednesday, Nykaa reported a 59.5% decline in its net profit for the October-December quarter.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: SC gives last chance to Mallya to defend in contempt case on Feb 24
text: The Supreme Court on Thursday adjourned a contempt case against fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya for February 24, while granting him the last opportunity to appear before it personally or through counsel. The court said if Mallya fails to do so, it will take the case to a logical conclusion. The court had sought his presence before it on various occasions.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Phoenix Mills to open 5 malls by 2025 at a cost of ₹5,300 crore
text: Retail mall developer Phoenix Mills (PML) is planning to open an additional five malls with around 6 million square feet of retail space at a cost of around ₹5,300 crore, MD Shishir Shrivastava said. Mall of Asia in Bengaluru, which will have around 1.2 million square feet of retail space, will be among the largest malls in India, Shrivastava added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Mahindra and Mahindra reports 155% YoY rise in net profit to ₹1,353 cr in Q3
text: Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) on Thursday reported a 154.88% YoY rise in its standalone net profit from ₹530.86 crore in Q3 FY21 to ₹1,353.07 crore in Q3 FY22. The company's revenue from operations in the October-December quarter stood at ₹15,238.82 crore, marking an 8.41% YoY rise from ₹14,056.54 crore. M&M's consolidated profit rose 57% YoY to ₹1,987 crore in Q3.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Swiggy's net operating revenue drops 26.5% YoY to ₹2,547 cr in FY21
text: Swiggy's parent company Bundl Technologies reported a 26.5% YoY drop in its net operating revenue from ₹3,468 crore in FY20 to ₹2,547 crore in FY21. The company reported a net loss of ₹1,314 crore in FY21, a 65% YoY decrease, while its total expenses stood at ₹3,310 crore. Swiggy's employee benefit expense stood at ₹935 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RIL completes acquisition of 40% stake in Sterling & Wilson Renewable
text: Reliance Industries (RIL) has completed the acquisition of a 40% stake in Shapoorji Pallonji Group's Sterling & Wilson Renewable Energy (SWREL) for ₹2,845 crore, the company said. In October 2021, Reliance had announced two acquisitions, one was to buy Norway's REC Solar Holdings for $771 million and the other was for 40% stake in SWREL in a multi-stage transaction.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: US retail inflation increases 7.5% YoY, biggest rise in 40 years
text: Retail inflation in the United States rose 7.5%, the biggest YoY rise since February 1982, the US Labour Department reported on Thursday. The Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased 0.6% in both December and January after increasing 0.7% in November and 0.9% in October. Increase in the indices for food, electricity, and shelter were the largest contributors to CPI's overall increase.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Govt likely to sell 5% stake, not issue fresh stock in LIC's IPO: Reports
text: The government is considering selling about 5% stake in Life Insurance Corporation of India's (LIC) IPO, Bloomberg Quint reported. The government plans to offer 316 million shares of the 6.32 billion shares it owns in LIC and the company is unlikely to issue fresh stock. LIC's embedded value is estimated to be about ₹5 trillion.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at 4% for 10th time in a row
text: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on Thursday kept the repo rate unchanged at a record low of 4% for the 10th consecutive time. The reverse repo rate also remains unchanged at 3.35%. The reverse repo rate is the rate at which RBI borrows money from banks. "Accommodative stance" will continue as long as needed, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 25-yr-old employee's death sparks overwork, '996' work culture debate in China
text: A 25-year-old content moderator working for Chinese video site Bilibili died from cerebral haemorrhage, sparking the debate on China's '996' work culture, where employees work from 9 am-9 pm, six days a week. The employee's death prompted accusations that Bilibili was overworking its staff. Bilibili denied the employee died from overwork, but said it would hire 1,000 new content moderators.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 'Empire' of fake Gucci, Chanel, LV items being run on Facebook, Instagram: Research
text: Meta is struggling to stop a "burgeoning empire" of counterfeiters pushing fake luxury goods impersonating brands like Gucci, Chanel, Dior & Louis Vuitton across Facebook and Instagram, a research found. About 65% of accounts selling fake items were China-based. Counterfeiters took advantage of WhatsApp's product catalogues feature available via app's 'business profile' to market such products.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Retail inflation projected at 4.5% in 2022-23: RBI
text: The RBI on Thursday retained its estimate for retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), for 2021-22 at 5.3% and projected inflation for 2022-23 at 4.5%. The RBI expects retail inflation to be at 4.9% in the first quarter of 2022-23, 5% in the second, 4% in the third and 4.2% in the fourth.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Cap on e-RUPI payment voucher hiked to ₹1 lakh, can be used more than once
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has announced that the cap on e-RUPI, which is a prepaid digital voucher, will be enhanced from ₹10,000 to ₹1 lakh. The vouchers, issued by the Centre or state governments, will be allowed for use more than once, until the balance is fully used. This will further facilitate delivery of government schemes to beneficiaries, Das said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's real GDP growth projected at 7.8% in 2022-23: RBI
text: While announcing the RBI's monetary policy, Governor Shaktikanta Das projected India's GDP growth at 7.8% in 2022-23. India is expected to grow at 17.2% in the first quarter, 7% in the second quarter, 4.3% in the third and 4.5% in the fourth, he said. Real GDP growth at 9.2% for 2021-22 is modestly above growth level of 2019-20, Das added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: What are the key takeaways from RBI's Monetary Policy announcement?
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das announced that the Monetary Policy Committee is keeping repo rate and reverse repo rate unchanged at 4% and 3.35%, respectively. The MPC projected GDP growth for 2022-23 at 7.8% and retail inflation at 4.5%. RBI hiked cap on e-RUPI voucher to ₹1 lakh and extended on-tap liquidity scheme for healthcare, contact intensive sector till June 30.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI Governor Das quotes Lata Mangeshkar's song 'Aaj Phir Jeene Ki Tamanna Hai' in speech
text: During the first Monetary Policy Committee address of 2022, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das quoted late singer Lata Mangeshkar's song 'Aaj Phir Jeene Ki Tamanna Hai'. "Together with the spirit behind the next line of this...song, she conveyed an eternal message of optimism," he said. Das stated it while talking about how COVID-19 pandemic has taught us to not lose optimism.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Government has no business to do business: PM Narendra Modi
text: PM Narendra Modi in an interview with ANI said, "Government has no business to do business." He explained, "Its job is to think about food for the poor, make houses and toilets, get them clean drinking water, make health facilities available to them, make roads, and think about small farmers." He added, "If somebody calls this socialism, I accept it."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Quess Corp shares tank 11% after report says CEO Suraj Moraje may step down
text: Shares of India's largest staffing firm Quess Corp tanked over 11% during intraday trade on Thursday after a report said that CEO Suraj Moraje will likely step down. Moraje's exit is likely due to differences in strategy between him and Quess promoter Ajit Isaac, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. He was appointed the group's CEO in November 2019.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India gets $339.55 billion FDI in the last 5 years, govt shares year-wise details
text: During the last five financial years, Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) inflows worth $339.55 billion have been reported into India, the government said on Wednesday. "FDI inflows have shown a continuous increase from $45.15 billion in 2014-15 to $81.97 billion in 2020-21," it added. The government also mentioned investor-friendly policies allowing 100% FDI in most sectors under the Automatic route.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Taxpayers can update income tax returns only once in an assessment year: CBDT
text: A taxpayer would be permitted to file only one updated return for an assessment year, CBDT Chairman JB Mohapatra said on Wednesday. He said the intent of the provision is to help people who have genuinely missed out on filing their returns. Budget 2022-23 permitted taxpayers to update their returns within two years of filing, subject to payment of taxes.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Why has a Chinese city's lockdown sent aluminium prices to 14-year high?
text: The COVID-19 lockdown in China's Baise city sent global prices of aluminium to a 14-year high. Baise was locked down on Monday after mass testing identified nearly 100 people with COVID-19. Nicknamed the "aluminium capital of southern China", Baise produces about 2.2 million tonnes of aluminium per year, but the production was impacted due to travel restrictions hindering logistics flows.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: LIC likely to file papers for India's biggest-ever IPO tomorrow: Report
text: Life Insurance Corporation of India is reportedly expected to file its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with market regulator SEBI on February 11 (tomorrow). The Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority (IRDAI) cleared the LIC IPO proposal in a board meeting on February 9,  CNBC-TV18 reported citing sources. LIC's IPO is likely to be India's largest-ever public issue.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Mukesh Ambani overtakes Gautam Adani to become Asia's richest person again
text: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani has become Asia's richest person again, a day after Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani's net worth surpassed his, according to Bloomberg Billionaires Index. As of Tuesday, Ambani's net worth stood at $89.2 billion, while that of Adani's fell to $86.3 billion. Adani has gained $9.8 billion so far this year, Bloomberg data showed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Adani Wilmar shares jump 65% over its IPO price in 3 days
text: Adani Wilmar, which became the seventh Adani Group company to be listed, is now among the top 100 most-valuable publicly traded firms in India, Moneycontrol reported. Its shares have surged more than 65% over its IPO price of ₹230 apiece in three sessions, taking its market value to nearly ₹50,000 crore. On Thursday, the stock hit a 20% upper circuit.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nykaa reports 59.5% YoY fall in net profits to ₹27.9 crore in Q3
text: Nykaa on Wednesday reported a 59.5% YoY decline in its net profits to ₹27.9 crore in the October-December quarter against ₹69 crore in Q3 FY21. The e-commerce company's consolidated revenue from operations jumped 36% YoY to ₹1,098.4 crore in the reported quarter. Nykaa's employee costs jumped 56% YoY while finance costs in the quarter increased 71.5% YoY.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI extends on-tap liquidity scheme for contact intensive sectors till June 30
text: The RBI has extended the on-tap liquidity facilities of ₹50,000 crore and ₹15,000 crore for emergency health services and contact intensive service sectors, respectively, from March 31 till June 30. This has been done on account of "continued uncertainties brought on by the third wave", RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said. Banks get certain incentives for lending under the two schemes.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Manyavar owner's IPO subscribed 2.57 times on final day
text: Manyavar owner Vedant Fashions' IPO, which opened for subscription on February 4, got subscribed 2.57 times on its final day, BSE data showed. The IPO received bids for over 6.53 crore shares against the total issue size of over 2.54 crore shares. Its retail portion was subscribed 0.39 times. The company had raised nearly ₹945 crore from anchor investors.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Sensex ends 657 points higher, Nifty at 17,463 ahead of RBI monetary policy
text: The Sensex closed 657 points higher at 58,466, while the Nifty 50 index ended 197 points higher at 17,463 on Wednesday, a day before RBI's monetary policy announcement. Both the indices extended gains for the second consecutive session. The gains were led by automobile and banking stocks. Coal India, Maruti Suzuki India, Indian Oil and Hindalco were among top gainers.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Supertech's twin tower in Noida to be demolished by May 22
text: The Supertech's 40-storey twin towers located in Noida Sector 93A will be demolished by May 22 in accordance with the Supreme Court orders, said Noida authority officials. A final road map for the process was readied on Wednesday and almost all NOCs have been issued except from the police, the officials added. Edifice Engineering will carry out the demolition process.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Open to some tinkering in capital gains tax regime: Revenue Secy
text: Addressing a CII event, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said, the current capital gains tax structure is "too complicated" in terms of varied rates and period of holding across the assets. "We need to rework the capital gains structure for rates, holding period. We would be open to some tinkering in it the next time we get an opportunity," Bajaj added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: DB Realty to issue 50 mn convertible warrants to Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, others
text: Real estate company DB Realty has said that it will issue 50 million convertible warrants to non-promoter investors such as Rakesh Jhunjhunwala's RARE Enterprises, Rekha Jhunjhunwala, KIFS Dealers and others. The stock hit a 5% upper circuit on Wednesday after the news. The preferential issue comes days after Godrej Properties withdrew its proposed investment of ₹400 crore for 10% stake.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RBI to hike VRR cap for foreign investors to ₹2.5 lakh cr from April 1
text: The RBI will hike the limit for investments under Voluntary Retention Route to ₹2.5 lakh crore from ₹1.5 lakh crore from April 1. "This'll provide access to additional sources of capital for the domestic debt market including g-secs," Governor Shaktikanta Das said. The scheme was introduced in March 2019 to facilitate long-term investment by foreign portfolio investors in debt securities.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Adani Wilmar shares surge 20% a day after its market debut
text: Shares of newly listed Adani Wilmar extended gains for the second session, surging 20% to hit its upper circuit on Wednesday. The stock closed at ₹321.90 on NSE and ₹318.20 on BSE. The FMCG company's stock made a subdued debut on Tuesday by listing at a discount of 4% over its IPO issue price, but closed around 16% higher.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: SIPs in mutual fund industry cross 5 crore mark for 1st time in Jan
text: Systematic Investment Plans (SIPs) in the mutual fund industry crossed the five crore mark for the first time in January this year. The industry added 14 lakh new SIPs in January, according to Association of Mutual Funds in India's data. The contribution of SIPs to the mutual fund industry in January stood at ₹11,516 crore.
author: Ashley Paul
